reviews.review:
it has been almost a year since my birthday dinner NIGHTMARE...LOL luckily we try to laugh about the nightmare that occurred and vow not to ever repeat it again

it was me, hubby, and two other couples and I'm soooooo embarrassed about this meal I could freak out...I had this "great idea" to hang Downtown and eat at V&A's that night instead of our usual Cosmo spots...

first we had made reservations weeks before and still waited over an hour for our table, meanwhile at the tiny bar area we all stood dressed up with no chairs...the bar and waitstaff KNEW we were waiting and just kept our drinks flowing and flowing

by the time we got to our poorly lit table where we had to shout at each other to talk (sooooo sooooo loud) and people bumping into the backs of all our chairs all night made it horrible...

anyway, to this day we can not remember anything other than it took 1.5 hours for our food to come out of the kitchen...meanwhile they kept the bar drinks flowing...

what we do have to remember is "Birthday Broccoli" it's a series of photos that we each took a photo with a !!!MASSIVE!!! full head of broccoli that came on my plate...

are you kidding? how embarrassing!

during the hours and hundreds of dollars $x,xxx that was wasted in this funny place these events also happened:

-constant interruption of waiters, our own cocktail waiter (not kidding) and all standing by just doing nothing

-asking for our salad or app courses over an hour after we ordered then getting the "we ARE busy" 

-one person in my party had their plate served to them MINUS their steak...yep...

-they actually served a crab cake to someone that did not order it, left it at the table then later came and got it and gave it to the table next to us...

-pitches of water were over-poured literally poured over glasses flowing onto the table (guess they could not see either, too dark)

-waiters tripped into our table a few times making it embarrassing and messy  

-baskets of bread were continuously sat all over the table during the hour and a half wait for the food

-a baked potato was served STONE COLD and half cooked

-the list could go on forever...ONE STAR EXPERIENCE, but they get TWO STARS for not charging us for 70% of the alcohol that was drank 

as another birthday comes upon me...the idea of "having a different birthday Downtown" does not come to mind... :) :) :) :)

a guess another horrible thing about that night was how stinky, old, dirty the extra large suite we booked there was (this is a different ball of YELP wax)...reaking old cigars and smelly socks we grabbed our stuff and went back home

AMAZING. 

This is the best restaurant I have EVER eaten in my whole life. 

This restaurant is located in Downtown Vegas in the Golden Nugget hotel. Compared to other restaurants I have seen in Vegas this one is a bit smaller, which isn't a bad thing because it provided a more intimate/romantic feeling to it. The staff was amazing and on top of everything. The only thing I did not like about this restaurant was the bathroom. It was located outside the restaurant in the casino. Seemed a little out of the way to me. 

The Food. 
Appetizer 1: Oyster Rockefeller http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vic-and-anthonys-steakhouse-las-vegas-2?filter_by_userid=True&select=gPS8SUN9C0iTjZdP_qVKOQ&userid=to5QXyxyI84QCR9JJMXrSw#R8SdoBWP1QGfsTU_oMhfiw
This was my first time trying oyster Rockefeller. It tasted amazing! This was a great way to start our dinner. It also came with half a dozen. 

Appetizer 2: Steak Tartare  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/vic-and-anthonys-steakhouse-las-vegas-2?filter_by_userid=True&select=gPS8SUN9C0iTjZdP_qVKOQ&userid=to5QXyxyI84QCR9JJMXrSw#XidOHOant3N9loHPOzgivA
This app is served on a salt block (which was amazing because I have never had anything served on a salt block before, only seen it on iron chief) comes with chips, cornichons and whole grained mustard. TASTED AMAZING. I think everyone should try this.

Entrée 1: 8 oz. Filet Mignon 
I ordered this for dinner and added the Jumbo Lump Crab Oscar topping. Wow. It tasted great. 

Entrée 2: 16 oz. New York Sirloin 
My boyfriend ordered this for his entrée and he said it was amazing. 

Side: Mashed potato 
GOOD!

Overall, this restaurant was fantastic and everything tasted amazing. I will 100% recommend this place to all of my friends that go to Vegas :)

Okay, if you're a guest of the casino, Vic & Anthony's has one particular meal that you simply can't pass up.  It's an Australian lobster tail they fly in and it is gooooood.  The reason I mention guest of the casino is because while I love an awesome lobster, this particular one is outside the range of what I'd pay for a single meal; it's I think around $120 to $130, and that's before you order drinks, apps, sides, etc. If Golden Nugget is picking up your bills though, oh mama, you better order this monster.  It's very close to a pound, post-cooked weight, so you could probably even split it if you wanted.  It's an unusual taste, kind of sweet, so completely different than what you'd get from a Maine lobster tail.  I had it twice on my last visit, saved half and turned it into breakfast the next day; simply fantastic.

As far as everything else goes; I've always been very pleased with the food and drinks here.  The place is very dimly lit but still has enough light to see some of the old Vegas memorabilia on the walls; lots of photos from days gone by.  The service has been excellent every time I've visited.  They, along with Golden Nugget, are also very accommodating to guests of the casino, so if you're a last minute kind of person, and they are full, ask your casino host to get you in and it will happen; love the service from them and Golden Nugget.

Their caprese salad is excellent; large fresh crisp tomatoes and big blocks of mozzarella with just the right amount of balsamic vinegar and basil.  Steaks; fresh and always cooked perfectly.  Their servers, and more importantly their cooks, understand how to cook a steak Pittsburgh style so don't hesitate to order it that way if that's how you like it.  Even the sides are excellent; cream corn, onion rings, etc.

There are a million steak houses in Vegas, and this is probably my number three option; good enough to go out of your way for.  Just as a point of reference, my #1 is N9NE at the Palms; their surf & turf is simply the best meal I've ever had, so it will be very hard for anywhere else to ever displace them.

Same awesome food and great service as you find at other V&As. This is a group that knows how to pick and cook a steak. It seems appropriate it is not on the strip and located in downtown Vegas. Cheers.

The filet mignon was among the five best steaks of my life. My wife had the best seabass she's ever eaten.  The atmosphere is romantic but not stuffy or overly formal.  The service is good (thanks Dennis) the drinks are reasonably priced ($6 beer) and the entrees fetch standard steakhouse prices of around $40 for a steak. 

The sides are nice but the creamed spinach could more accurately be described as cheese with a bit of spinach. The pear salad was amazing and the potatoes Lyonnaise were great too. 

I'm a steak lover and the filet was really outatanding. It had a nice flavor as if it had been seasoned or marinated, but the taste complemented rather than overpowered the meat. The filet wasn't so heavy that I felt like I was biting into a cow.   I would dine here again in a heartbeat.

Came here for our 7 year anniversary. Our waiter Jim was just lovely and the food was exceptional. The chilled seafood appetizer had the most amazing oysters and my filet was perfect as was my fiancée's ribeye. The au gratin potatoes were as decadent as grandmas. Jim brought us bread pudding dessert made from cinnamon croissants that topped an absolutely perfect meal. Lovely ambience, Sinatra in the background. Love love love this place.

When you walk in to speak with the host you see a nice display of steak and lobster which starts your appatite. The ribeye was cooked perfectly and the waiters were decent. Best steak house off the strip.. great selection of wine

On everything that doesn't involve the food this place gets a 5. Nice decor and a very professional wait staff. Great wine list as well. It's very pricey but not outrageously so considering where you are and what you expect to get.

Now onto the food. Which is what really matters when separating a steak house from a really great steakhouse.

We started out with the calamari with peppers. It was good, interesting flavor with a touch of heat. We also had the chips and strings which are exactly that. Homemade potato chips and onion string served with ketchup. Nothing special that would make me get it again.

The specials include a 27oz dry aged "Cowboy" ribeye steak for $149. Considering that the 16 oz ribeye was $48 we didn't bite. Dry aged steak is great but not at those prices and the big bone , the cowboy part, is nothing more than a gimmick adds nothing to the food.

The sides we ordered included the brussel sprouts, wild mushrooms, baked potato and mashed potatoes.  All tasty and overpriced but while in a "premium" steakhouse not unusual.

Now for the steak. I ordered the prime ribeye. Cooked exactly as I ordered it, so kudos to the cook. Unfortunately I've had a better piece of meat from Costco. It was not seasoned very well, if at all. The meat itself was tender but not what you would expect from a prime steak.  

My wife had the lobster mac and cheese which she liked. The lobster tail is lightly breaded and fried. The cheese sauce was light and tasty. A good entree.

Overall not bad but there is certainly better places to spend your money for a premium steak.

Just had the best steak I've had in at least a decade tonight. We had drunks before we got here which I should've slowed down on but once we got out food, I was just blown away. And to make things worse I was so toasted I forgot to take pics. Damnit. Haha. Next it's dinner before the drinks. My dinner date had so much wine she's passed out next to me. This place was money well spent and we'll definitely be back sooner than later. Our waiter Jim? was excellent. Best lamb cutlets I've had since Australia. Next time no scotch since it doesn't mix well with lobster bisque. Anyhow, if you want great food downtown on the old strip off Fremont, this is a small place but you'll enjoy it. 5 full steins from me..

This place is the real deal. Located inside the Golden Nugget it is the quintessential steak house. We had a delicious foie gras appetizer that wasn't on the menu followed by Maine lobster and a lovely rib eye. All of it was superb and I am very fussy about such things. The service was knowledgeable and professional. 

I have to drop a star because they charge $10 for a baked potato. I expected this place to be expensive and it certainly was but I think that's ridiculous. They also allowed a large group of tourists to come in and stand by my table which was like being in a fish tank. That was undesirable.

I like this place the steaks are solid..the sides are the usual fare...the lobster mac n cheese is over hyped but not horrible ($38)....the service is also pretty solid depending upon how busy they are. I like to play at the nugget so its pretty convenient. The mood is dark and old schoolish except for the flat screens over the bar..kinda odd..but i don't really mind it just don't ever remember seeing it before. The lobster tails are from fukushima nuclear plant....I have never seen them so big....serious 3 eye action there. All and all pretty solid..but not the best.

Very nice, upscale dining experience... classy, but not stuffy.  Waitstaff was friendly, prompt, and efficient.  Everything we had was excellent, try the beet salad or the heirloom tomato panzanella, the filet  (medium) was 'melt in your mouth' good.  They know how to make a perfect Manhattan - Bulleit Rye, with a twist, up. We dined upstairs in the quiet, small, dining room.

This was an amazingly delicious restaurant. Our server was excellent, just wished I remembered her name to post it. Every part of the meal was 5 stars and worth the price. The Golden Nugget was also really cool to walk around afterwards. We plan on visiting this restaurant again the next time we are in town.

This is one of my favorite steak houses. The dark wood, Dean Martin playing, upscale ambiance that matches the service , quality of the food and experience. Been here several times and have never been disappointed! Can't wait till next time I'm in town to run to you...#vicandanthonys, #vegassteakhouse

I really need to rate it more than 5!!! Without a doubt the best steak house in Las Vegas! Not just Fremont or Downtown, Anywhere! Nothing on the strip or off the strip can compare to this place. You MUST check it out. As you walk in from the time you leave, First Class all the way. The hostess is very professional, the bartenders are all top notch, my server was outstanding and the ambiance was perfect for Las Vegas. We enjoyed Salmon and Crab legs with a bottle of the bubbly. A perfect and romantic evening for my wife and I to enjoy a delicious dinner while listing to the rat pack and actually see photos of the Golden Nugget back in the day is truly remarkable. I WILL BE BACK!

Vic & Anthony's is located inside the Golden Nugget right next to the lobby/check-in counters.  Compared to the other restaurants in this hotel it is very discreet and kind of hard to find on the bustling casino level, but there are several signs directing you which way to go and plenty of employees who could do the same.

The first time I went was on a Saturday at about 7pm, and it was very busy. I was by myself and looking for a restaurant with a nice bar area where I could have a drink and a nice dinner alone, without feeling too on display.  Though at full capacity in the dining area, the hostess took me immediately to the bar area where there were a few empty spots and I was seated promptly, a pleasant surprise.  The bar area is fantastic, classy, comfortable, and removed from the dining area enough to feel a more comfortable/casual atmosphere, yet close enough to feel an elegant and intimate vibe.

Though the bar was busy on both occasions, I was immediately acknowledged and given a dinner menu and wine list.  After debating over what drink to order, I was greeted by the sommelier, Brian, who was very educated and passionate about the wines offered.  It was an added treat to talk to someone familiar with the Washington wineries I have so often visited. Despite his extensive knowledge and expertise on the subject, he explained the selections very clearly and in a way that did not overwhelm me and or seem pretentious, as sommeliers so often tend to be.  It was very refreshing and his suggestions were excellent.  The wine was definitely a highlight of my vacation.

The lead bartender both nights, Noah, was hands down the best I have ever come across. It was very fun to watch him make drinks all night. Friendly, efficient, and masterfully trained.  His cocktails were like works of art and so exciting to watch him create.  He also gave me suggestions on the dinner menu, all of which were perfection.  The first night I ordered the raw oysters as an appetizer, and they were wonderful.  There were 6 oysters served on the half shell on a bed of ice with fresh horseradish, tabasco, lemon, cocktail sauce, and mignonette as accompianments.  I am a big oyster fan, and these hit the spot.  This was followed by the wedge salad which was so good I ordered it again the following night. A heaping plate of creamy, tart roquefort cheese and crisp iceberg lettuce, it was the best I had ever had. And at $9 it was a steal! The following night Noah suggested the crabcake as an appetizer, which I was hesitant about because I have had so many bad ones, but trusted his judgement and went with it.  This was absolutely delicious. For dessert you must order the bread pudding.  I was told it was award winning, and was not disappointed.  I had this both nights as well, justifying this indulgence by telling myself I was on vacation and could eat whatever I wanted... No regrets.

If you are anywhere near the Las Vegas area, you must come here.  Could not recommend this place enough!

And you thought Downtown Las Vegas was a place for cheap drinks, thrills, gambling and titty bars.

This place rivals most of the fine dining places on the strip and the pricing is actually very reasonable for the caliber of food. The portions are very large and the service is very fast and friendly. The atmosphere is dark and very intimate though there are spots in the middle perfect for casual dining, if you take your significant other then make sure you get a table along the walls of the place for an even nicer experience.

I would recommend a good cut of steak, the veal or the big 25 oz rib eye is the way to go. Pair it with a Pinot Noir and the lobster bisque soup. If you are not a meat fan ( you really shouldnt go to this place then ) but seriously if you just are not feeling steak then i would definitely get the jumbo shrimp and crab cakes.

I would definitely recommend this place, it is also a great last minute nice place to eat just in case you forgot to make plans or need a place to impress with little or no time advance or reservations.
Great Steakhouse, perhaps the best in Vegas. We usually eat here when staying at The Golden Nugget. Top quality steaks and service.

Ruben and I celebrated our anniversary here a couple years ago and we had a wonderful experience. It's been a while for me, however, Ruben took his mother for her birthday last year since we enjoyed it so much and they had a great time! 

We started our meal with the Calamari with Sweet and Spicy Peppers ($13), Beefsteak Tomato & Onion Salad with Roquefort Cheese ($11), and Lobster Bisque, finished with Cognac ($11). I enjoyed the sweet and spicy sauce on the calamari and the bisque was delicious. The salad was good, but disappointingly scarce with three slices of tomato and four very thin slices of red onion.

Ruben and I both enjoyed an 8-ounce Filet Mignon ($39) with Wild Mushrooms ($11), Steamed Asparagus ($10), Macaroni & Cheese ($9), and Sea Salt Fries ($8) as our accompaniments. Their steaks are USDA Prime Midwest Grain-Fed and were perfectly prepared (medium rare) and really delicious. We were very pleased with all the side dishes as well.

Service was spectacular and we enjoyed a complimentary chocolate cake at the end of our dinner. Vic & Anthony's has been a highly recommended steakhouse choice for both of us and we will always love to return!

I recently found myself in Vegas on business and decided to head down town on my last night on a recommendation to try Vic & Antimony's. I had read a few reviews and was excited to enjoy some of their signature items.

When I arrived I was impressed with the decor, which I like to describe as 1977 meets 2007.  It's got dark woods and some cream colors with heavy curtains, that adorn large windows and decorated walls. Very tasteful.  I immediately noticed the glass display case featuring rib-eye, new york, and porterhouse cuts as well as LARGE (and i mean HUGE) Australian cold water tails that were 18-20oz EACH. They also house two lobster tanks with 3-4 pound lobsters which they offer at $29 per pound (which I think is a little high).

We were sat at a nice table in the center of the restaurant and ordered several items.  I did not opt for the lobster tails, as they are $145 each (not a bad price, but a little outside my range for the evening). Next time though I will bring my brother and split a 12oz filet and 20oz lobster.

To start, we got the Calamari, which is tossed in a onion-pepper sauce. The portion was large and included LOTS of really nice caramelized onions, however in my opinion the sauce was too thick and the rings should have been tossed in it instead of just placed on top. Also the breading on the rings was more crumb based and heavy. Would have been better with panko. Rings and tentacles were nicely cooked however, not stringy or rubbery.  $12.95 7/10

Next we received the Pear and Saga Blue Cheese Salad, mixed field greens with teardrop tomatoes, candied pecans and house-made creamy vinaigrette.  A really excellent salad.  The pears were nice and ripe, the pecans crunchy and fresh. There was quite a bit of avocado as well, just enough dressing which was sweet, tangy and slightly thickened. A nice compliment to the pear and cheese.  I would go back for this one again. 11.50. 10/10

Our third course was their famous lobster bisque. It's not an overly large portion, but what was lacking in quantity was more than made up for in quality.  I've had few better bisques.  Rich and creamy (but not overly so) this dish did NOT suffer from having too much sherry cream, but at the same time the sherry flavor was front and center but not overbearing. It's also finished with cognac, and that is easily tasted too.  Decent amount of lobster meat, intense (in a good way) lobster flavor. I could eat it non-stop! 10/10 A STEAL at $9.95.

Main Course was the Sea Bas ala Nage.  They use Chilean Sea Bass as the protein, sauteed in a Dunginess crab butter sauce, balsamic, harcourt verts, roasted tomatoes and topped with a few lumps of dungeness crab.  I've eaten a lot of chilean sea bass in my day, it's probably my favorite protein. This ranks in the top 2 for sure.  Wonderfully cooked, perfect crust on the fish, perfectly accompanied by the butter sauce, nicely cut by the sharpness of the balsamic. Verts were al dente, and nicely cooked. The mound of roasted tomatoes also helped cut the natural oiliness of the bass.  Melt in your mouth. A true triumph. $36.95 10/10

I also tried some of the 8oz filet, and it was beautifully done and seasoned. Rock salt in the preparation makes all the difference! I definitely would not hesitate to order cut beef at this restaurant if I was in the mood. They offer a number of sauces including a bone marrow borderlaise, which wasn't ordered, but I would love to try it in the future.  9/10

For desert we ordered their famous bread pudding, which is served like a layer cake slice in a pool of whiskey sauce alongside praline ice cream, and a brittle sculpture (edible).  Amazing.  Totally moist, amazing flavors. Everything you want out of a bread pudding without the sloppy look. Ice cream was divine.  I ate pretty much the entire brittle decoration which was killer good as well. 10/10 We also got a flour-less chocolate cake topped with unsweetened whipped cream and surrounded by chocolate sauce. VERY DENSE, very good.  Somehow not overbearing and dry-tasting like ones I have had at Ruth's Chris. Difficult to eat all of on your own. Split the chocolate if you get it. 9/10.

I also got earl grey tea, which I wouldn't normally mention, but it came in a very interesting tea pot of stainless and blown glass. Hard to explain but I thought it was neat.  If you're a tea drinker try it.  The tea itself was excellent as well.

All in all, this is one of my new favorite restaurants in Las Vegas and I will be returning as soon as I can for that massive Lobster!

It makes me a little sad to say it, but this place has declined a bit.  This past weekend we had our latest visit.  We've been there 3 or 4 times previously over the last 4-5 years.  The last time I was there in 2013, I had the best steak I've ever eaten (half of the porterhouse for 2), and this was in line with the quality of my previous visits as well.  This time, they missed that mark by a pretty wide margin.  Mind you, the steak was still excellent, but no longer outstanding, and below the quality of many other expensive, top-line steak houses.  They no longer offer the porterhouse for 2 - although they still have a porterhouse on the menu, and it is still plenty for 2 people (it is now 32 ounces, it used to be over 40, like I said, still plenty for 2 people, but you now have to split the order).  Anyway, the steak was expertly prepared as usual, but the t-bone half was tough.  I had encountered half a dozen pieces of unchewable gristle in the T-bone half.  The filet half was fine and tender, although both halves were not as flavorful as I remember.  It certainly didn't see 'prime' grade.  More like 'choice' grade.  Mind you, this steak comes in at nearly $90, so I think its justified that expectations for it be very high.  It made me wonder if with all the premium steak-houses opening across the country, it is just harder to these high-end places to get the same quality of meat as before.  On the other hand, a dining companion shared a bite of his NY Strip with me (half the price of the porterhouse -note, also 1/3 the weight), and it was absolutely perfect and delicious.  

Other things that have declined.  Our favorite appetizer, "chips and strings" (home-made potato chips mixed with fried onion strings) was half the size as before.  Mind you, it also was still plenty - but it was no longer (as a waiter described the previous version) "Las Vegas over-indulgence in excess".  Now its just plain over-indulgence.  But worse was that it didn't taste good.  it had a distinct 'old cooking oil' taste to it this time, which was unpleasant.  

Everything else was as before. The restaurant is elegant, the wait staff exemplary, the wine list contains many reasonable price range choices (as well as some highly unreasonable ones too, if that's you thing ;-).  But it will be hard to come back and pay the ultra-premium prices for a steak that is now a step closer to ordinary.

While I'm complaining, I'd like to add just one more thing.  While the PA music selection is nice and appropriate (Sinatra and similar), it has always been played too loud (this time and on all my previous visits).  It makes conversation at the table difficult, as you have to raise your voice to be heard over the music.  I wish they'd turn it down by half.
The service was great but the fillet was hard to cut with the knife.?? The sides were great and the drinks were ok.

food was great here!  Great art deco design. The service was interesting to say the least.  We walked into  the restaurant where we stood for 10 minutes without the hostess acknowleding we were standing there or even looked up. Our server came by several times to check to see how the food was or if we needed anything.  At one point he came by to make small talk that was painfully forced.  The busser was subpar...he came by several times to fill up water and spilled it all over my phone and didn't even notice even when I said something.

We ordered the foie gras apppetizer, lobster bisque soup, bone in prime ribeye, onion shoestrings, mac n cheese, and creamed spinach.

The appetizer and soup were okay, but the ribeye and sides are top notch.  The ribeye was cooked perfectly rare as requested. It was super tender and seasoned perfectly.  The onion shoestrings came out as a heaping pile of crispy salty perfection on a plate...enough for 4 people. The mac n cheese was creamy and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. the creamed spinach was loaded with cream and cheese and had a crumbly topping. All the sides were large enough for at least 2 people.

My only wish was that I had room for dessert...will definately save room next time for the creme brulee or the bread pudding!

This was our best meal in Vegas.  Service from Shaun was fantastic.  He was friendly, knowledgeable, and served us at just the right pace.  We even got to meet the Chef to tell him how great the meal was.  Wedge salad was beautiful and delicious, but the star of the show was the lobster tail.  It was more than enough for two of us to share and was cooked absolutely perfectly.  I don't remember having better lobster anywhere.  We also loved the au gratin potatoes-rich, cheesy, and delicious.

The old school vibe brought me back to what I imagine it was like in the old days of Vegas.  Very relaxing.  Vic and Anthony's knocked it out of the park!  Fantastic experience from beginning to end.  We will definitely return on our next trip.

I would go back to Vegas just for dinner at this place again! 5 star service on top of 5 star food and drinks makes Vic and Anthony's an unforgettable dining experience and a MUST while your visiting  Fremont street!

My high expectations were met with disappointment. The food was just okay for me. The meal was rather forgettable, nothing really stood out enough for me me to say "I'd order this again!"

The dinner service got off on a very rough start when they refused to seat our party of 11. They refused to seat us because 1 out of 11 of us was running late. ONE person out of 11......does that even make any f'kng sense?

The 2 doctors in our party tried repeatedly to request to the servers and even the manager, but they refused and kept us waiting at the small narrow bar area for almost 45 mins. Some of us got tipsy while waiting for our tables, while most of us just got agitated for having to wait so long. 

It would've been 35 min wait, but the manager seemed to be OCD or unsatisfied w/the table set-up so he made the staff move and rearrange our tables further down from the its original location. Tacking on additional wait time for us at the cramped bar. 

As I said earlier, the food was alright. Nothing spectacular, nothing memorable.

CHICKEN PAIGE ($26.95): 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=DFV2Zg8N6ZaECfizTAIddA
Scallopined/thinly cut chicken breasts lightly breaded and pan-fried in a lemon butter sauce. The menu also listed capers and sundried tomatoes cooked into the sauce, but I found cooked down regular tomatoes. No biggie. The portion size was generous and it was tasty. 

FRESH FISH A LA NAGE (halibut was the fish special that night, $36.95) 
The halibut filet was stuffed w/jumbo lump crab meat and served w/baby vegetables. 
I didn't get a chance to take a pic of it, but I was able to steal a couple fork-fulls. 

The under-seasoned halibut was unevenly cooked, some parts were dry and overcooked. 
I'm not so sure if the "a la nage" or poaching part was entirely true. 
Perhaps the poaching liquid or "nage" was just used to dress the fish after it's been cooked. 

JUMBO LUMP CRAB CAKES (1 crab cake for $19.95): 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=vMTQgbpbzaTeSUFUAhOp5A

Yes, you read that right. It's $19 for ONE crab cake. 
The crab cake was topped off with additional crab meat and a chive buerre blanc. 

For me, a good buerre blanc should be light and airy, yet rich and thick enough to coat whatever food it's drizzled on. 

This sauce was darker and more orange, I've never seen any buerre blanc (means "white butter" in French cooking) that dark before. It looked very similar to the sundried tomato sauce that was in my Chicken Paige dish. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=DFV2Zg8N6ZaECfizTAIddA#DFV2Zg8N6ZaECfizTAIddA

BROILED PORTABELLO MUSHROOMS W/RED WINE VINAIGRETTE ($9.95):
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=07F2D7XHPQxYjnyOYYg6zw
Dressed w/basil oil, fresh diced tomatoes and "fresh mozzarella." 
The mozzarella had no flavor and was a bit on the dry side. Some cubes crumbled very easily, almost like feta cheese. 

When I see "fresh mozzarella" on the menu, I'm expecting the cheese to have a higher moisture content, resulting in a more soft to semi-soft cheese. This was not the case. 

RAW OYSTERS (6 for $14.95):
Plump fresh oysters. 'Nuff said.

OYSTERS ROCKERFELLER (6 for $15.95):
Everyone raves about this dish, so of course we had to get a couple orders for our large party. It was okay. I got chopped herbs, bread crumbs and butter. I wasn't wowed by this dish. 

FRIED OYSTERS w/malt vinegar tartar sauce (6 for $11.95): 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=NwbMJiBs__-RuwiMIjRLLA
Out of the 3 oyster dishes, this was the one I was looking forward to. Like the raw oyster and oyster rockerfeller, these fried oysters were also plump and juicy. 

The crust (although very greasy) had a nice crunch to it, but that's where the buck stops. 
There's nothing more unappetizing than biting into a crunchy fried oyster, only to be disappointed when you find out that you're chewing on some RAW BATTER. 
Perhaps they should go back to the basics and use deep-fryer thermometer? Just a thought. 

FRESH SPINACH SALAD ($8.95):
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bjSC_jbrypke0l-bXXBmwQ?select=MWLoXcv3T_MXTLgqCp2Ubg
This was a favorite amongst most of us (I only got input from our side of the long table, the other half of our large party didn't mention anything about it). 

This spinach salad had a mixture of chopped bacon, eggs, kalamata olives, and artichokes. That's my kind of salad! Can't go wrong with crispy bacon! The citrus vinaigrette was the perfect addition to the salty bacon and kalamata olives. I enjoyed this dish very much. 

Ironic that my favorite part of the entire meal was a damn salad.....especially when I don't even like veggies. That's actually the very section that I avoid like the plague when I dine out.

The service was incredible, the steaks succulent, the lobster bisque heavenly, and the sides enormous as the check. 

Thank goodness my future brother-in-law treated my fiancée and I to dinner. 

Our water glasses never dipped below half full and the food was simply amazing. I had never heard of this place before, but it will probably become a Vegas tradition for us as soon as I win the Powerball jackpot.

Third time here.  Each experience is better than the last. Old school steakhouse; Sinatra, Clooney, and Bobby Darin singing maybe a little too loud.  Menu very strong.  Service 5 star.  D'Andre, a true professional, reseated us to the private dining area because music was too loud; John, our waiter for all three visits is as good as you could wish for in a server.  Two filets at perfect temperature.  Peppercorn sauce and Bernaise.   Mushrooms are incredible, trust me!

Very good steak, but the review someone else had about the crab cakes was true, they are gross.  We both took a bite and asked for it to be removed from the table (the waiter had said they were the best anywhere....wow really?  Cuz yuck!  super old fishy tasting.)

Otherwise the meal was perfect.  I just wouldnt order anything containing fish.  I would go back.

The wait time on a Thursday was just 5 Minutes and the service was exceptional.  Steak and Lobster was delicious and the smash potatoes had my wishing for more... On the other hand, wines selection was not  what I expected..  At least they had Josh from Sonoma is a good cab that did an ok ... job for my steak.  Yet the over all experience was delightful and will be back soon for more.

Wow!  I came here for dinner last weekend for a friend's bachelor party and was absolutely impressed!  Victor, our server, was fantastic throughout the entire night.  He thoroughly explained the specials for the night including the prices, and made some great recommendations for us.  

I went with the 16oz Prime Rib Eye where as most of my friends went with the 21oz Prime Bone-In Rib Eye.  I also tried a piece of the Filet Mignon.  Filet was absolutely melt in your mouth and the Rib Eye was full of delicious flavor.  

Lobster mac n cheese was amazing as well with huge chunks of lobster and cheesy goodness.  

Victor also recommended the Croissant Bread Pudding for dessert which was pretty good but the Key Lime Pie was fantastic!

All 6 of us were completely satisfied and thoroughly enjoyed our meal/experience at Vic & Anthonys!
Still to date the best steak and lobster I've ever had. Period. My one and only 5 star rating.

I want to start off by saying what a great steakhouse. Has the old school feel to it. Not trendy or fake looking. Dimmer lighting and quit. Service was impeccable. Food was to die for. I had the 8 ounce fillet and Lobster tail. Both cooked to perfection and the wife had the shrimp and pasta. Tasted great as well. We had the calamari for an appetizer and it was lime heaven. The portion was almost too much. Prices are more than fair. Definitely treat yourself to this fine steakhouse.

It's a rarity that I "fancy dine" in Vegas.  I'm usually too busy being intoxicated to appreciate that really fancy meal.  Frequently, I end up at a food court somewhere, passed out in my Nathan's french fries.  

On a recent trip to downtown though, I decided to avoid the intravenous injection of cocktails for a day and actually peruse options for a good meal.   Since the wife and I were staying in the nugget, we decided to keep it local and try Vic's.   

I have nothing but positive things to say about the evening.  The food was near transcendent.  I opted for the bone in rib-eye,while the lady chose seafood.  The steak literally melted in my mouth, while the side of Au Gratin potatoes served as a welcome compliment to the meal.  The wife raved about her salmon as we also slowly enjoyed a recommended bottle of bubbly.  

Service was beyond amazing and the atmosphere was beyond comfortable during the entire dining experience which is important for a Vegas fine dining rookie like myself.  

Hopefully, I'll be back downtown in the future and will be able to avoid the football full of liquor long enough to appreciate Vic and Anthony's for a second time.

A little late, but had had to get it in. By far, the best dining experience I've ever had. I believe our waiter's name was Hector (sorry if I'm wrong :/) but he made the experience one to remember. The food was soooooooooo spot on. I actually enjoyed the sides (loaded baked & bone marrow) more than the steak - but the steak was phenomenal! Worth the price. Atmosphere was fantastic - except for a couple of bros acting way out of control behind us. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!

4.0/5.0.  Bone in ribeye cooked perfectly med rare. The mushroom side was the best I've ever had, highly reco. The creamed spinach was outstanding.  Waiter and service was great.  Felt non-pretentious like an old school steakhouse should.

This place is very dark and looks quite old. The service is very professional, but behaves unfriendly and got very angry at us for deciding our order a little bit slower than normal. The waiter was very rude and pushy. The kitchen is just fine. Their filet mignon is good, and the prime ribeye was just fine. Both of them were a little bit undercooked. I asked for medium, and they were medium-rare. Their shrimp scampi and cold water Australian rock lobster tail were also just okay. Among side dishes, their wild mushrooms is good, but very buttery. The asparagus and brussels sprouts were just fine. Overall the service was so bad that I do not recommend the experience for the price.

Excellent experience overall. Good selection of scotch, excellent appetizer. Main courses were delicious!! And our waiter, Victor, was very helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to have a quality dinner around Fremont St.

We were welcomed warmly by the hostess even though we didn't have a reservation. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive to our needs. I had the special which was the filet mignon (was melt in your mouth tender)with a lobster tail (cooked to perfection) asparagus and mushrooms. My husband had the New York strip steak with wild mushrooms and au gratin potatoes as side dishes. The bread was crispy, with a soft inside and warm. We were sooo full there was no room for dessert! Incredible meal all around...I will recommend this restaurant to our friends for sure.

3.5. Pretty over it.

Distinctive Dining deal is now $59, and you don't get to choose your own side any longer. Instead you get a mediocre mash that I was not compelled to eat.

Filet is still excellent and seasoned very well.
Crab cake is bomb.
Salmon was served with a really heavy, rich sauce that was just too much. 

For some reason V&A's just doesn't deliver on sides and sauces.

If you dine here and self-park, make sure to bring your ticket stub into the restaurant to get it validated.

I won't lie, I was not expecting much from a steakhouse inside the Golden Nugget. It was only due booking a hotel for a last minute trade show that we found ourselves at this hotel and had no other choice for dinner as all other reservations in the city were completely filled. But I am happy to say Vic and Anthony's became the shining, mouth-watering, reputation boosting, savior of my entire stay.

I've had Morton's, Mastro's, and Ruth Chris, and honestly on more than one of my visits to these places, I've had to send my steak back due to it being overcooked or undercooked, and once received the most horrid service.

The 21oz bone in rib eye was nothing less than DIVINE. And standing at 5'1" 105 lbs, I ate every single last bite of it, down to scraping off the bone. 

Every single bite was so tender, juicy, and full of flavor and as consistent as it could be throughout. I've found in other rib eyes, the outer rim of the steak was always much more well done than the center. Our waiter was so helpful and suggested that we order the steak rare, since the plate is very hot and it will continue to cook at the table. I am so thankful we did this as my steak was a consistent medium rare throughout the entire meal. 

We shared a crabcake for an appetizer, and all I have to say is you MUST get this. I was worried about it being too heavy before our entrees but there is very little breading, so it was more crab than cake, which worked wonderfully.

We were a party of 3 and ordered a side of broccoli (which comes out in 3 GIANT florets, simply cooked) and a side of the duck fat potatoes. The duck fat potatoes were fingerling potatoes soaked in a confit, and i simply must order anything and everything with the word "confit". However, these were a bit underwhelming. Definitely delicious but they actually just tasted like breakfast potatoes. Which felt out of place with everything else we were eating.

We also ordered a side of bearnaise and peppercorn sauce for our steaks. I ended up not using either as I thought the steak was perfectly delicious on its own.

I guess I'll be coming back to the Golden Nugget after all.
Everything was delicious !! Loved the Chicken Paige was the most delicious I have ever tasted. My husband loved his steak. Kids loved the loaded potatoes and Mac and cheeses. Loved it.

Not the best steakhouse meal I've had, but far from the worst. 

We started with cocktails. I wanted a vermouth - they didn't have the very specific one I was looking for but they gave me a short pour of a really perfect replacement on the house. My partner and I both ordered steak, he started with the roasted bacon and I ordered the bisque. 

The bacon was just absolutely sublime, but the portion was far too large. It was a full 8oz of bacon, people. In two rashers. They were enormous. But the fat rendered perfectly, and they really were delicious. The bisque was standard steakhouse lobster bisque - good, but nothing lifechanging, which is fine.

My steak was cooked perfectly, but there just was something...not great about it. It was a bit chewy, and required a bearnaise. Last year when I was in Vegas I went to Cut and had the steak I compare all steaks to, and this one didn't meet that standard. 

We ordered coffees, and split. I didn't see the bill.

The place was convenient (right in the hotel!), the service was phenomenal, and the food was about what I'd expect. Not a bad choice, and probably the best choice on Fremont street (unless you're in the mood for chicken in which case go to Chart House).

My goodness. I just had the best meal EVER!!! 

Chopped salad - WOW
Filet Mignon w. cheesy au gratin potatoes - OMG
Flourless chocolate cake -  Seriously, WTF? 

I just left Vegas but I am already planning to come back soon just so I can eat at V&A again.   

Screw every buffet and restaurant in town.  I am coming back HERE for the rest of my life!!!  

Throughout the entire meal, I couldn't stop oohing and aaahing.  
This never happened to me before.  Sure, once in a while you have a great meal and you think about it afterwards.  But THIS was the best meal I ever ate!!!  Nuff said.
Yeah, it was very very good. Not the best high end steak (filet) I've ever eaten but close to it. Usually not a fan of over-priced steak houses.  Vic and Anthony's is top notch.

Everything about this place was great. We went here for my birthday. Our server Matt was awesome.  We wanted to try so many things... We went with the chips and strings, bacon, baked potato, salad, Mac and cheese, and a steak... All great!

Take it from a local who has been everywhere - Vic and Anthony's is not only the best steakhouse in Vegas, It is one of the best restaurants in the whole city. Please do yourself a favor and just try this place. It is our new favorite! The prices on the strip are outrageous for what you get and quite a number don't deliver. This place is worth every penny for a special evening. My wife and I went recently to celebrate her birthday this year. The original Vic and Anthony's in Houston is consistently ranked as one of the best in the country. This is their second location, if I remember correctly, and it is every bit as good. Before I say anything about the food, let me just express how incredible the service was. From beginning to end, my wife said it was the best service she has ever experienced and she used to work in the food and service industry for years. They hire excellent people and they will take care of you. The restaurant is located in the best hotel off the strip, the Golden Nugget, and it has a beautifully focused menu. To start the lobster bisque was perfect and the crab cake - Best I have ever had. Furthermore, the drinks are excellent and well priced. The steaks are all cooked to perfection and are served all by themselves, with an optional sauce, topping or any of several sides you can order. The key here is that the steaks are of such high quality and seasoned so immaculately that they don't need anything. I am not a filet man, as like most chefs, I agree it has less flavor than other cuts. However, my surf and turf was sublime! My wife's new york was equally good. We finished with dessert wine and a killer red velvet cake. Everything will be so good you will have to share dishes just so everyone can try a few things.

This is simply the best steakhouse in the country.  You must try it.  While on the pricey side we always walk away thinking out meal was worth it.  When was the last time that happened to you?New York Strip is my favorite steak and the Mac and cheese is a must.

This place is the real deal! Fine dining with an Old Vegas feel. From sublime Martinis with blue cheese olives, incredible oysters Rockefeller, the food is great. But it was the service that set this establishment apart from the rest. Our server Hector must have been telepathic because he and his team anticipated our group of 8s every need, down to calling for and escorting us to waiting cabs.

And i can't forget to mention Noah the Bartender, the alchemist behind those Martinis with ice crystals. He set the tone for the friendly atmosphere and was part showman as he prepared our "poison".

There was Sinatra crooning in the background and a fine dark wood paneled ambiance. Not to be missed downtown. Take a chance and leave the Strip. You won't be sorry. Best recent meal in a flurry of fine dining.

They also handled a special order birthday cake with aplomb for one of our party.

We ate here Monday June 7th.  My wife had the lobster bisque which was good (A-)and the spinich salad, also good (B+).  I had the bone in filet, which was very tender, I'd guess 14oz as advertised but really tasteless. After two bites and a conversation with our waiter, I was compelled to order a sauce to add some taste.  It helped but I was charged the three bucks for the sauce -which I thought odd under the circumstances. Additionally this steak was $67.00!  Now I try to never let the price of a meal affect my opinion but I must admit it may have this time.  Steak gets a shaky C.

As a a side we had the chips and strings and they were OK but pale in comparison to The Palms version. (B-).

The hostess greeting was OK, if a bit lackluster but we found it odd that a couple who checked in right behind us without a reservation were seated ahead of us (we had reservations). Give her a C.

Our waiter was competent but offered little help in menu discussion, showed no personality and seemed to be doing little other than going through the motions. Another C.

Landry's and The Golden Nugget need much more from this place if they want to compete with the strip.  Our meal at Andiamo (at the D) was far superior in every way.
Just a bad night. Maybe but, bad service and food is unforgivable when paying big dollars. Nothing more to say.

I have to say I was impressed. I was in Vegas for the weekend (go figure) and one of my friends said he has heard rave reviews about Vic & Anthony's, however once I heard it was in Downtown Vegas at the Nugget I questioned how good would it be? Afterall I am not really a downtown Vegas type of guy but the other guys wanted to check it out so I went along. Decor is your typical dark wood and paneling steakhouse with lots of old photos on the walls, nothing too spectacular. The food on the other hand was very very good. everyone ordered a different cut of meat from a petite fillet to a huge bone-in rib eye, each with different preparation and temp from rare to medium well and everyone's food came out to their liking. Prices are not bad at all especially when copared to steakhouses on the strip. Now if you are on a budget this is a great place to eat some great food but don't forget to factor in a cab or limo ride fromt he strip to downtown. If you are staying downtown then for sure give it a shot.

I've heard people talk highly of this steak house and through fellow yelpers I found out about the $52 dinner menu. You get an appetizer, entree, side, and dessert for that price! I got lobster bisque, 8oz fillet, at gratin potatoes and the bread pudding! Service was fantastic and so was the meal! I will definitely be back!

Superb service, excellent bone in porterhouse, extensive wine list. This is place was wonderful and will return. I recommend this place to all my friends if they wanted a place to go for a special occasion or for a special evening out with your special date, make your reservations if you decide to go here. It was busy on a Saturday night. 

The service is by the best I've had hands down, from bartenders, waiter, hostess etc
Amazing food and service ! Florin was the best waiter and we really appreciated his suggestions. We will definitely come back here because of the wonderful treatment tonight! Way to go Florin!

Amazing....GREAT food and GREAT service.  The staff was so friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived.  I dont think my water glass was ever less than 3/4 full before the staff refilled.  The attention to detail was fantastic.  As for the food, well I think it was as good as it gets. We ordered a steak for two...cooked to perfection.  I would recommend this place to all!  We will be back for sure!

(Review based on 3.5 stars)

Located at The Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas, directly across from the Chocolate Box and very close to the hotel lobby check in.

My husband and I arrived here for dinner on Christmas day while spending a little vacation getaway in Las Vegas. We arrived right on time for our 5:30 pm reservations (another couple had walked in and asked how long would the wait be since they did not have a reservation and the seating hostess told him it would be about 45 minutes). 

After we were seated and greeted by our server (unfortunately I do not recall his name), we were given menus. We ended up ordering:

Sourdough Bread- This basket of complementary bread was pretty "meh". Although it was served warm, it did not have much of a taste. It is served with butter (with good reason). But since we were both feeling hungry, we ended up eating 1/2 of it. 

Jump Lump Crab Cake, $21 prior to tax- Although this crab cake was a large size (and a fair amount to share for 2 as an appetizer), I wasn't really impressed with it. I thought the breading was not seasoned well. But the crab pieces itself was good. The butter sauce on this crab cake was good but the crab was good all by itself. I wouldn't say this is worth ordering again.

Roasted Salmon, $32 prior to tax- This salmon is served on a bed of potato puree (mashed potatoes) and a delicious lump of crab. This dish is also served with asparagus. I had requested for the asparagus to be steamed. According to our server, normally the asparagus is sauteed in butter. I thought this salmon was perfectly cooked. The sauce was wonderful and I liked the diced tomatoes on the salmon. However I didn't find the capers to really enhance the flavor of the salmon and rather overpowered the delicate flavors of the fish. The crab cake that was served was much better seasoned and better tasting than our appetizer. The portion of this entree is more than perfect for one person. 

Prime Ribeye (16 oz), $47 prior to tax- My husband ordered this (since he is a big steak fan and we are in a steak house). We were both actually surprised that this prime ribeye entree was just meat and no side like my salmon. When we had dined at other steakhouses in the past, the steak entree always comes with some kind of vegetable and/ or starch. So this was a little disappointing. In general, the prime rib was cooked a bit more than my husband wanted (he ordered it medium rare). But the steak was still juicy. It would have been nice to have an accompaniment of sauces to be served with this steak (unfortunately that is not free). 

Haricot Verts, $10 prior to tax- I requested to have these green beans steamed. Normally this would be served with a buttery sauce. I thought these green beans were cooked perfectly. It was nice to be able to taste the natural sweetness and tenderness of the vegetables. 

--------------------------
(Total= $150 after tax and tip)

This was quite a special meal for us to celebrate Christmas. Our server in general was friendly. But was not quite as attentive, but that seems to be the norm for steak houses (so that isn't what caused me to deduct stars on this rating). 

We were disappointed with my husband's entree not coming with a side dish, also disappointed that his steak was cooked a little more than he had requested. We were also disappointed with the bread they served (thank goodness it was free at least because we have been to a steakhouse that served bread for a $5 charge and it wasn't even good). Another thing that did annoy my husband was that there is no restroom inside this restaurant. And so you have to use the restaurant in the casino (a short walk, but you still have to leave the restaurant to use it). And lastly, the crab cake we ordered as an appetizer was not worth it. Overall. this place is worth a solid 3.5 stars.

The couple next to our table did order the bread pudding and it truly looked amazing but we were too full to make an order. If you do come here, I would recommend you consider making room for this dessert. 

By the way, this restaurant will validate your parking ticket for 3 hours. (Parking is not free at the Golden Nugget unfortunately but with validation and for hotel guest only it is free).

I real gem in old downtown. I've been to this restaurant 3 times and every time it gets better. The service is nearly perfect and the food is consistently excellent.  My most recent visit a friend and I started at the bar and decided to have a few appetizers, oysters rockafeller - Scallops (with a slaw that will knock you out) and an heirloom tomato caprese style. All we're awesome.  The atmosphere is great as you'll hear conversation, laughter, great tunes in the background and little else. The staff are veterans that know the hospitality gig cold. Treat yourself to a good time and give this place a whirl.

I make it a point to get down to Freemont street to eat at V&A every single time I'm in Vegas (about twice a year).  They never fail to prepare steaks, chops and fish to perfection!  But the real charm is the service, they are formal and old school, the wait staff and bar staff know what they are doing, they are prompt with food and drink and don't steer you wrong when you have questions.  The wine list is fantastic as well.  The dark paneled atmosphere and big leather chairs make you comfortable to sit down and enjoy your meal.  

This past visit (5/3/10) was no exception, we were dining with clients and part of our group was running way behind.  The hostess was able to work with us on our reservation and we happily split the time difference between the bar and munching on apps at the table, again perfect!  This is a steakhouse not to be missed!

Have eaten here 8-10 times, LOVE IT.  One of my favorites in LV.  The best thing ever is their seafood tower appetizer, sometimes my wife and I go JUST for this, it is so good and filling and don't miss the martini glass with seafood kimchi coleslaw... it is to die for and I get the impression people miss it, thinking it is a decoration.  It may be one of the best things on the platter.

Another thing to look for, the website has a special for a meal for 2 for around $100.  A good deal for a date.
Great food, good service. Husband loved his filet mignon & I had shrimp cocktail & crab cakes, which were both good. The creme brulee was the best ever... So good. Good place for a nice meal.

Easily one of the best steakhouse in Las Vegas! It is located inside the Golden Nugget Casino.  Filet mignon was excellent (no need for additional sauce), melt in your mouth - this is one of the few times that I actually finished my steak and the croissant bread pudding is to DIE for ! :)  Service was excellent ! Oh yeah, hubby and I will be back with others. 
Tip: Go to their website and print out the Distinctive Dining  Deal menu (You will get 3 courses w/ sides for a great price) 
Note: It is not a very kid friendly restaurant - I called a few months ago to make reservation and was told that if the child is too young and start making a fuss, we may be asked to leave. We decided not to risk it with my 2 year old niece. Having said that, when we were at the restaurant, we did see children that's about 5 or 6 years old. So, parents:  use your best judgement :)

BT and I went here because it was recommended by our friends. I didn't realize it was in the Golden Nugget and was worried it wouldn't be that nice inside. Boy, was I wrong. I was completely blown away by the gorgeous woodwork, the ambient lighting, and overall old school "fancy" feel. The hostesses were great and welcoming. Our server was amazing. He recommended great wines and let us have tastes when we were indecisive of what to order. We were lucky to have stumbled upon the distinctive dining offer. What an amazing deal. We first started off with the lobster bisque. My goodness was that ever decadent. So flavorful with big chunks of lobster. They did not skimp with the serving size either. Next, we had the 8 oz filet mignon. Perfectly cooked to our desires of medium rare and medium. They also had this peppercorn sauce on the side. It was a perfect complement to the meat. Not overpowering, but a great enhancement. We chose the broccoli and au gratin potatoes as our sides. I was awe-struck by the portion sizes. The broccoli was HUGE. I am not exaggerating either. It had an awesome flavor- far from your average steamed broccoli taste. The au gratin was rich and decadent. All of this yummy goodness paired with a nice, generous pour of Malbec. For dessert, BT had the bread pudding, which he LOVED and I had the lemon sorbet. What I appreciated most is that our server was very concerned with my allergies, and went to find out what I could have in lieu of the pre-set dessert choices. The service was top notch and we never wanted for anything. This was a very special experience of amazing service, food, and setting. Definitely worth the 151 dollar tab (not including tip) So, Treat yo' self to Vic & Anthony's. You deserve it.

Great Wine Selection 
Good Food 
Great Service 
Outdated Decor 

Maybe everything in the old part of Las Vegas is supposed to look like a wiseguy era, cigar smoking, handkerchief mouth covering type place. Whatever it was, I felt like I was paying for the food, wind options and service only. They really need to modernize this place. 

I don't eat steak, but my friend made me try it - it was exquisite. My chicken was amazing and the Grgich wine was spectacular! Make the trip out here to see the Fremont Street Experience and Vic and Anthony's!

There are some experiences in life you have to live at least once, and dinner at Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is definitely one of them. 

I've had the privilege of coming here for a third time; two previously with my fave uncle, and this time with my husband, my cousin, and her husband. We sat at a table tucked in a balcony area, where our server, Ben, gave us superb service as he provided us with dinner specials, suggestions for drink pairings, a little bit of history, and entertaining jokes throughout our evening. 

The four of us shared a bottle of Pinot Noir that Ben recommended. We followed this delicious and smooth wine with individual cocktails, I had the Spiced Pear Martini, which might not have been the best choice to pair with my filet and lobster tail, but it hit a great spot my taste buds were desiring. 

We shared a calamari appetizer that was mixed with shishito peppers. The plate was just right for the four of us, especially since two of us aren't big fans of this particular seafood. 

For our second course, we chose different salads. I enjoyed the heirloom tomato penzanella, which seemed to be a variation of caprese. It was rich, light, and scrumptious. Around the rest of the table were Caesar salaf and Spinach salad. 

The main course consisted of two specials of 8oz filet and I think 12oz lobster tails with fingerling potatoes and sautéed mushrooms (yellowfoot, bluefoot...and one other that I can't recall at the moment, mostly because I have them to my man to enjoy since he is the only fun-guy I like! lol). The other two plates were filled with porter house ribeyes that my cousin and my husband savored until they couldn't eat anymore. Yes, leftover meat taken back to the room and chewed up for breakfast. 

Our additional sides were au gratin potatoes, roasted Brussels sprouts, asparagus, and in house made creamed corn. We covered the table with our feast, everything set in a wonderful presentation, flavored amazingly, and eaten with great delight. 

Ben paid attention when we mentioned we were there to celebrate my cousin and her husband's wedding anniversary, and he generously brought out a creme brulee with a candle. It was just the right amount of sweet for four spoons that filled us to our limit. 

It was a fabulous evening of food, conversation, service and overall memory making that the four of us will get to share and enjoy the rest of our days.

Was here with family and friends on sunday Sept 14 With a party of 10. Was seated in a private room and the service was impeccable. Our server Victor was perfect and I like that they served our lady's first when dinner came out.  The manager Deandre was very polite and professional.   Food is delicious and we will definitely be back. Thank you for this experience.

By far, one of the best meals I've had in a long time.  Their signature crab cake is a must bc it contains large lumps of sweet carb meat.  The steak was very tender and full of flavor.  I've eaten at a lot of top Steakhouses, this one ranked up there with the best.  My wife ordered the Pepper Tuna, that was excellent.  The sides were great, our desert was Croissant Bread Pudding, topped off our excellent dining experience.  Beside our meal, I think our service was even better.  Hector is a class act and very personable.  I HIGHLY recommend him!!!

A great place! Eight of us had dinner and all eight of us were totally happy. 
The food was delightful from steaks to seafood to salads. 
The service was 5 star to say the least. 
The restaurant was cozy and very comfortable. 
All eight ladies gave it a 5 Star both food and service. We can't wait to go back to Vegas, we will surely have dinner here again.
I live in Vegas and this by far is a hidden gem. I think its the best steakhouse in Las Vegas

I love this place!!!! It was a little harder to find and on the expensive side but it is worth every penny. GREAT steak and seafood too, you know it's good when everyone at the table loves their food and you can't pick out a favorite.
The food was awesome. We especially enjoyed the lobster bisque and the ribeye. The servers were on point and never needed to ask for anything.

Very solid steakhouse.  I loved the Sinatra-esque feel to the ambiance.  With enough imagination and style, you could really fool yourself to feel part of the rat pack. 

The crab cake is the best item on the menu for me.  A generous portion of lump crab with very minimal breading is pan fried and served piping hot.  The steak tartare is just a must!  

I appreciate the method of preparing their steaks.  It's seasoned lightly with salt and nothing else.  You have the option of ordering a sauce but I really see no point with quality meat.  Just be sure they understand what medium rare means.  My steak was medium to medium well.  I could have sent my steak back but the service was superb. 

Excellent list of wines.  A variety of notable Napa wines that most restaurants do not carry such as Shafer and Peju.  Also, nice selection of Mendoza Malbec wines.

I was excited to eat at Vic's in Vegas, I have been to the original in Houston. Our server Benjamin was nice and described the menu with his vast knowledge.  I wanted wine with my steak.  The wine list is extensive, so I asked for a reasonable priced bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon, nothing too expensive.  I thought he would recommend a 100-150 bottle.  He suggested a bottle that was $450.  I laughed.  He gave me attitude, so I ordered a kettle One martini.  After that his attitude and service changed.  The other server was nice and more helpful.  I ordered a Rib eye on the bone.  Extremely rare cut and it was delicious.  But the whole dining experience was tainted by the stuck up waiter.  We ate the next night at Hugo's Cellar at the Four Queens and had a terrific dinner.
This steak house is my all time favorite. The food is delicious and the $49 3 course meal is a great deal.

Ok, I'm a carbs girl. So going here was extremely important for me cuz I need some good carbs to go with my dang steak cowboy. LOL Au gratin, au gratin, au gratin potatoes, how I luv you so. And the bread is flippin' amazing. Oh yeah, all of the steaks are phenomenal! You gotta get the creme brulee for dessert to share cuz it's huge just like the potatoes. One downfall is the fact that you have to kinda walk through the entire casino to use the ladies room, so make sure you go before you're seated.

Was there in March with some friends, excellent steak, also had the mac & cheese, that was good too.  My friends had the shrimp, which I was told was also good.  We went out on Freemont Street after and had a great time.

Before I get to what a terrific restaurant this is, I have to depart into the bloody mary, my thing:

I expected more from the bloody mary here. Demitri's is my favorite mix, but for a cocktail that pairs so well with meat, I'd have expected a house-made mix. And, "spicy" meant extra tabasco, not the right answer in our age of scotch bonnet, bird and ghost peppers. 

The soups: fantastic. I ordered one for my dining companion, took a taste, and was so impressed that I immediately ordered their other soup option for myself, to try both. 

The large ribeye was delicious and well-cooked, but I have to be straight to my readers about the bone-marrow sauce option. I chose to come here specifically for that sauce, and I can't fault it for being what it is: I just had to learn, somewhere, sometime, that it's a black, salty, sticky sauce with chunks of greyish paste-y marrow. 

My dining companion had the salmon, and was relieved that the Roaring Fork's is better. It'd be a shame to have raised the bar on one's favorite entree at such an inaccessible place. The grilled wild mushrooms came in nice variety, three of four types.

Dessert, the flourless chocolate cake, was too rich for words, of course, and fabulous, but if you're reading this in Austin, go to the Mesa Grill in Northwest Hills for its rival.

We went for the old-school atmosphere and the interesting menu, but the service was top-flight, the best waitstaff I've had outside Paris, the kind of service that makes you remember that serving can be one hell of a classy profession.

I went here last night for a holiday dinner and hadn't heard much about this place but my boss had heard about it through word of mouth. Wow...I am sure glad we did! This was by far the best steak I have ever had. The filet was cooked so perfectly and so tender that you literally could cut it with a fork. But my dinner started off with the highly recommended crab caked and man am I glad I did. I am not sure if there was any filling used in these cakes because they were just stuffed full of crab...amazing! 

Lastly the service here has got to be some of if not the best service I have ever received ...absolutely outstanding. The prices are a little high but you are paying for the atmosphere and a nice steak. This is located in the newly remodeled Golden Nugget which is very nice done.  If you are looking for an awesome steak then this is.
The most amazing steal and lobster so worth the coin. Definitely coming back again!!! Creme Breulle is amazing!!

Simply excellent. We were taken to Vic & Anthony's by some of our favorite reps and it did not disappoint. It's a fabulous steakhouse with a gracious and helpful staff and an array of choices on the menu.

For starters we went with the cheese plate and a dozen raw oysters - top notch. 

I selected the rib eye (duh) medium-rare and ate every. last. bite. I'm not necessarily proud of that but it was a feat for this carnivore. 

The sides are huge - plenty for sharing - try the creamed spinach and mac and cheese. Heaven in your mouth, I tell ya.

Vic & Anthony's has that classic steakhouse feel. Very sophisticated, but comfortable, which makes me a fan.

Lovely, old school vibe. The lobster bisque and filet mignon are good. The mac and cheese was beyond salty. 

Great service.
Thank you for the most beautiful evening heather was the best server the food was A little busy but absolutely wonderful service all the way around
Wonderful service, fantastic food and an overall great experience! Highly recommended! The filet was cooked perfectly, halibut with lump crab was amazing and the desserts were over the top!

I go to Vegas once a month for work and stay downtown. This is by far my favorite steak house in Vegas. The food for the price is great. I have been to other steak house on the strip and they do no t compare in taste or price to what Vic and Anthony's has to offer. I always sit at the bar and the tenders are more than friendly and professional. I have asked for slight changes in my app and the kitchen will always accommodate, the filet always cooked to perfection. They serve a drink in a tumbler. Always good! Though someone in another review complained the key lime pie was too crusty, the key lime pie has a crust and the actual filling is the tartness it should be.

Best Steak house, went there for Father's day dinner, all of the food from appetizers and  salads,  to main course and side dishes were all amazing. The service was superb, our waiter went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect .  Also, the bar makes you any drink that you want! Highly recommend this place!
This place is outstanding. it beats my expectations everytime. Shawn Norris is an exceptional general manager and the food is out of this world.

Our romantic evening started off with Ketel One dry Martinis, Up, with 2 olives, Lobster Bisque, Traditional Caesar Salad, we shared a 1lb King Crab Legs, Asparagus, Baked Potato with the works and a nice, warm delicious Bread! My husband and I don't eat much, and didn't want any leftovers but this delicious dinner spread was very filling, we were extremely satisfied! Tab: $150. We will return for more satisfying, dining experience when we return to the Fremont Experience!
Don't be fooled by the location. V&As is a great steakhouse. It's a must visit for us every time in town. Dry aged NY strip and bone in ribeye. Sides are great as well.

Simply awesome. As good as it gets. I had the 32 oz porterhouse.....can it get better than that??? My wife had the 12 oz filet....awesome as well. We both did the au gratins. They were extremely cheesy in a good way, and also very big. We've been told so many times "it's big enough to share"  only to be totally disappointed. These are! No worries though as they were so good we ate most of them and took the meager amount left home. 

We had the creme brulee and chocolate mousse for dessert. Both were very good and the creme brulee in particular was large enough for two. 

The bill was over $200 and I didn't bat an eye because everything was so good. That's what I expect in a high end steakhouse. Vic and Anthony's completely delivered in every aspect from food to service.

We decided to stop into this gem of a steakhouse due being indecisive about where we wanted to eat. Little did we know it was an excellent decision. This restaurant has a ton of charm and the classy feel of an old school steakhouse restaurant. The wine selection is out of this world and the menu doesn't disappoint. My husband had the steak and lobster special and I had the stuffed salmon. Both entrees were like nothing I have ever had. Very unique and delicious! Our server (and I'm going to butcher her name, Ayko??) was fabulous. Gave us amazing drink and menu recommendations, and was at the top of her game with service. Best server we have ever had. And if you have room for desert, get the croissant bread pudding. YUM!!!

This is a definite hidden gem downtown....top notch steakhouse inside a 3rd rate casino. Be sure and ask about the all new distinctive dining deal.....at $49.95 its a great value . I had the iceberg wedge salad and it was very good. Wife had the beefsteak tomato and onion salad..a little weird=no lettuce. I had the 8 oz. filet mignon,...melt in your mouth delicious...wife had the sea  bass with jumbo lump crab and loved it. my son opted for the rib eye steak off the regular menu and he was extremely pleased. we shared au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. everything was tasty. for dessert...the croissant bread pudding and the crème brulee come highly recommended. Our meal was enhanced by our waiter..patrick. he was incredibly attentive and enthusiastic. a waiter who obviously loves his job! we were amazed that for a prix fix meal..the portions were normal size huge.sometimes restaurants skimp on the prix fix..not here. ambiance here is all old vegas steakhouse with rat pack type music a little too loud for my taste. also parking here can be a problem. golden nugget parking garage was full....we considered just cancelling things but a valet at the nearby golden gate let us park there and we walked over. we all left vic and anthonys very happy.

I had the 24oz Ribeye and it was great. Service we excellent and the prices were as expected. This is still not one of the best steakhouses but if your in Vegas and you love steak you have to try this place. Stripsteak and Gallaghers are better but this place was still very very good.

I went here because my husband raved about the orgasmic experience he had at the Houston location. Yes, you read it correctly, "Orgasmic." If I had to describe his experience any further, my post would probably be flagged. 


I, for one, am not about pass on such an experience, booked the reservation on Christmas eve when I knew we were going to be in  Vegas. 

After dinning there, it was a bit of a let down.  Let me preface that the steaks were good: Just as good as any other $50 steak place. I mean, a steak house ruining steak, that's just blasphemous. However, it just was not the best I've ever had -- that's what she said.  (See what I did there. Following on the sexual theme. Ha ha.)

Service was attentive, and they displayed the steaks tartare on a cool salt slab; one you can buy for 45 bucks! 

My husband agreed that it was not like Houston's. I guess the Texans just know how to cook their steaks. If I were ever in Houston, I would give this another try.

Truly one of the best steak and lobster restaurants in the world!  If you order a steak and lobster to share and ask them to present family style they do all the work and remove the lobster meat from shell and slice the steak into bite size strips, they so spoil you!  Awesome sides and wine selection.

Wayne Gorsek

We hit Vic and Anthony's on a Thursday night with a reservation and it was delicious!  I had the filet mignon 8 oz which was cooked to perfection and a side of the Brussels sprouts which was great. When the food came to our table (of 4), it was all extremely hot which makes you feel like it just came out of the kitchen and straight to your table, none of this waiting under a heat lamp for service. One of my friends happened to look online and find a great 3 course alternate menu for a significantly cheaper price than if you ordered it all separately.  It was presented to us by the server from her billfold when we inquired about it, leading us to believe it is a unadvertised special. It must be asked for. A few small complaints, which are actually pretty minor, the wine list is veeeeeery long. Almost overwhelmingly long, it took us forever just to decide on a wine to enjoy with dinner. Also, you must physically leave the restaurant and walk through the casino to find a bathroom.  However our server was great and the staff was fantastic. Plates cleared within seconds of finishing. Enjoy!

located inside of the golden nugget hotel. nice atmosphere, our waiter seemed like he worked there forever (older gentleman), was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu and seemed to read us well with suggestions of sides and drinks. the food was amazing!!! potatoes cooked in duck fat? freakin yum! there is a "secret menu" that isn't listed at the restaurant, but if you print it out and take it to the restaurant, you get a set 3 course meal for $50! we didn't opt for this meal, but would definitely consider for a future visit. the crab cake was really tasty and loaded with crab! some reviews complained about the dress code, or lack there of...the restaurant is in a casino!! lol. there are many people that choose to go have a nice dinner after a day full of gambling...does it bother me that they're wearing shorts? nope! they're still paying the same $50 per steak, and it's not like they're dirty or acting like heathens. perhaps people should consider taking their dates to a nice restaurant not located in a casino. definitely recommend, awesome service, and fantastic food!

Looking for a fabulous dining experience and we picked Vic & Anthony's.   Bad choice!   I had the filet and lobster and my husband had the rib eye.   Lobster was very small and ok,   filet and rib eye were ok but not good enough for either of us to finish eating.   Chopped salad was excellent.
