Wine list was huge,  we picked Seghesio Zinfandel a top notch Zin but they were out of it.     We opted for another bottle of Zin which was good but wines are so overpriced it was not surprising only one other table within our view had a bottle on their tables.   When asked how our dinner was we gave them our opinion and offered dessert which we declined but they did reduce our bill by a small percentage which we did not ask for but accepted.  Going back??  Nah!
V & A lived up to all the reviews!  Service was fantastic, lobster bisque was creamy and delicious, and the NY strip melted in my mouth.  Highly recommended!

Very nice place the service was EXCELLENT !! The food was perfectly cooked to order. We started with appetizer of pan seared scallops my gf loves these and I never had tried them she said they were excellent . I chose the shrimp cocktail which was pretty good as well. I ordered the prime porterhouse which was melt in your mouth perfection my gf ordered the fillet at med well and that was perfect and not dried out. The waiter was great always attentive if we were low on drinks or in need of anything. The only thing you need to be aware of is bring the bank the place is expensive but worth every penny, I forgot to add also had the wedge salad was awesome as well as the side of scalloped potatoes w/ dinner outstanding!!!!!!!

Lordy, they try hard here. I adore them for that. The service was attentive and friendly.

But sadly, this is a mediocre steak house. A little better than Binion's, which has gone downhill since the casino was sold, but compared to the vast selection of other carnivore feeding-troughs in town, this is only a few dozen notches above a Sizzler. I mean where's the damn kobe?

My medium rare ribeye was delivered medium. The steak fries, which I asked them to double-fry, were the best thing of the night. The wines by the glass were few, and uninspired.

As I continue to do my tour of the steakhouses in Las Vegas with the goal of definitively finding the top 5, this one is not even in the running.
The service is very friendly AND professional (a rare combination at some restaurants) and the food was EXCELLENT.  Without a doubt the best meal on a 14 day trip across the United States.

Always stop here when in Vegas to have a fabulous dinner. Have never been disappointed. Had the 20oz lobster tail, done to perfection. Choose the wedge salad, and a great glass of wine. Service was top notch,  never had to want for anything, waiter was right there. Highly recommend!

Miguel was our server and he was outstanding!!! We were a party of 8 with several peeps in high demand of attention and he accomodated every request with a smile. If you order any of the side dishes, they can be shared amongst your party, they are huge portions!!! Caeser salad was heavy on the dressing with few crutons. Also had the crabcake; it was moist and very tastey!!!

My husband and I dined here on our recent trip to Vegas after reading about it on Trip Advisor and we're so glad we did! Even though we were staying at the NY, NY on the Strip, we ventured into the old part of town for this meal at the Golden Nugget. After the $30 cab ride, we kept our fingers crossed that the meal was as great as we'd read about and were not disappointed.

Ambience: The restaurant exudes that traditional steak house feeling! The dark wood, leather, and dim lighting made it the perfect environment to enjoy a lovely meal.  They even had very beautiful stained glass ceiling pieces in the area where we were seated that were unlike anything I'd ever seen. The restaurant was busy, but the tables were nicely spaced and my husband and I never felt as though we were being invaded upon by other guests. There was even a large table nearby, but again no issues!

Food: We decided to enjoy our bread and butter and also a cup of their lobster bisque which was perfect. Off to a great start! We also ordered two reasonably priced glasses of merlot (recommended by our waiter, Mario) from Washington State.  It was so tasty that we bought a bottle upon our return home and have bookmarked the winery (Sagelands) in our favorites. My husband ordered the rib eye (rare) and I ordered the filet (medium). These steaks have to be among the very best we've ever had, and we've dined at several of the finer steakhouses in the US.  The meat was seasoned perfectly, and so juicy that we savored every bite until the end. We chose the asparagus spears as our veggie to share, and they too were wonderfully seasoned (huge stalks, by the way!) We did look the dessert menu over, and there were many choices that looked appealing but we passed. 

Service: As others have mentioned, the service was top notch. Our waiter, Mario was friendly, knowledgeable, and visited our table just the right amount of times during our meal. We were so impressed by the quality of his service that we asked to speak to the manager on our way out to share our compliments. Needless to say the manager was concerned at first that something had gone awry with our meal, but was very happy that our first experience had been so positive.

Bottom line: While expensive, Vic and Anthony's triumphs over the typical Vegas steak. Make the trip! I know the next time we are in Vegas; we will definitely stop in for a repeat performance.

Wow, this place was amazing.  Old world feel with Sinatra and Dean music in the background.  Our waiter Jim and service was excellent, loved the New York Strip and Lamb Chops, creamed spinach was to die for.  If our heading for Fremont Street and don't mind paying for a great meal, book this experience today.

This place is truely the best dinner i have ever had in my life.the cold water lobster melted in your mouth and had good melted butter.the bone in filet with potatoes and asparagas was a special and it was killer!so much flavor.there was this creamy white sauce and fresh herbs tossed with these flavorful fried red potatoes.none of the food needed any salt and pepper at all.the service was the best service i have ever had in my life at a restaurant.they brushed this knife over the table and picked up all the crumbs after appetizers and constantly replaced your fork and made sure everything was perfect.the ladies were served first n get to order first.i thought that aas nice too.the waiters/waitrssses were all so knowledgable about the food they gave percect detail and we asked lots of questions too!this place is a jewel in las vegas

Wife and I ate here the first day we got to Vegas.  After a 6 hour flight and time spend getting to the hotel we were looking for a nice quiet dinner.  We were not disappointed.  We both thought it wouldn't be too busy on a Tuesday evening, but we were wrong.  It was about an hour to hour and a half wait, but that is on us, since we didn't make reservations.  They did take my cell phone # and would call when our table was ready.  We headed out to the casino.   I got a call after about an hour and we headed back to the restaurant.  The atmosphere is dark, quite, very nice.  We received bread and water almost immediately after we were seated.  Our waiter came over and went through the specials and menu.  We ordered the tomato and mozzarella salad for an appetizer.  I ordered the special which was a filet with three shrimp in scampi sauce, garlic mashed potatoes,and sauteed fresh vegetables.  My wife opted for the ribeye with baked potato.  We received our appetizer quickly and it had been split onto two plates which was nice.  Our steaks arrived shortly after we finished the appetizer.  Our waiter asked us to cut into them to check that they were done to our liking and they were.  The filet was melt in your mouth tender.  The veggies were a little under cooked, but I like them al dente.  The mashed potatoes had way too much garlic for my taste and I really like garlic.  My wifes steak had that nice intense beef flavor and was cooked perfectly.  The skin on her baked potato was a little tough, but inside was light and fluffy.  The service was awesome and we had a truly pleasant dining experience and were able to de-stress after traveling.

Rivals any steakhouse in Las Vegas and that says a lot because this city has some INCREDIBLE steakhouses. I would place it in the top 3.  The bone-in ribeye has so much flavor that it is remarkable. DO NOT MISS A CHANCE TO EAT HERE!  It's heavenly.

The ambiance is great albeit a bit crowded. Great service but not intrusive. Fillet was the best I've ever had and I love steak. Went with the Peppercorn Port sauce per the waiters recommendation. Really good. Only downside was we were there for a birthday and they charged us for the birthday dessert they brought us without ordering. Place is classy without being stuffy.  On site wine expert made excellent recommendations and was cost sensitive.
This place is so classy!! It's like old Vegas with all the modern flare! Try the lobster!!! You can see what your about to eat right when you walk in the front door!!!

I really enjoyed Vic & Anthony's.  This was actually my first time walking through the Golden Nugget after the renovations and it was great to have had a dose of Fremont after spending so much time in the past few years on the Strip.  Alas I digress!! 

Okay... so, you come to Vic & Anthony's for the fine dining, great steaks and dark atmosphere that really gives it that nice touch of "Oooh, fancy-smancy!"

V&A delivers on all fronts, walking in across the selection of cuts and lobster aquarium, through the dark corridors and to a nicely spaced dining area you really get a sense that you are in for a treat. 

The service is wonderful, our server was very accommodating and attentive.  Our food came out fast and drinks were consistently filled to the brim.  Absolutely NO complaints here, I would say the service is some of the best I've received in all of Vegas.  FANTASTIC!

The meat (the important part right?) is great but not pinnacle of all steak houses in my opinion.  I ordered the rib eye ($55) and had a taste of the bone in cut that clocked in at about $69 dollars that night for a 21oz cut (Market Price).  I enjoyed the marbled taste of both ribeye but the flavoring was a bit peppery in some areas as the seasoning did not appear to have been spread across the entire cut as well as I had hoped.  I had a chance to sample the filet mignon as well and that was great, but again not something that I immediately fell in love with.   Overall a very fine experience and I will definitely be back, however when it comes to my FAVORITE steakhouses I'd have to still say Ruth's Chris and Craftsteak are still my favorites.  

Definitely worth the try for EVERYTHING as an overall package.  Thank you Vic & Anthony's :)

Snuck in here at the closing bell and was treated to an an amazing filet mignon and lobster dinner.  The filet was prepared to perfection and the lobster was as good as it gets - almost sweet.  Bartender was heavy handed.  Jay, my waiter, was top notch. The creme brûlée was very good as well.  5 star meal and 10 star service.  Definitely the spot I would frequent if I was a local, and I'll return the next time I'm in town.
Authentic atmosphere. Classic service. Good ambient temperature for our preference (means not too cold). I love here.

My taste buds are forever altered, after having experienced the deliciousness of the Vic & Anthony's experience.

The restaurant is located inside the Golden Nugget. My wife and I made reservations for 9:45. We are greeted by the hostess who was very friendly. The dining room is not very large, but it did not take away from the fact that it has a very intimate / romantic atmosphere. Perfect since the wife and I were there celebrating our 5th year wedding anniversary that night. The room is dim lit, with candles burning on every table. 

As we are escorted to our table, every single waiter is gretting us with "Good evening", which was a very classy touch.

We are seated and served our bread basket. The bread alone was so fresh and warm. We start looking through the menu and I plan a strategy. My wife is set on the New York steak which is pretty big. I know for a fact she will not finish it. So I order the 8 oz filet mignon. That way I will eat my steak, and finish her left overs! 

Our waiter finally comes around and addresse's me as Mr. "my last name" the entire evening which made me feel like a big shot. My wife's New York steak is at market price for $46.50. My filet mignon went for $38.50.

On the side we ordered the Au Gratin Potatoes.

Let me just say that my plan worked perfectly. My wife did not finish her steak, so I got to enjoy them both. I order my filet medium, and my wife requested her's medium well. The steak's literally melted like butter with every bite. Whatever seasoning they used was simply amazing which only enhanced the flavor,. By far the  best tasting steak I have ever had. I will consider it a crime for someone to come to Vegas, and n ot dine at Vic & Anthony's.

The Au Gratin Potatoes were incredible as well. They were baked with cheese on top.

The sides are portioned to share by the way. Very generous portions.

For dessert, we ordered the croissant bread pudding. You seriously do not know what you are missing if you dont try this piece of sweetness. According to our waiter,it won the dessert of the year award. I believe it. It was too good.

It is a pricey restaurant, but well worth every pennie!

We will no doubt be dining here again on our next Vegas trip..
good restaurant with very good food and very  good service i would like to eat here again i think it's one of the better Steakhouses in las vegas it's expensive but it's worth it.

Was sort of intrigued with the rating for the place even though it's in downtown LV. (Golden Nugget)  Typically highly rated places here don't really warrant their ratings IMO (Hugo's cellar, Second Street Grill)   I thought this place has either got to be really good or really overrated.  But since we were going to be pretty close to it around dinner, and we wanted some steak, I thought let's try it.

Got the Prime Ribeye (no bone) med rare.  Perfectly cooked, the meat had great texture throughout.  Seasoned just right as well, it was succulent and tasty.  Sometimes these prime or prime prime meats have chunks of fat in them; not this though, it was a nice and even. I even got the port peppercorn sauce on the side just in case but it wasn't really needed.

Parents had the Filet Mignon and Veal Chop.   I think my dad liked the chop since it disappeared pretty quickly.

Got the au gratin potatoes and the risotto (crab based) as sides.  The Au Gratin Potatoes had that nice deep cheddar flavor with a good crust as well.  I'm not a real 'crab' person but I appreciated how the risotto was so smooth with that good 'crabby' flavor.  Both sides were so tasty with a depth of flavor that seemed truffle oil-ish, but it wasn't overwhelming (so probably not?).

Even though we were full from that, we got the Caramel croissant bread pudding.  It comes with a scoop of ice cream and toffee chips in the sauce (see pict). Each bite was sweet and succulent.

Although price is usually a factor in my rating, this place's rating will be different.  The quality of each dish at this steakhouse matches the best steakhouse dinner I have ever had before (Mastros BH). Even being in downtown, it crushed other steaks I've had on the Strip (Craftsteak, Prime).  I haven't tried the very top steakhouses in LV but I know if I want some great steak in the future and I'm over here in downtown, I'll try to come back here again.

I would probably give it a full five if I had just had a steak!  But as the night was, I was in the company of 4 older people, all of who were not about to indulge in a steak with me and I was not about to order one of those bad boys myself.  But it looked SOOOO GOOD in the showcase.  

I did have the tartar though, which they did up in small chunks, seasoned, and plated on a salt brick.  Very nice going down.  Between the 5 of us, we had seafood, seafood, and seafood.  I won't comment on the Alaskan King Crab legs because I think that they are all the same.  The AKC pasta though, was wonderfully light and fresh.  My dad had the special which was scallops, shrimp and swordfish over polenta with a baked potato on the side.  Perfectly done.  HUGE SIDES! I suggest sharing, especially if you order the mashed potatoes.   

Salmon was also done well.  

Nice ambiance - dark like a real classy restaurant, but like Hawaii, because it's Vegas, the dress code is not that strict.  I wore shorts. But in true Vegas fashion, there were large screen tvs through out the place that played sports non stop.  Service was great, quick and friendly.

I look forward to going back with a meat eater and killing one of those $90 porterhouses or $60 rib eyes.

Two days after a birthday steakhouse dinner in Seattle, we went here. The service was top rate, but the steak was well below par, and their was a group of a dozen or so that overflowed from the small bar and gathered around our dining table.......not a great setting and a piss poor meal. My wife's meal was fine, but a steak cooked medium should have some sort of juices remaining.....dontcha think?  Not again!

The bone-in ribeye had the best flavor and texture of steak I have ever had. Being a native Houstonian, I've had my share of steak! I ordered my ribeye medium rare (which at Vic & Anthony's is nice and pink) and it literally melted in my mouth. I hardly had to chew--it just melted! The steak cuts like a tender piece of meat, but when it hits your mouth is it truly similar to the texture of butter. Unbelievable. I never quite understood what people meant by comparing foods to butter, until I tasted Vic & Anthony's steaks. The meat isn't overly seasoned or overly salted---its a perfect balance (maybe just a dash of salt and pepper) with a quality cut of meat. When you taste a steak from Vic & Anthony's, you are tasting the meat in its best form--not covered up with a bunch of spices and seasonings. Simplicity at its finest!

Be careful though---once you eat there, you'll have risen the bar so high on good eats, that you may have a hard time tolerating food from other Las Vegas eateries. No matter where we went, nothing we ordered compared to the experience of our Vic & Anthony's meal. 

The asparagus and the mushrooms were wonderful accompaniments. The asparagus was medium-sized, lightly seasoned and al dente. The mushrooms tasted like they were tossed in a wine sauce of some sort. Served sauteed and whole, these mushrooms were firm and absolutely delicious! A fun appetizer to order is the steak tartare. Delicate and whimsical, the steak tartare is served with a mildly spicy ground mustard, chips and an egg yolk in the center (which becomes like a rich sauce when you break it open). A slab of salt that resembled marble was used as a platter for this appetizer, which added some light salty flavor and lots of fun to this dish. 

The decor inside Vic & Anthony's is dim, warm, soothing and elegant--as is the music playing in the background. Be sure to check out the photography on the walls, as they are all tributes to Las Vegas history. Beautiful restaurant, and excellent food. You are making a huge mistake if you miss out on Vic & Anthony's!

OMG~ We had the most amazing meal at this steakhouse.  Perhaps because I was not expecting much, or perhaps it was the great company I was with, but I HIGHLY recommend Vic & Anthony's.  The appetizers, main dishes, drink menus, wine list were all impeccable.  It was a truly memorable meal that still makes my mouth water....

My girlfriend and I had been planning a trip to Las Vegas for quite some time and finally the day arrived where we were in our car and driving through the desert. I can be classified as a meticulous planner. I had everything planned from what shows we were going to see, to where we were going to stay to where we were going to eat. My girlfriend and I are HUGE fans of Steakhouses and I knew Vic & Anthony's happened to be in the lobby of the Hotel we were staying at the 'Golden Nugget.' I figured since we were driving around it only made sense to enjoy a dinner close to our Hotel this just happened to be in our Hotel. Quite honestly even if this Steakhouse was the other side of town we would of driven there, it is that good. 

I made our reservation for Vic & Anthony's using the Yelp feature on my phone. We arrived and from the moment we checked in with the receptionist we were treated like absolute royalty. I due honestly believe we were given the 'STAR' treatment because of the whole 'Yelp' reservation. 

As other patrons were being seated on the 1st floor of the restaurant we were taken to a small 2nd level that overlooked the entire restaurant almost like you were on a balcony with curtains obstructing the view of the commoners below you=) As described on the Vic & Anthony's website 'Our Las Vegas locations offers a Private Tasting Room in an elegant setting, featuring beautiful wine country murals. The tasting room will seat up to 18 guests, and features our award-winning cuisine with and extensive wine list.' We were the only ones seated in section until just before our dessert arrived. We were also dressed the part which added with the 'Yelp' check-in was the icing on the cake. The décor was stunning. The chairs we sat in were leather with 'brass tacks,' the menus were hard/thick leather. The music playing was everything 'Old School' Las Vegas offers you, it was a medley of Dean Martin, Frank Sinatra and various other artists from the day. You honestly felt like you had been transported back to the 1950's, you were literally looking at the front door of the restaurant want for Bugsy Siegel or Al Capone to walk in the front door. 

From the moment we sat down we were treated great by the staff. If you asked for anything they were on the ball and it was done. The staff brought out fresh bread with whipped butter and hard butter upon request. Our waiter 'Hector' arrived soon after our bread did and 'Hector' was one incredible waiter/server. Hector had us laughing, smiling and made our night so much more special than it already was. I am not a drinker at all and nor is my girlfriend but we will enjoy a glass of wine every now and then. We immediately asked 'Hector' what wine pairing would go great with a Filet Mignon, Hector quickly suggested 2006 Rutherford Hill Winery Napa Valley which was amazing. As I stated above I do not see what all the hub-bub is about wine and how is pairs with a meal until this glass of wine and this meal. The wine 'Hector' suggested was fantastic. It was so good (and by 'GOOD' I mean 'GREAT' and by 'GREAT' I mean 'AMAZING.') that several days after we left Las Vegas I actually called the restaurant to get the name of the wine we drank so we could purchase it on our own. 

My girlfriend and I were debating if we were going to split a Cesar Salad or also order Tomato & Mozzarella as an appetizer. We asked 'Hector' who asked what we were planning on having for dinner. We told him and he suggested we go with something lighter, we ended up just splitting a Cesar Salad 'Good call Hector.' For an entrée my girlfriend and I both ordered the 8oz Filet Mignon, my girlfriend ordered hers Medium rare, I ordered mine Medium. All of the side dishes are A' la Carte. My girlfriend and I decided to go with the Wild Mushrooms & Sea Salt French fries. 

Our meal was fantastic; you could literally cut through your piece of meat with a spoon if you wanted to. The steak was cooked to perfection. The edges of the steak had a char to it that complimented the Filet so well. I have been to several top end Steakhouses and nothing even comes close to Vic & Anthony's, I mean they are not even close to being in the same Ballpark. 

Right when my girlfriend and I thought we could not eat another bite of food 'Hector' brought the dessert menu and we decided to split a piece of cheesecake. Be advised one piece of cheesecake can easily be split between 2-3 people, so do not eat with your eyes here, order 1 piece=) We ordered out cheesecake with the blueberry dressing on the side and it was simply mind boggling it was so good. 

There are several other Steakhouses I want to try in Las Vegas but it is so hard to give them a shot when you know you are going to get such great service and such good quality of food at Vic & Anthony's. I am counting the day's until I can come back here and have another meal. 

My girlfriend and I wanted to thank 'Hector' and the entire staff for making our meal such a special one.

I don't say this lightly: one of the best steakhouse experiences I have ever had. Top to bottom, perfection. To start, the staff was attentive and competent. The hostess guided me to the bar, where a random waiter ensured that I got a seat. I ate at the bar -- Noah was the barkeep that night -- and wow he delivered. Noah has a deep knowledge of the food menu, as well as cocktails and wine. He even went so far as to sample up several different wine varietals that could pair perfectly with the steak. 

I went with the 8 ounce filet and lobster tail combo. Both came out superbly. Many restaurants err on the side of cooking a medium-rare steak too long. Not here: it came out just the perfect shade of deep red in the middle, yet still warm, and nice pinkness on the outside. The lobster tail was fluffy and tender -- no need for a knife, just melted off the fork. The chef himself even made an appearance to talk meat with the bar patrons. 

I am telling you, treat yourself to an epic dinner and get in here.

I was inclined not to review this place as I think now everyone will want to go there, but feel I must. Our server, Patrick was beyond compare.  We had a non foodie with us and he guided her thru the details of how to order a steak etc

Everything was served as ordered. Tip: share your sides, they are huge!

I'm sure we will return if no one else finds out about this gem located inside the golden nugget. It's most enjoyable even if a bit pricey

I started with oysters on the half shell.  I would not recommend that dish.  They were kind of small.  (I should have ordered the crab cake.)

I next had a rib eye steak that was cooked to perfection, with Bearnaise sauce.  The mashed potatoes and mushrooms were outstanding side dishes.

The service was attentive.

My fellow diners all agreed that we would visit Vic & Anthony's again when we return to Vegas.
I ate here in Dec 2012 while staying at the Golden Nugget.  Both the food and service were great.  Additionally, the restaurant atmosphere was very nice.

My husband and I are wine connoisseurs. We go to wine dinners and events regularly. We have dined at 3 starred Michelin restaurants, and we have NEVER EVER seen an unholy markup on wine as we did at this restaurant. In fact, the table next to us were saying the same thing. They were in total disbelief. Of course, there is significant mark up at restaurants for wine, but this was just plain insulting.

My husband got the $155 steak which was a rare beef and that was great. I got the prime bone in rib eye, and was severely disappointed. I get bone in ribeye regularly (it's my cut) at Fleming's, Mastro's, Ruths Chris and other high end prime steakhouses, and the bone is always long and runs across the steak. Here, it was a "bone" that was barely an inch! How is that possible? It just didn't look right or taste right--it lacked seasoning, and it was 3/4 fat. Rib eye is a fatty cut of meat, but I get it regularly and never experienced this much fat.

The sides were disappointing other than the mushrooms. Brussel sprouts lacked seasoning, duck fat potatoes would have been superb, but some pieces were not fully cooked. Au gratin potatoes were okay, but the consistency of the cheese was like Velveeta. I prefer a firmer cheese with a crunch at the bubbling top. Also, the creamed corn was salty. Weird.

Our bill came to about $550. Not worth it. Our server Luciano was spectacular, or I would have given it a much lower rating.

I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and  this is without a doubt the best steak house in Vegas. The service is unbelievable, the wine list will blow you away, and the food is incredible!  Go eat, drink wine and enjoy.

If you've ever eaten at an upscale restaurant on the strip, you probably have had the experience of feeling like you're in a fishbowl with everyone staring at you & judging how you're dressed. I know I have. 

What I really liked about dining at Vic & Anthonys, apart from the food (which was fabulous, more on this in a minute) was that I didn't get that "fishbowl feeling."  Not once. And the service was just as good as any of the five-star dining experiences on the strip. There were waiters, bussers, and servers filling your cup at every turn, never intrusive, always on the ball. I was impressed. 

The ambiance is old-school Vegas steakhouse, with old black & white photographs of celebrities gracing the walls, dark wood, wrought iron details, and lighting which made it cozy but not so dark that you couldnt read your menu (dont you hate that?)

We ordered the lobster bisque with cognac - some of the best bisque Ive ever had - and the quail for an appetizer. Id never tried quail before, it was tender, juicy, and the skin was crisped perfectly. My mouth is watering now just thinking about it!

I ordered the stuffed salmon in an attempt to eat (somewhat) healthfully. Salmon can be iffy, but I figured this place got a 4.5 stars, its bound to be good. I was mot disappointed. Wow, was it good! Lots of capers, just the right amount of sauce, i savored every bite. Surprisingly, the mashed potatoes were some of the best Ive ever had at a restaurant. My hubby was sneaking bites of them off my plate!

He ordered the special, a snapper dish that he also enjoyed immensely. 

Then we shared the vanilla bean creme brulee, which was big enough for two and also some of the best creme brulee ive ever had. 

Thats three items that were the top of the list for me, EVER. Id say that makes this place a 5+ stars. 

A few side notes: there seemed to be a lot of men dining here with other men. I think the ambiance made them feel more comfortable (back to the goldfish bowl thing again). 
Also, it WAS pricey. Most of the entrees were in the $40- $50 range. A few were lower, like the chicken and salmon. The alcohol was pricey too, the low end was $15 per glass. You're not going to get away with less than $100 for two. More like $200. But well worth it for a special occasion. 

Hubby said he'd love to make this his go-to place for special occasions. I wholeheartedly agree.  Kudos to the Golden Nugget. I really enjoyed dining here and will certainly do so again.
Very good food & very good service (& a great wine list too!)  A little pricy.  Would go again...

What can I say, this is my first 1* rating.   My girlfriend and I wanted a nice dinner in Las Vegas.  We reviewed yelp and Zagat reviews and chose this place.  The décor and ambiance are terrific, but that fell apart.  We were dressed for a 5 star meal, but not everyone in restaurant shared our wardrobe.  There was literally 5 or 6 tables were men were wearing ratty cargo shorts and tee shirts.  I saw a woman in yoga pants.  I was very disappointed to pay $50 for a steak and see someone that was barely dressed for Chipotle.    Our waiter, Jay, started out great, but fell apart later (details to follow).  We both ordered the same steak (NY Strip).   The price was $55 including the blue cheese topping.  Ala Carte, this is hefty, but I am willing to pay for quality.    My girlfriends steak was cooked well, tasted great, but was tough (very tough - we mentioned it to the manager but he did not seem concerned about it).  My steak I ordered rare.  It was medium well to well when it came out.  I cut it in half and called Jay over.  He agreed and cooked me a new one.  The steak part deux was not tough (like my girlfriends), cooked perfectly, BUT, I had asked me to put blackening seasoning on it.  I took a bite and had a Pierce Brosnan reaction in Ms. Doubtfire when his shrimp was too spicy.  They used Cajun Blackening.  This seasoning made the steak way to salty (and I like salt) and very spicy (and I like spicy).  I was not what I expected.  I informed Jay about the seasoning and he said he would investigate.  After that, we surmised Jay entered the witness protection program because we did not see him until the bill came.  This was strange, because we were discrete about our concerns.  When he did bring the bill I asked him about the seasoning and he said 'oh yeah' they ran out of regular blackening and used the Cajun instead.  True story.  I finished the steak.  When Jay did finally emerge from the shadows he inexplicably gave the check to my girlfriend (she quickly shuttle passed it to me so no damage was done to her wallet).
The check included $0 off for our issues.  For newbie diners, this is NOT usual for well-dressed well-mannered diner where the kitchen screws the pooch.
While I am piling on complaints, one more.  There is no restroom in the restaurant.  The restroom is literally half way across a crowded, smoky, dare I say dingy casino and that restroom, well let's just say it was not as clean as it could have been.  Again, for a high end dining place, I should not have to walk 4 minutes one way and get some free longshot horse advice from a guy in the next urinal smoking a cigar.  Not what I was expecting.
Overall, maybe we got unlucky.  However, I would recommend avoiding this place for 2 reasons.  1. Do not support a fine dining restaurant that does not enforce a dress code and 2. Do not support a restaurant that cannot resolve a problem.
Every casino hotel has a steakhouse, avoid this one AND the Circus Circus steakhouse.  Same problem there - no dress code, no problem resolution.

This place is AMAZING. My friends and I had the best meal we've ever eaten, here. We received great service, as well, including a table visit from the Executive Chef. This is, by far, the best steak place we've ever eaten.  If you go to Vegas, do NOT miss this place.
Absolutely delicious food and first-rate service.  Make sure to get the au gratin potatoes.

My first love is Smith & Wollensky in NY so I could only give 4 stars.  

The porterhouse was amazing.
The creamed spinach yummy.

We were leaning back trying to breathe after the steak but I had to try the croissant bread pudding.
It was worth the gluttony.
One of the men at the table never partakes of dessert and he ate almost half of it  !!!

You have to try it.  It is definitely 5 stars.  Yum.  Yum.

The service was fantastic, attentive and entertaining, not intrusive at all.  

Looking forward to going back for an absolutely fantastic steak and dessert.

This place was amazing , had the 8oz filet, side of wild mushrooms and Brussel sprouts. My girl had the salmon , we also had a couple of glasses of wine . Place is nice and dark but in a good way , cool atmosphere of old Vegas times , all the food was Delicious, Ofcourse a lil pricey but you get what you pay for , and that's great food , will visit again if in the area
Atmosphere and service were both exceptional. The food was delicious. We had lobster bisque, iceberg salad, Caesar salad, and the ribeye. All fabulous!!  We will return!!
top notch.  unreal good.  nuff said.

Swanky little restaurant inside the golden nugget! So glad we have this place a chance because it was good. 

Excellent & attentive service, old Vegas charm, great decor & ambiance, food was tasty, and good wine list. This could be a special occasion place OR come dressed casual. Just don't come dressed as a slob. ;)

I recommend the steaks, cream of corn, appetizers, and salads were good. We will be back again!

The creamed spinach tasted different this time, too intense with the cheese.

Amazing absolutely yummy! Steak was cooked perfectly !! Duck potatoes to die for! I also had the salmon that was so yummy!!!  Had the lobster bisque yum yum yum!!!Pleasant atmosphere glad we tried it! Perfect for celebrations!!

Four of us went for dinner on November 24th and we each ordered a filet mignon steak with a couple of sides to share. The steaks were so tender and perfectly seasoned. Sure, they are pricey ($42 each plus $14 for the "Oscar" style) but pretty much all food in Vegas is expensive. You'll likely forget your $25 breakfast, but you'll definitely remember the steak at Vic & Anthony's. 

We ordered some wine and other drinks with our meals, and had crème brûlée for dessert. It was a bit of an odd presentation, served on a plate instead of a bowl, but that allowed for maximum brûléed surface area lol. It's a good thing we were sharing - that's way too much sugar for one person. I prefer a deeper dish, but that's a personal preference. Still had a great flavour and texture. Excellent service, great food - overall a wonderful evening with great people.

Officially my favorite steakhouse hands down!  As if Vegas doesn't have enough to write about, this little gem is in one of the remaining standouts of what some call "Old Vegas".  The meal got off to a great start at the bar as we waited for our table.  The service was fast, the drinks were well made and naturally they were top shelf.  I was particularly pleased with the professional look and feel of the place.  Its very old school, mafioso, dark, white linen, with the sounds of clinking wine glasses and lively conversation in the background.  

The food:  Excellent!  Your steak is served as intended, well aged beef cooked to order on a hot plate...nothing else!  Fantastic.  The sides are of sharable portions so agree on one for every 2 or 3 people unless you plan on toting a box of leftovers around Vegas.  The mac and cheese is perfect as is the smooth and creamy lobster bisque.  The other members in my party had several cuts of meat and one had a chicken dish...my sincerest apologies for not having info on those.  Fact is, I wanted every square inch of space in my belly for the rib eye on my plate.  Like sooo many other reviews about this place, it was melt in your mouth good.  We also ordered a chocolate gnash desert that could only be made better by eating it off of your favorite super models body, otherwise it was absolute perfection.  

Service was superb.  Our waiter was attentive, informative and practiced.  He was professional and friendly.  Over all a fantastic experience.  I will definitely be returning.  Highly recommend this location to anyone.  You will not be disappointed.

Absolutely superb! Service, food, and atmosphere. This place can compete with any steakhouse on the LVS. Steak was fantastic, but if you don't order the crab cake, you have missed something special. Ask about the off menu 4 course dinner. Will be eating here every time I am in town!

Hands down, my favorite steak house in Vegas! Not only is it close to home, but I've literally never had a bad experience here....on the contrary everytime time has been amazing! From service to food and start to finish!  It blows my mind that some other restaurants in this companies portfolio disappoint? Because this place just blows not everything other steakhouse, but every other restaurant out of the water

They have some nice big boody over here: I'm talking about lobster tail....

Around Freemont there are many advertisements for $12 to $15 steak meals; I passed on those cheap deals for this place.
The taxi driver and two different store clerks said that this is the best restaurant on Freemont.  They were right.

What I liked:
The damn Filet Mignon that I've had!  It was so tender - it was almost tender like fish (I always order rare).  It was perfectly paired with the Peppercorn Steak Sauce.  If they sold it in a bottle, I'd buy it.
The service was very friendly.
The environment was classy, laidback, and filled with jazz music.
The prices are far more reasonable than the prices on the main Las Vegas strip!  (The filet was around $40 something)

What could have been better?
The Oyster Rockefeller had large juicy oysters, but was overall OK: too much cheese and spinach for my taste.  The chopped salad was nice but not outstanding.

Other notes:
I want to return and try the FREAKIN HUGE Australian Rock Lobster tails (they are on display).  It was the largest lobster tail that I've seen in person for sure.

BTW: The people who referred me to this restaurant just called it "the restaurant at the Golden Nugget."  

So definitely try the outstanding steak + peppercorn sauce and check out that lobster booty.

Went to visit our favorite steakhouse on our trip with friends last week, and again failed to disappoint.

We've tried most steakhouses in Vegas over the years, and this is definitely the one that is most consistently amazing...

The older arrogant, and a little rude waiter was a surprise this time, but he still got the job done with a little prodding.

Must haves are the bone-in Ribeye, and the Australian Lobster Tail. My wife's 8 ounce fillet cooked medium was also amazingly tender and juicy.

You must also have the Wild Mushroom side, and the creamed spinach and the asparagus is awesome...

Calamari starter was great too.

Wine is a little pricey, as is the food, so be prepared for that..2 cheaper bottles of wine and food for 6 was $900 with tip but the food is great..

Look forward to my next trip.

AMAZING i loved loved there sea food cocktail ..  i don't eat meat but my fiance and father were equally impressed.. large portions huge we weren't expecting such portion and ordered 5 sides , too much.  we had left overs for two days
Delicious! Probably one of the best meals we've ever had. I got the lobster mac and cheese and hubby got the filet mignon special they advertised. So yummy.
My new favorite steakhouse in vegas, and I've been to many. Great service, drinks, and huge portions. Make sure to share sides and desert, they're enormous.

What can I say that hasn't been said before about this wonderful restaurant nestled in the Golden Nugget... When I first visited Vegas in 2011 I tried this place and became hooked! Now it is at least a yearly visit for me.  I always find an excuse to travel across the country because of this restaurant. 

From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave you are treated to a wonderful dining experience. The ambiance is such that you can get dressed up and make it a formal dining night or make it a semi-casual evening filled with mouth-watering food.

The steaks are cooked well enough that sauce is not needed, but I love their peppercorn sauce so I always order it.  This time I ordered the creamed spinach as a side dish and it was all that you would think a creamy cheesy spinach dish should be. My husband ordered the 12 ounce filet and I ordered my usual prime ribeye. When the steaks came we didn't speak to each other until we devoured the steaks lol. 

Oh the drinks there are also made to perfection! There is nothing bad I can write about this place other than I wish there was one in Miami. :-(

Until then, I make a point to visit at least once a year.

Do yourself a favor and choose V&A among the many ..many ...many ..steakhouse choices in LV. V&A has a great neo old school vibe with it's dim lighting and Sinatra playing. The decor is rich and modern. The food is scrumptious. Just dive in with rib-eye bit make sure to cover it in the blue cheese bacon butter. Make sure you include a side of mushrooms and of course don't miss the duck fat potatoes (scalloped potatoes fried in duck with bacon and caramelized onions) ....perfection.

I'm sure this place is often great but it was run of the mill the night we visited for a business dinner. 

The restaurant seemed more concerned about themselves and their desired processes vs. the customers. Restaurant was extremely dark with no rest room. You had to leave and go through an extremely smoky casino. Not a big deal for a quick meal - but not a good setting for a business dinner where you're doing a lot of talking.

Food was good / very good. I wasn't thrilled with the recommendation from the waiter and it was just okay for the price. 

Worst part - they delayed us on the food order - and then brought out all our food at once! If this happens at Applebee's - no problem - this should not happen at a high end steakhouse. Even worse - the wait staff never took away my plates (salad) and it was saddled next to me for the duration of the meal. 1st class pricing with 3rd class service.

Again - I'm sure you can have a better experience here. I won't be back to enjoy it with you. Too many options in Las Vegas to sit in a dark restaurant with zero ambiance and so-so service and food at high end prices. I have no problem paying for high end food / service - I just have some higher expectations.

Vic and Anthony's is awesome!  Best seat in the house is at the bar.   Do not forget to order the crab cakes.  Best ever!    They really take care of you!    Ordered a bottle of wine and they were out so they gave us a complimentary bottle of $150.00 cab.  We go when ever in Vegas!

VERY GOOD FOOD! 

This is the second time coming here. We decided to eat here before the Gordie brown show (Which was awesome by the way) at the golden nugget. 

This place is very good and super nice. I liked that they made my buddy take off his hat, respectable..... I like that. This place would get 5 Stars but I think the price is a little high for what you get. None the less I would eat here again and both the steak and seafood was AWESOME here.

Wonderful experience all around! The atmosphere was perfect!  Photos of the rat pack, old Las Vegas and Elvis with great lighting and the old beautiful bar, comfortable seating make the difference! The ribeye steaks and salmon were delicious and perfectly cooked.  The crab cake was the best I've ever had!  It was huge and truly the best this 63 year old retired Colonel ever tasted!  We had two kinds of mushrooms that were perfect with our steaks. The creamed spinach and au gratin potatoes were amazing!! We had the velvet cake, key lime pie and chocolate moose and they just couldn't have been better!  The wine our extremely professional server Jay recommended was again perfect!   Do yourself a favor, go check out this wonderful experience, and ask for Jay!  We will always visit Vic and Anthony's when we visit Las Vegas!

We've been to Vic & Anthony's 2 times now and it's possibly the most consistently excellent restaurants we've ever been to (and we go to some pretty nice restaurants). We've had their steak, fish, and chicken, and several different sides, and all were excellent.

Literally everything is bursting with flavor in a way that is rare. I especially recommend the Brussels sprouts and mushrooms. But really you can't go wrong.

We rarely get restaurant dessert and I'm really over bread pudding, but succumbed to suggestions to try their "award-winning" version made from croissants (!). It was phenomenal!

Their service is also fantastic: courteous, attentive, friendly, professional without being stuffy. It looks and feels like an old-school steakhouse for old men with cigars but we're comfortable going as total tourists in shorts and T-shirts.

It's not cheap but it's totally worth it, and sometimes we go and split an appetizer and entree and get out of there for not a lot.

Jumbo crab cake is a MUST HAVE! Tons of crab, way less cake!
A++++ service! Biff, the manager and our server Laura were amazing! 
Potatoes Au Gratin were to die for! 
Also had the Mac n Cheese as a side....this was great too. 
Portions are giant and bring an appetite! 
5 star restaurant in my opinion.
Steaks melted in our mouths!!!!
Very happy customer and highly recommended! We will be back!

Amazing experience! I thought I was dreaming the entire time 

Staff was friendly and attentive. They did not miss a beat and were not overbearing. 

Our table started with the calamari and oysters. We each then got either a salad or soup before our sizzling plates of deliciousness greeted us. It took one bite to know I was hooked! I ordered the filet and it was cooked to perfection. We paired this with a nice Pinot noir. 

In case we didn't have enough we ordered the bread pudding. Even though we were all plenty stuffed , we were able to find room for this decadent treat!

By far the best steak I've had in years.  Great atmosphere and a truly elegant dining experience.  Attentive service without being intrusive.  This is a true definition of a world class restaurant.  I highly recommend this fine establishment.

I loved everything about this place. I'll try and describe why...

Ok, you know the pictures of your grandparents taken in a Vegas roundbooth in the 60's? It could have been here. The atmosphere was old school, the staff super professional and the overall vibe unpretentious and classy without being stuffy.

We ordered the heirloom salad which was the only thing we didn't love. We thought the vinaigrette was a little off - kind of tasted like creamy Italian or something. Not our favorite but I still wanted to give it 5 stars because I think that small shortcoming was trumped by a really impressive overall experience. We also had a couple of amazing Moscow Mules and for our entree we had filets, which were perfect, and delicious along with a baked potato - which was huge and more than enough for two, and asparagus. The cherry on top came in the form of a traditional and HUGE piece of NY style cheesecake with strawberry sauce. It was so big we had to take half to go. Our total check for dinner and 4 cocktails was $200 and worth every penny!

We are still talking about this place days later - always a good sign - and will be back asap!

I still dream about the bone in ribeye I had here.  Best creamed spinach ever (Peter Luger's being #2).  We went on a pretty slow Thurs night so our waiter was cool enough to bring us several samples of the huge wine list they have there at no charge.  I imagine very few places are better than this downtown.  You can't go wrong with this place!!

Service was great, food was decent. They sure rack up the random charges... All and all I would say they have good food, but it's definitely overpriced. I have had way better dining experiences for much cheaper.

This restaurant is simply amazing. It is my second visit here, both times with my daughter. Both times the food, ambiance, service were nothing less than exceptional. Our server last year, Victor, remembered us and although he was not our server this time he still checked on us multiple times, as did other staff. Our server Nick was professional and efficient. He made excellent recommendation in food and beverage.
I would recommend having creme spinach as an appetizer. Lobster bisque was 5 stars. I had chopped salad and it was refreshing. Steak was under cooked but still delicious.

une excellentes adresse un peu moins connu dans le vieux Las Vegas, galerie du golden nugget's (faite un petit crochet par la piscine et le toboggan qui traverse un bassin rempli de requin) 
dans un cadre hors d'age, soigné, et grâce a un service impeccable.
les plats sont raffinés, la cuisine et la présentation sont irréprochables.
la carte des vins est une véritable bible !
seul hic, la quasi perfection a un prix et pas des moindres.

Service & ambiance 5 stars, food 3.5 stars. I ate the lobster/steak combo. My steak was a little overdone & the lobster was on the smaller side with a sauce on it (I prefer it plain). We also ordered the ribeye (HUGE) and the crabcakes, which was simply awesome. One suggestion:    I thought that was strange not to have a restroom in the restaurant.  Use the restroom in the hotel before you dine here.

My wife ordered the lobster tail ($85) & I ordered the filet  mignon ($45).. We also ordered asparagus & creamed corn & wild mushrooms
As our sides..  In all fairness the meal was just okay..the service was top notch..
Our bill was ( $210.) without the tip & with no drinks...
If you want to go to THE BEST STEAK HOUSE  by far ..
Walk across the street to the four queens hotel, and go  to HUGO's
Cellar.. After eating there for more than 20 years, it simply is the best!!
We thought we would try Vic & anthonys, but realized quite quickly this
Place is just an average place to eat!!
Delicious food but it's pricey. The waiter was not very friendly otherwise it would be 5 stars. Recommended for special occasions and business dinners!

I like to write reviews on all types of dinning experiences.
But this one is going to be the shortest one I have ever written.
  - Drop the Microphone
SIMPLY PUT!!! EXCEPTIONAL Dinning experience.
OUT

Great service, Friendly staff, and one hell of a good Ribeye.  This place treats you like you're royalty, and I was with my family that aren't exactly high rollers.  It was one of the best meals I've ever had regardless of the price, which is much more of a bargain compared to Chris Ruth's or any other top steakhouse.  I'll be back for sure.

VEGAS OLD SCHOOL

I'm a trendy Angeleno.  I KNOW good food...especially steaks.  That's because LA is blessed with the swankiest steakhouses:  Boa, Mastro's, Cut ($130 filet mignon). 

During our stay in Vegas, my sweetie said she wanted to try this place she found on Yelp called Vic & Anthony's.  My face said "sure!" but I scoffed inside.  Why am I leaving our suite at Cosmopolitan, not to go downstairs to dine at STK, but to drive all the way to the business district of Vegas for...Vic & who?


My first impression was that this restaurant's decor was dated, sort of Sinatra old-school.  I scanned the room and was surprised it was full of people all seemingly in rapture with their meals.  Probably local Las Vegans whose desert-baked brains can't comprehend modern upscale dining.  I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare, no accoutrements.

Juicy.  Tender.  So good I sat up from my slouch.  I was enveloped by a wisp of humility as that savory hunk of steak yelled out to me:  IN!...YO!...FACE!

When my sweetie asked if my filet mignon was up to par with those from LA, I answered, "It's not bad".  

Damn, I really got ripped-off at Cut.

Wir sind hier zufällig hereingestolpert als wir durch das Golden Nugget Richtung Auto gelaufen sind. Es war hochpreisig, aber sehr gut. Es gibt trotzdem nur 4 Sterne insgesamt.

Essen

Ich hatte als Vorspeise den vom Kellner empfohlenen Eisbergsalat mit Roquefort. Eine riesige Portion bestehend aus einem kompletten Kopf Salat mit gefühlt einem Jahresbedarf an Roquefortkäse. War sehr lecker, Aber viel zu viel. Total übertriebene Portionen. Auch absolut nicht passend zu dem Ambiente.
Als Hauptspeise hatte ich Hummer mit Rinderfilet und Mashed Potatoes. Der Hummer war auf den Punkt, und mein Rinderfilet wie gewünscht Medium Rare und sehr gut. 
Zum Trinken hatte ich ein bayrisches Bier. 
Wegen der Vorspeise gibt es insgesamt eben nur 4 von 5 Sternen.

Service

Unser Kellner war super aufmerksam sehr toll! Super schnell klasse Beratung und für jeglichen Spaß (Foto schießen von unser Truppe Papa, Bruder und ich). Einfach gut und nicht diese aufgesetzte Freundlichkeit, die man un den USA oft erlebt. 5 von 5

Ambiente

Edles Ambiente. Wir fühlten uns KOMPLETT underdressed, wurden aber ganz normal bedient. Leider ist die Räumlichkeit sehr dunkel gehalten wodurch wir mit dem Essen ziemlich müde wurden. Auch die Klimaanlage war auf Eiszeit gestellt. 
Lautstärkepegel war sehr angenehm.
3 von 5.

Fazit.

Sehr hohe Preise, leckeres Essen, normale Getränke zu übertrieben Preisen (Wein aus der Moselregion für 700$. Hier steht er im Supermarkt für 10).
Würde ich nochmal hingehen. Diesmal aber besser gekleidet
Amazing food. Amazing service. The bread pudding was the best I have ever had.
Good gawd this is yummy... best steak I have EVER had... seriously!

WOW.  Yum.  Perfection.  Came here for my friend's wedding dinner in July...now, I wasn't expecting much...but everything was so delicious, I think that even the water was perfect!! hahahahah! !  The waitstaff was friendly and professional.  My favorite looked like Doc from Back to the Future; he even did a voice impression for me!  Everyone, EVERY single one of us was perfectly content with our meal:  from the calamari and tomato/mozarella (?) appetizers to the Salmon, chicken and Filet Mignon.  Before you leave Vegas, take your hungry butt here.

Excellent service, beautiful atmosphere and delicious food. Perfect way to celebrate my BF's 40th. The staff was extremely attentive and helpful with our selections. We had a promotional dinner special I received via email, it included soup or salad, 1 entree, 1 side and 1 dessert, per person. Turned out to be way too much food...we all ended up waddling away with "to go" boxes...but it was well worth it. The sides are enormous, they are meant to be shared so keep that in mind when ordering. For the 7 of us I would say 3 sides would have been sufficient. We had  2 potatoes, 2 creamed corn, 2 broccoli, and 1 order of onion strings. My favorite was the creamed corn (which I would have never ordered on my own)...and the onions strings which went well with my perfectly cooked filet. I also enjoyed the rich lobster bisque...had just the right amount of yummy, chunks of lobster. Delicious! But the real star for my sweet tooth was the creme brulee...it was HUGE! It's served in a shallow, but wide bowl so you had a lot of hard shell to share :). Although the promotion was an excellent deal, I wouldn't order again (way too much food)...That said, I will be returning...very soon.

I was not impressed with the wagyu NY strip and the crab legs were seasoned with sage (which it didn't say on the menu).  Great restaurant and atmosphere, but you would be better off with the filet and lobster.

I love this resturant, I wish I could afford to eat here more often. Our favorite waiter Ben was off so we had Patrick taking care of us. Everyone that work at this resturant is so freindly, we really enjoy the atmosphere here. Those darn crab cakes are so delicious. The bartender always make drinks really strong.
Very nice, romantic ambiance. The food was delicious and the signature cocktail that I had was good as well. Will be visiting the location in Houston for sure !

The steak here was amazing, and slightly blissful. A group of us went here when we arrived at Vegas to celebrate a friends bday. It was a great decision as it was the best meal we had in Vegas. I had the bone in New York, and it was cooked perfectly.

Some of the best service and food that I've had in Vegas. The servers are attentive but still give diners their space- a rare trait. Tried the ribeye, splurged on the caviar and had the wedge salad. All were impeccable and delicious. Dinner was so good that I almost forgot that I was at a work function. Yum.

We decided to visit Fremont Street for Christmas Eve.  A stroll under the lighted canopy and by the huge Christmas tree before heading to the Golden Nugget and dinner.  We arrived 10 minutes early and were greated warmly by the hostess.  They offered to seat us immediately or to let us enjoy a drink at the bar.  We chose to be seated immediately.

Our waiter, Hector, arrived quickly with the menus.  Bread, butter and water arrived before we even opened the menus. The sommelier accomodated our request quickly and spent some time discussing a couple of our favorite Paso Robles wines.  

Great choice for dinner.  Had a great meal, great service, and a reason to dress up on Fremont Street.

Thank you for a great evening.

If this place's prices were 20% less, I would give it 3 or possibly 4 stars.  This review is probably a 2.5, not fully a 2, but I can't go to a 3.  Don't get me wrong, it was a good, but not great meal.  The problem is that it's priced like it's Delmonico, Cut or Carnevino.  And, it ain't those places.  My wife had the special, which was crab stuffed lobster.  The lobster had a strong fishy odor, which indicated to us the lobster was not totally fresh.  Perhaps this was why it was used for the stuffed lobster rather than being steamed and served whole.  She had the filet, which was fine, but not overwhelming and certainly not worth the cost.  I had the ribeye, which again was fine.  Certainly better than your neighborhood Outback, but not worth anywhere near what they charged.  

Service was adequate.  The wine list was average I would say, probably decent for downtown.  If you plan on spending this much on a meal, I would recommend Prime, Brand, etc.....

A friend from London and I went because he wanted old school Vegas. He got it! This place was great! I loved the pictures on the walls. 
The food was outstanding. I got the porterhouse (my favorite cut), it was cooked perfect and mouthwatering. All the servers were attentive and knowledgable. 
I highly recommend the place!

We had a 10pm reservation on a Wednesday, got in town a bit late, got to the joint about 10:15 and decided to just sit at the bar have a drink, actually many drinks .
So we ate at the bar and it was a great dining experience. Not a huge fan of downtown Vegas, but had been years since I've been there. We shared the ribeye, mushrooms, and cheesy potatoes. It was all quite delicious and would definitely go back. Well at least from what I remember... :)

Consistency!!!!! This is the word that you can expect when dining here. Our visit this time was with a group of new customers that we needed to make a favorable impression with. Not a problem!!!! Over the top service, food was A+++, ambience for our group in private dining area was excellent. Menu selections for every taste!!

Maple glazed quail, prime ribeyes,  awesome mushrooms, and potatoes au gratin.

Enough said. You will not be disappointed. I have dined at fine steakhouses all over, from Chicago, to New York and between. Definitely worth the visit!

We haven't been here in years and had a dinner Tuesday night and went back Sat it was that good.  We eat at most the high end steakhouses in town but this place is really top notch!  Def have to try the traditional favorites like the ribeye and porterhouse!  All the sides and salads were huge and great!
My favorite steak house.  Excellent meats & seafood selection; great service & atmosphere; fine service too. Buoy can keep Gallaghers, RuthChris, etc

We were going off of reviews, good thing.  We were blown away.  People have become really picky and everyone is a critic. 
Lobster Bisque, 8 oz Filet, Au Gratin potatoes, Cosmopolitan, and Creme Brule.  All amazing, service outstanding! We can't wait to come back.  Don't deprive yourself!

Well, I thought I had been to some GREAT Stekhouses in the Phoenix area . . . boy was I wrong . . . this place puts them all to shame . . . from the atmosphere, to the service, to the food . . . I don't think it can get better.

We started by telling the Sommelier that we were looking for a good reisling . . . while he had three specials for the night . . . he actully recommened the lower priced one . . . and he was spot on . . . it was unbelievable.

Knowing we were going to be having desert . . . we did not opt for an appetizer . . . my wife had the wedge salad, and I the lobster bisque . . . both were very very good.

The main course . . . the 16 oz. prime ribeye eith augrautin potatoes and wild mushrooms . . . the steak melted in your mouth . . . the potatos very cheesy . . . and the mushrooms very tasty.

And finally desert . . . wife had the creme brule, and I the croisant bread pudding . . . I thought I had died to and gone to heaven . . . my wife, I thought she was going to move into the kitchen and live on creme brule for the rest of her life.

Pricey yes . . . but it is definitely worth a stop once a Vegas Trip . . . WE SHALL RETURN . . . .

I I went there on January 1, 2014 around 8ish. We were super casual and sat at the bar. I have been on a low carb for about 2 months and dropped like 20lbs for my wedding.  So all I wanted was CARBS! So I got a mushroom and chicken risotto and mac and cheese and a glass of Reisling I was eating like an animal. No really animals. ..my husband ate some white fish with a balsamic reduction sauce and vegetables and a Heineken.  

The bar tender was so friendly and nice despite our casual attire.  I could barely walk after wear those 4.5 inch heels for 9 hours..so a beautiful end of wedding day meal.

I like the dark, leather booth, steak houses around vegas and vic and Anthony's does it well.  there's a large beer, wine and specialty drink menu.  like most tourist places in vegas, the prices are high (16 bucks for a duvel). for dinner I had a Caesar salad.  it was very good.  the shaved parm, however, was a disappointing lower quality.  it lacked the nuttiness and crystallization of the real stuff.  for dinner I had veal Milanese.  it was pounded thin and cooked well but it lacked seasoning.  the veal should have been seasoned before breading and the breading would have benefited from some parm and herbs.  still, it was pretty good.  at 45 bucks i'm glad I wasn't paying.  finished with key lime pie.  it was ok.  service was excellent.

We enjoyed every bite. The Oysters were fresh. The filet cooked to perfection and could be cut with a fork. Our wait staff, Josh, was as good as it gets. He was knowledgeable regarding the food and the wine, making excellent suggestions. We will definitely return next time we are in Las Vegas. We felt extremely lucky to have found Vic & Anthony's.

Located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino in the Downtown area is Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. Classy w/  "Old Vegas" ambiance and style. 
To call this a "Steakhouse" is a disservice. This restaurant is flawless fine dining.
From the food, to the service to the fine details everything here is perfection.

My wife and I dined here on our recent trip to Vegas and had the absolute best meal I've ever experienced in the more than 14 years that we've been coming to Vegas regularly. Every course was perfect.
Honestly, we didn't even have reservations upon arrival at 6 pm and actually were somewhat under dressed upon entering but the hostess was kind and graciuosly seated us almost immediately.

Our meal:

Appetizers:

Soup of the Day: Chicken Tortilla - Rich and smoky w/ fresh grilled corn, cotija cheese & fresh toasted tortilla strips.
It was the perfect balance of  layered spice, crunch and smoothness.

Spinach Salad - Seriously the best sald I've EVER had! 
Warm, fresh leaf spinach w/ bacon, chopped eggs, kalamata olives & artichoke hearts served w/ a citrus honey vinaigrette. This could have served as the perfect light entree on it's own.

Entrees:

Jumbo Fried Shrimp with Broccoli and Mashed Potatoes - My wifes entree. Classic ingredients done flawlessly. She loved it. Simple,  seasoned and cooked to perfection

Sea Bass A La Nage - My dish and our servers suggestion. 
Chilean Sea Bass poached and topped w/ jumbo lump crab meat and paired with roasted baby vegetables. My favorite course of the night.

Dessert :

Croissant Bread Pudding w/ Caramel Ice Cream - Another of our servers suggestion as a must try dish and It was everything he promised and more.
Layers of Croissant stacked, combined and plated into a delicious bread pudding with cinnamon and caramel sauce and paired with a toffee brittle with freshly made caramel ice cream.  The actual plating itself resmbled a swan with a caramel ice cream body with a toffee brittle neck and head perched on a crunchy tuile and balanced with the bread pudding sliced into a triangle alongside. 

Overall, a wonderful meal and one we plan on repeating again soon the very next time we're in town. I especially can't wait to enjoy the Spinach Salad, Sea Bass & Bread Pudding time and again.
I think this place is great try the bone in rib eye price is high but you get what you pay for.

We had our rehearsal dinner here the Friday night before our wedding for 16 people and it was absolutely fabulous.  We went with their silver menu and I cannot express how delicious everything was.  I was so full from the jumbo crabcakes and shrimp cocktail appetizers that I could barely eat my perfectly cooked filet mignon or the au gratin potatoes.  Also, the slice of cheesecake they put in front of me I thought was to share with my fiancé, but then they put another slice in front of him.  I mean they were absolutely huge and the seasonal sorbet was delicious as well, ours was strawberry.  I know that everyone at the dinner fully enjoyed all the food since we took all the leftovers back to the hotel and every piece of leftover was eaten by the time we left the following Monday.  The servers were great as well with drinks, as soon as you started getting low, they would be asking you if you wanted a refill.  This was the perfect place for a smaller, intimate group dinner and hanging around Old Town the night before was amazing.  I will highly recommend Vic & Anthony's to everyone having their special day in Las Vegas.

Vic and Anthony's is one of the finest steakhouses in the country.  The food is exceptional and the prices are VERY reasonable.  I went with 10 guys and we all ate and drank for around $75 a man with tax and tip.  This was for a bachelor party too, so there were pleant of drinks served with that tab.  My only regret is no gettig the rock lobster tail to split for the table.  

Being in the golden nugget reall sets the scene.  The atmosphere inside the restaurant is great as well.  Service was 5 star also.  This is a must do while in Vegas.  Many people forget how fun old town can be and V&A's is worth the trip alone.  

Don't miss out on the crab cakes either!

Can't wait to go back.

I'm just going to be honest and let you all know that my memory of eating at this particular steak house is a little fuzzy because I had been playing blackjack and drinking champagne for, oh about 7 hours before realizing that if I didn't eat dinner now!, then I would have to eat at a diner or some form of 24 hour place and it probably wouldn't be as good. Also, Nick has a tradition of wanting to eat at a steak house at least once while we are in Vegas and this was our only chance on the short trip we took there recently.

With that said, I was pleasantly surprised with how much I enjoyed the meal and I'd easily go back again. I ordered a classic filet and Nick ordered a strip and both were cooked perfectly. We also shared some of the mac and cheese (sooooo good), the Brussel sprouts (eh, average), and a chop salad that I really enjoyed. And while I know it's not part of the menu, the bread and butter were worth mentioning as well. I'm normally not much of a bread person, as I prefer my carbs in the form of purer sugar, but man alive! I couldn't stop eating this stuff.

While it isn't the high roller steak houses you can find on the strip I think the quality is definitely great here and you also miss out on the waits and attitudes you might find in some places on the strip. Plus the cost, while high, wasn't as high as some of the other steak houses I've been in Vegas. More money for doubling down is always a good thing!

What an incredible steakhouse! This is my new favorite steakhouse in Vegas and I cannot wait to come back for more! All the food from the appetizers to dessert was incredible. But what we early made my experience here special was the wonderful service I received from my server, Victor, and the General Manager/Sommelier, Shawn. Both men were attentive, helpful, friendly, and knew their stuff! I've been staying at the Golden Nugget for years and this was my first time at Vic and Anthony's. I cannot wait to return!

The Bone in Ribeye is a great steak for a good price and it is 21oz. The flavor is very good, very juicy and perfect seasoning.  The staff is all very nice, attentive and have all the answers. The menu has an excellent variety,  with desserts also. We  will definitely be back to try more sides. You have to try this place.

Went here to celebrate the bf's birthday a few nights ago and it didn't disappoint in any way.  The restaurant is gorgeous, with a classic old time ambience.  We had the Alaskan king crab legs and rib eye with a huge baked potato and asparagus, both large enough for two big eaters!  The server and wait staff are wonderful without being overly attentive.  We'll be back!!!!!

Fantastic dinner  and the waiter was a older gentleman who knew his stuff and gave a great recommendation on the perfect glass of wine to go with my filet. A little expensive but worth every penny since it is a experience not just sitting down to eat your normal dinner. If you get a chance and your on Fremont street and you want a true dining experience hit this place up!!!!

I have been coming here every year for my Birthday love the food but this year not sure what has changed my husband steak was burnt, asparagus was burnt my crab legs cold the worst part we both got sick 30 minutes after eating after we finished dinner took 20 minutes to get our check to leave we won't be coming back
Love that salmon. Love the heirloom salad. Lobster of always fantastic. Wedge salad. Yum. Club soda yum. Ribeye very good. And cremes brulee

Me and my wife  went to the Vic and Anthony steakhouse in Texas and it was one the the best in the country for steak. Had a great experience.  We got dressed up and did the whole 9 yard. So for our anniversary  we travel to Vegas . We figured hey it's a little pricey but what the heck. Let's go for it and splurge.  We both got dressed nice. Her in a fine black cocktail dress. Myself in a sport blazer,pants and a headdress. Recently I have be wearing my hair long so it keeps it nice and neat, tied back and out of my face. We were staying at Bellagio and wore something very similar to Picasso for dinner the night before. Not a single problem there.  And was treated with the utmost respect and services.  Not at Vic and Anthony steakhouse Vegas. Don't worry we will get to the food very shortly. The hostess sat us down and asked me to remove my hat in the dining room.  I told her it's not a hat it's a headdress.  She walked away.  Than the waiter came to take our order and asked, "Would the gentleman kindly remove your hat?" I told him it was not a hat and this gentleman would like not to be asked again.  Than the manager came and as me to remove it. I told him that this headdress is culturally accept around the world and is also used by many religious group and can be very offensive if asked to be removed.  He looked at me like I drew the race card on him. I noticed how the whole senerio was making the evening unpleasant for my wife so I reluctant removed it. Than we noticed a older man in jeans and a cowboy had behinds us. To the right of us a group of people in shorts and t shirts.  You know the ones with the US flag on it. The food was  2nd rate. But the service was awful.  Never have I been made to feel so uncomfortable in a restaurant before. As we sat there I noticed one more thing. The only minority present was me.

Really nice service. Made a reservation in advance and we were seated quickly which is nice to not be kept waiting.

Our server was a seasoned professional and knew good customer service and timing.

Drinks and appetizers came out quickly and the waiter recommended the best dishes.  Never felt he was pushing certain dishes as he asked what we liked and recommended accordingly.

Steaks were cooked perfectly and served hot.  Side dishes were well prepared and did not disappoint.  I had the ribeye (no bone) and my dining companion had the 12 oz fillet.  Both were perfect and delicious.  This restaurant knows how to cook a steak!

Passed on dessert but wished we had room for it.

A great dining experience!

My only complaint is that they don't have a restroom inside the restaurant.  You have go out into the casino, but all in all not a big deal.

I was really hoping this would be the best steak I have ever had. Instead it was just good. The staff was great. The flatware, glassware and china was nice. But the steak was only good, not awesome as I expected. I had the filet and lobster tail. Vic and Anthony's was highly rated as one of the best steak houses on the strip and I really didn't think the steak measured up to the rating. The potatoes were really tasty though.  
For desert, we ordered the Creme Brulee and Key Lime Pie. The Creme Brulee was the worst I have ever had. It has a very, very light sugar top. It covered a pudding-like substance, and the dessert was served in a large saucer! Never seen that before. Overall, it was horrible.  But the service was on point all night from the beginning to the end though.
Wow! The whole experience was absolute perfection. The crab cakes are the very best. Luciano was our waiter and I have never had better service. Enjoy!

This has slowly escalated to be my favorite steakhouse in America, and I've been to them all. What I also love about this V&A's is the consistency of quality through the years. I've been to other steak houses that were hit or miss, but not here!

Best damn crab cake outside of the North East. True lumpy crab meat, not all shredded up and mixed with fillers.

Great oysters rockefeller.

Insane scallops and grits with tobacco vinaigrette!

An australian lobster tail that probably can feed 3.

And how do you add to the creaminess of ice cream? By adding foie gras! So they did. It sounds crazy, but very good! We walked out of here 5 pounds heavier, with smiles on our faces.

Over priced, over rated, and too big headed!  If only they had told us the creamed spinach side was the same glop that had put on the oysters rockefeller, we wouldn't have paid another $10 for it.

This food is mediocre at best. I had the Halibut special.  The fish was dried out and fishy.  My husband had the Steak which was dried out on the outside and almost raw on the inside.  It was definitely not medium rare. 

Nothing comes with your meal and every side is almost $10. Would have been better off at the coffee shop.

We came here after our wedding for dinner and it was so very delicious. The Caesar salad was the best ever and our steaks were fantastic! Everything was great. Highly recommend if you're looking for a suburb meal.

Good service, dark, pricey, but decent eats.   

I wanted a good steak. I knew this place was pricey, which it is, but I was craving meat.  My girl ordered the steak-lobster special and I ordered a 8 oz fillet, we both ordered them medium rare.  
When the steaks came I was instructed to cut into the center and check it, if you dont like it we can fix it.  I'm like what?, but I'll get to this in a minute.  So the steaks come, hot as hell, I'm guessing they didn't even let it stand, anyway we cut into them as instructed and the suckers were cold and raw in the center.  It was even too rare for my girl which She will basically eat hers usually very rare.   The waiter instructs we we can just heat that up more.  Ok here's what I find wrong.   Medium rare should be warm in the middle, even by just pressing on the steaks I could tell it was rare.  Shouldn't a steak house charging these types of prices know better.  Once you cut the thing in half then put it back on the grill its going to dry out.  Away, so they give it a good again, steaks come back, plates hot as hell, but the damn thing is cold in the middle, huh?   The servicer quickly says , I have them make another one and hes gone.   So what comes out is this tiny fillet thats about 3/4" thick, dry and over cooked.

    At this point, I realize this is not going well, I just shut my mouth and eat.  I'm  not all that hungry, since I was snacking on her lobster, which was good.
