The pesto and basil mash potatos were very good.   So in the end, I left not filling my desire for steak from a steak house, bummer.  I can't knock the service, I found the service to be excellent, but in the end the steak was the disappointing.

Amazing! You can't do better if you're crazing a steak while in Vegas. From the moment we walked in everything was perfect. Delicious ribeye cooked medium rare along with a side of potatoes and asparagus, both sides are big enough to share. Thanks to Shawn for picking out our wine and servers Luciano and John who both took great care of us on separate nights. Next time I'm in town I'll make sure to come back!

It was very good , Just not 5 star has that old-school feel, all dark wood and low light. It was a busy weeknight (the rodeo was in town), so while service wasn't super speedy, we were acknowledged quickly, and our server was very sweet and personable.

Went there for a celebratory dinner, and was wowed by how great the food was. Filet mignon was very flavorful, wife's tuna was superb, side dishes amazing. Even vanilla ice cream had deep vanilla taste.  Wait staff capable and friendly.  Pricey, but for a special occasion well worth it.

Great meal; great steakhouse. Loved the steak & side dishes. I had the 8oz fillet Mignon and appetizer of raw oysters & a side of broccoli. 
My only complaint is that the waiter was not friendly, nor unfriendly, he also did not warn us about the size of the side dishes. Our group of 6 ordered 5 and were overwhelmed. We expected better of the waiter. Otherwise it would of been a 5 star. Though, other tables seemed to have had better staff serving them. We will try them again on our next trip to Vegas

This was one of the best, if not the best, surf and turf dinners I have ever had... my filet was amazing and the lobster was sweet and prepared perfectly!  We had the steakhouse salad before dinner, and it was to die for! 

The restaurant itself is full of swank, lots of wood and leather with low lighting. The wine list was great and the service was awesome. The waiter went above and beyond for our party and brought out a dessert sampler that was amazing! Even the after dinner cappuccino I had was great!! Unbelievably awesome meal!

Hate to be the bad review guy, but here goes. Dressed to the nines, the wife and I step out to dinner at this joint. We've been dining out in Vegas for over 20 years and this is a first. Upon being seated I am asked to remove my hat as they have a no-hat policy. I think to myself, must be fancy, as I remove my hat and begin to enjoy a great dinner. Food and service was very nice. As I am enjoying this succulent filet mignon, I notice that most other guests in this place are dressed for an outing to Wal-Mart.
Shorts, dirty tee shirts from 80's rock concerts, etc.. I ask the waiter why they are offended by people wearing hats. His answer was very polite as one would expect. Hate to ramble here, just make sure you don't wear a hat around these folks and you'll have a great time.

Great restaurant.   Food was excellent. I had the Bone in Ribeye and Au Gratin Potatoes. If you visit ask for Mike. Very Knowledgeable waiter who made great suggestions and recommendations on both food and wine.

Was there last night and Got the oysters as app with the tomato salad.  Oysters were awesome.   Salad was just ok.  Split Australian lobster and the 60 oz tomahawk steak for the table.  Perfect.  Augratin potatoes were to die for!!!  Service was adequate.  Server was attentive but not overly friendly.  Drinks were good. Bit pricey but that what you pay at a steakhouse! Very good!
One of the best Steak house in Vegas and that's in the good old Golden Nugget casino / hotel.

Simply put - one of the best meals ever !  Annette was our server and she was great - very professional with a sense of humor as well.  Their portion sizes are large and cooked to perfection.  Ambience was very nice - dimly lit, nice pictures on the wall to look at.  Well worth every penny.  You are actually made to feel "special" here.  Highly recommend this establishment located inside The Golden Nugget.

Wow!

What a meal!  I was there with 3 other guys and we totally feasted! The atmosphere inside was perfect.  It was dimly lit, great pictures on the wall, inside the Golden Nugget and just the perfect MAN CAVE.

Big goblets of wine, very attentive staff and the food was excellent.  

I suggest the bone-in rib-eye...you will not be disappointed. Typing about it now makes me want to go back.  The sides are huge and enough to share so - if you have a table of four - each of you get different sides so you can try something else.

The onion straws, the sauteed mushrooms, the potatoes...all excellent!

I love this place and would go back in a heartbeat and would tell everyone to check it out! 

It's totally worth it!  Plus...you're in Vegas, c'mon! Live a little!!!
Au gratin potatoes are amazing. Both steaks I've tried we great. Service? Meh.

24 Oz. Bone-In Ribeye. Medium Rare! 

Again, maybe I'm not the Steak Connisseur most of you are who frequent these establishments. I definitely have more of an Asian Fusion Tongue of sorts. But I did love my Bone-In Ribeye from Ruths Chris long ago. I had a great steak at what once was 3950 at Mandalay Bay. And I loved N9ne at Palms.

But this experience at Vic & Anthony's was Amazing! Maybe I wasn't expecting much as we were in Downtown Las Vegas, where the entire area just reeks of something so different from the likes of Mandalay Bay, Caesar's Forum Shops or even Restaurant Row down Flamingo. But it's not very difficult to recognize great service, a tasty steak, and some decent ambiance!

Like I've mentioned, I had the 24 oz Bone-In Ribeye that just may be the best steak I've ever had! Aged to perfection, and cooked EXACTLY the way I wanted, soft and juicy on the inside, some great seasoning along the outside, especially around the bone. This steak was so good I have been craving another every day since I left there! Also in our party - a Ginormous Lobster, the Sea Bass and a no-bone Ribeye. Everyone was completely satisfied with their entrees as we didn't even get to the asparagus and other sides!

Our server was extremely attentive and friendly as she also recommended a great red wine to go with our meal and threw in a couple of desserts for us to share for our birthdays (3 July Birthdays and 1 August Birthday), I thought she went completely out of her way to do that for us, but it totally completed a Great Evening there. The Creme Brulee and Chocolate Cake really did finish off our meal to Perfection!

Can't recommend it enough! Another Wonderful Dining Experience with Great friends, Great Food, Great Service!

The food here is incredible.  I was recently here for business and our group of 16 went here for a celebratory dinner.  That's not such a great idea if you're on a budget (like we were), but you'll quickly find out it's worth it, even if you are.  We were in a secluded room above the main dining area and had one server who was fantastic.  He had a lot of help, so the food was always hot and timely, but it was a feat nonetheless.  He was happy, knowledgeable, and on top of things.  He was also knowledgeable about Vegas and stuff to do, so he helped us with some useful ideas for what to do on Fremont St after dinner. 

The food was the reason to come, though.  I ordered the Chicken Claire or Jaime (can't remember and it's not on the menu online), which was Chicken Scaloppine. Totally mind-blowing.  Best chicken I've ever had.  The guys sitting next to me with their filet and lobster were a little disappointed they didn't have what I was having.  The only problem was that there wasn't enough, after I shared it with half of the table.  The others said their dinner was really special, too.  

We also had most of the sides (duck fat potatoes were the hit) and desserts (pass on the creme brulee and get the bread pudding), but the main courses were exceptional.  I'm sure there are a lot of amazing restaurants in Vegas, but this one was worth the price if you're looking for a quality steakhouse with great service.

We had an excellent experience.  Service, food, and just the overall experience was perfect.  If you are looking for this type of experience and are willing to stray from the Strip and pay for quality rather than popularity/trend then go! You won't be disappointed!

I've been to some of the best steakhouses in the states and this one takes the cake. Service was amazing always making sure you are well taken care of. 

I had the bone in rib eye and it blew me away, my wife had the three pound Maine lobster which I helped eat which was great. The apptizers were awesome being from Florida we get good seafood but the oysters rockefeller omg it was the best I ever tasted, the wife had lobster bisque I sopped up every bit with the bread on the table. 

If your looking to take your wife to a intimate dinner this is were I would go.
This was the best porterhouse steak in Vegas at the Golden Nugget and our waiter Matt was amazing in explaining the menu and specials with us.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere of this restaurant

Excellent deal and meal had by all. Had my 47th birthday meal here with two of my boys. Had reservations for 7:30pm and moved it to 9pm with no trouble. Had the Distinctive Dinning Deal, three course meal and a side for $49.99. Had the wedge salad, 8oz. Filet mignon, green bean, and chocolate mousse cake. Was great! Highly recommend this steakhouse and that V&A, keep this deal. It brought me in and I'd use it again.

On June 30th, 2014, my wife and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary at our favorite Las Vegas Steakhouse, Vick & Anthony's. Out server Dennis was awesome, not missing a beat with his attention to detail. The food was amazingly delicious, as always. Thank you Vick & Anthony's staff for helping make our anniversary memorable! We highly recommend Vick & Anthony's Steakhouse. 
The Soto's
Best steakhouse in Las Vegas.  Excellent service, the food is amazing, and they have a great wine list.  Try the wild mushrooms, I swear the sauce with that is made with crack, it's that good.

The atmosphere was excellent. Our waiter was very helpful although he did say something inappropriate or maybe it was a skit, I don't know. That my fiance must have a twin or it was him in the night before but with another woman. I thought it was funny, my fiance on the other hand DID NOT. I ordered the NY strip steak with the blue cheese bacon butter sauce. Mine literally tasted like what I cook at home. Not pleased at all. My fiance ordered the special of filet m. steak, mashed potatoes and lobster tail. He is a harsh critic when it comes to food. He was very satisfied with his meal. Although he did not enjoy the sauce on the lobster tail. Also, I tried a bite of the lobster tail per fiances request with the sauce (I dislike seafood) and not only was it good, it was phenomenal. I was very surprised.

We came here for a small reception dinner after our wedding at 702 Weddings. This place is to die for. The steaks melt in your mouth, you don't even need to cut them with a knife, they are cooked to perfection. Writing this review 4 days later is making my stomach rumble and mouth water. This is fine dining, and yes it is very pricey but reasonable for what you get. The waiter warned us that the sides are meant to be shared, we ordered broccoli and wild mushrooms...... they were fabulously cooked, and seasoned perfectly. I would not change a thing. Yes, the steak is a piece of meat that comes on the plate, by itself. It does not need to be garnished, it is perfect by itself, it is rich and flavorful. All these low ratings for it being expensive.. HELLO it's a steak house, mind you a FINE DINING steak house, go to outback plebeian if you want to complain about the cost of your steak vs quantity/quality.  Also the low ratings about garnishing, again HELLO steak house,  you're getting a steak or meat... it's not coming with anything unless you ask for it. Also if clearly states on the menu upgrades for  sauces on your steak will cost you, so people complaining about hidden fees/cost, learn to read. Honestly, I'm 28 years old and I understand how to read a menu and how to punch in numbers on my cellphone and decide whether I can afford to eat some where. 

If you're looking for a seriously nice dinner that you'll remember, come here. And please at least dress nicely. Nothing ruins ambiance like jerks who wander in with jeans and a T shirt.

One of the finest steakhouses I have visited; comparable to a Maestros, but with service that's a notch better.  We were constantly tended to throughout the night, never having to search for someone.  Great wine list with tons of options to chose from: big appetite? Try the 32 oz. bone-in.  Steaks were perfectly seasoned.  Personally, I opted for the 12 oz. filet, which was filling as they bring tons of bread.  The calamari was the best I have had hands down. This will be my new go to steakhouse anytime I am in Sin City.
Tomahawk steak was excellent! Lobster was nice and juicy! Service was excellent! They even went as far as providing something that was not even on menu!

My husband and I come to vegas 4 times of year and stay on the strip. We always make it to this steak house which is in downtown. This steakhouse is in old town vegas but worth the drive and effort. Service is above and beyond but the food is 5-star above any steakhouse in Las Vegas. Ambiance is very welcoming for a original las vegas hotel. We always have crab cakes, unreal chop salad, filet migion with recomended wine parings. Please try sanbucco as after dinner drink. You'll fall in love as we have. As of today over 9 visits and looking forward to the next one.

If not perfect, close enough.  White table cloth, mostly male wait staff.  Extremely attentive.  Perfect for a night out to make a special someone feel, well, special.

Fresh bread was served.  Appetizer was prompt.

We both enjoyed our steaks tremendously, cooked to our specific taste.  I can honestly say this was the best steak I've had in years, beating Chicago and certainly Virginia easily.
Amazing! We truly enjoyed our dining experience - a second visit for us. Ever bite was filled with flavor. . .the atmosphere and servers excellent. We will be going back again!

I love this place. The food here is incredibly delicious. It's located in the Golden Nugget. We were seated right away, but of course we had reservations.

I ordered the filet as my entree, medium rare. This was one of the first times I wished I had ordered it medium. It was seasoned really well and had great flavor, but a couple more seconds on the flame would have been perfect for me. They have a variety of specialty cocktails. I can't wait to go back! Too bad there isn't hoverboard parking or else I'd be there weekly.

We ate here when we visited Las Vegas.  The atmosphere was very classy and relaxed.  We started off with amazing salads and fresh bread.  We also had cocktails, that were great.  But what was really amazing was the steak and chicken.  Everything just melted in your mouth.  But if you eat here you absolutely have to have the creme brulee.  It is served on a plate instead of a dish.  The best meal we have ever had by leaps and bounds.  If we go back to Vegas, we will be stopping back here.

I was seeing a show at the Golden Nugget and I decided to try Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse for dinner.  I was taken upstairs and given the first table at the top of the stairs.  It gave me a good view down the steps of the people walking by the restaurant.  That area of the upstairs is somewhat narrow and I had my back to the room so I couldn't see more of it.

Very quickly, I was brought water and my order for iced tea was taken.  My server, Victor, came by and told me about the specials for the evening with prices--a nice touch that some restaurants don't do.  You have to ask them about the pricing.  I ordered lobster bisque for a starter, their 12 ounce filet, an order of sea salt fries (I was advised that this was small and manageable for one person, and then chocolate mousse for dessert.

I was brought warm bread and a plate with piper butter.  Nice presentation.  The lobster bisque  was finished with cognac and it had a fair amount of the cognac flavor in it.  

I ordered my steak blue--Victor asked if I wanted it seared 1/3 inch on all sides and I said yes.  The steak was about 2 inches thick and the searing was just perfect for not cooking it too much.  The interior was very rare, exactly the way I like my steak.  The fries were good with a large amount of salt on them.  If you're watching your sodium intake, get something else.

When it came time for dessert, I asked for suggestions.  Victor recommended either the crème brûlée or the chocolate mousse cake.  For the most part, I find crème brûlée to be almost the same from one place to another so I opted for the chocolate mousse cake.  That was the correct choice.  It was creamy, chocolaty, and simply a great way to end the meal.

Service throughout was great!  My iced tea was replaced several times with no need to ask.  The only detriment was the group of five very loud men at the next table.  Because of the narrowness of the restaurant here, I heard the whole conversation including talk of Leonardo DiCaprio and other personalities from an insurance guy.  Go figure.  All this while using four letter words quite liberally.  This was something the restaurant can't control, but it was a drawback from the overall enjoyment of the meal.

Finally, you're paying close to Strip prices for a downtown steakhouse.  It is worth it because the filet was very, very good.

This place has the best and most flavorful steak I have had in a long long time. The waitress was attentive and the menu was mouthwatering. I had the bone in ribeye with crushed peppercorn and I haven't been able to stop thinking about it since and it's been over a week now. It's located in the Golden Nugget and it is a must stop for anybody looking for a great steak dinner in Vegas

If you are looking for an inexpensive steak dinner, Vic and Anthony's is not where you should be focusing your attention. That being said, if you are looking for a great steak and are willing to part with a few Andrew Jackson's (or more), then Vic and Anthony's is worth a visit. All of the steaks come ala carte and the side dishes will set you back a few bucks as well. 

I opted for the 8 oz. Filet Mignon and Garlic Mashed Potatoes. The steak was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were outstanding. Although the side dishes are a little pricey, the portion size is generous enough to share. I would rate the steak and mashed potatoes as some of the best I've ever had.

They also offer chicken, fish and lobster, but all in our party opted for beef. I will say the Australian Lobster tails on display looked rather tasty though. If you are a salad aficionado, they have you covered there too with eight to choose from on the menu. They have a fairly extensive beverage list, including specialty drinks, wine and bottled beers. 

The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was what you would expect from a high class steak house. Located inside the Golden Nugget Casino, the clientele ranged from those in tuxedos and dresses, to others in blue jeans and T-shirts. Typical Vegas tourism in an upscale environment.

My 8 oz. Filet was $41 and the side dishes ranged from $9 - $12. The three of us split two sides, or Accompaniments, as the menu refers to them. We ordered a Crab Cake appetizer (not listed on the menu) at the recommendation of the waiter. It was outstanding, despite the $21 price tag for one four ounce Crab Cake.  For dessert, I went with the Chocolate Mousse. One in the party got the cheesecake, which rivaled any I'd seen before. All total, for the three of us, including a few adult beverages and the tip, we left happy and satisfied, even after dropping just north of $300.

If you are looking for a great meal, in a great atmosphere with outstanding service, and don't mind dropping a few bucks, I would recommend Vic & Anthony's. Their menu is also available on the Golden Nugget website, so you can peruse it before you go.

Ive been around... to make it short when me and the fambam hit the road from Vegas to Buffalo NY 1st thing we did when we reach our hotel/motel for that night is YELP the BEST STEAKHOUSE that city can offer :) price doesent matter I will order the BEST STEAK that steakhouse has to offer... 95% of the time its going to be a BONE IN RIBEYE which is my all time fave food too... Vic and Anthonys PRIME RIBEYE is soooooo good that it seperates itself to  my 2nd place... or take it from my cousin who IS 100 X MORE EXPERIENCE THAN ME... his also is certain Vic's & Anthony wont even craack his TOP 10... he was sooooo WRONG...not only it replaced HIS #1 but Vic's is the 1st thing he'll request when he visits Vegas... it will knockout your #1 too GUARANTEED...and us a added bonus the service is GENUINE and gets my 1ST 5 star rating ON SERVICE... I dont write reviews just for one reason its NOT WORTH IT lol... Vic's and Anthony's gets my BEST STEAKHOUSE AWARD and BEST SERVICE AWARD

Great service and delicious food. We ordered the petit filet, porter house and New York. All steaks were well flavored, tender and cooked to perfection. We also tried the tomato and mozzarella appetizer, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. All were delicious. Very pricy but you would only expect that in a place such as this. Well worth it. Highly recommend.

This place has so many good reviews already, but let me just try to further persuade whoever is deciding if they should go to Vic & Anthony's for a good piece of meat and excellent service. 

I took my family here for my mom's birthday on a Sunday night.  A party of five.  We arrived fifteen minutes late from our reservation.  We had to wait for a couple minutes and were seated shortly after.  I love the mahogany decor and the dimmed lighting - very romantic.  

Our server, Victor, was very nice.  I was skeptical of his nicety at first - thinking he is going to try to sell me the most expensive item on the menu.  As it turns out, he kind of knew what he was talking about.  He recommended a promotional red wine, which our party loved.  The boyfriend ordered a bombay sapphire, and he liked it.  (He then finished up the bottle of red wine also.)  

For appetizer, we had the steak tartar, the infamous crab cake, and a dozen of the fresh oysters.  All were delicious except for the crab cake.  Not that the crab cake had anything wrong with it, but it was "a crab cake with an edge" to quote the boyfriend.  It was chunky crab meats, which is always a plus, but it didn't have as much flavor to it as I would have liked.  So go ahead, give it a shot if crab cakes are your thing.  It was by no mean terrible.  The steak tartar was very fresh - no one got sick afterward.  The oysters - almost comparable to those served in Santa Monica, CA. 

Our group shared a caesar salad and the spinach salad (recommended by Victor), and they were also delicious.  The spinach salad triumphs the caesar, however, in my humble opinion.  The spinach salad is tossed with this honey vinaigrette, that is to die for, really.  It is a very flavor dressing but not one that weighs down your palette.  It leaves a fresh, light, summery feel to your mouth after each bite.  We also tried the lobster bisque, and it was also very good.  However, Joe's Stonecrab at the Forum Shop might have a slightly better one - just slightly... 

Onto the entrees!!!  We had the bone-in ribeye - medium rare, prime ribeye - medium, organic lamb chop - medium rare, and the shrimp scampi.  The bone-in ribeye was to die for!  I mean, the meat literally melted in my mouth!!  The perfect texture and temperature - I couldn't believe that I had found a better place for ribeye (Flemin's and Joe's was previously my favorite.)  The prime ribeye was good, but maybe because it was cooked to the temperature of medium, it made the texture a bit tougher than I'd like, but still very good.  As for the lamb chops - I don't personally like lamb chops, but I had a bite, and to my little knowledge with lamb chop, it was passable.  The boyfriend had the lamb chops, and he killed it - finishing it by picking up the rib and torn what was left off on the bone.  Lastly, the shrimp scampi was good, but I think by the time we tried the shrimp, we were so full.  What was interesting with this shrimp scampi was the sauce - it was of a spicy tomato sauce, which was very good with the fresh ciabatta bread they serve throughout our meal.  

We also had the wild mushrooms and mac and cheese as sides.  No one, except the boyfriend, liked the wild mushrooms.  Mac and cheese was okay...  Nothing special. 

We didn't have dessert since we had cake at home, but they do have the largest scotch menu I have ever seen.  

Last but not least, I promise to wrap this up, the service there is great!!!  I mean, I am a true believer of good, friendly customer service.  If they serve good food, but terrible service, I wouldn't see the point to come back.  Our glasses were always filled, and Victor was so honest about what was good (or maybe the menu just didn't have anything bad...)  Anyways, the service is what made me give this place the fifth star. 

I hope I have convinced those who want to come to Vic & Anthony's but are skeptical of going downtown to the Golden Nugget thinking how could downtown has good steaks to offer.  I was skeptical once, but now I am a true believer.  I would definitely come back to Vic & Anthony's.  

Enjoy!!!

Superior service and food make this place a standout on Freemont St.  The wait staff happen to be some of the best I have encountered over the years.  The food was delicious and cooked to perfection.  If you do decide to go get a reservation as I did to help get a seat promptly.  The restaurant is in the Golden Nugget which has become quite the hot spot since it has remodeled.

We had my birthday dinner here.  AMAZING.  Everything was perfect.  I had steak and lobster with the duck fat potatoes and my husband had steak, baked potato, and we split a Cesar and oysters Rockefeller.  Flawless.

The service was quick and our waiter was very nice, I think Patrick was his name.  

Pricey but worth it

Had another stellar meal here during a staycation at the Golden Nugget. Only the noise level and TVs in the non-separate bar stops this from being a 5* review. They are serving high end food, at big ticket prices, while food and service are top notch, it just takes away from the ambience to have patrons yelling at the NHL game during a meal, IMO. YMMV. 

Our waiter started us off with cocktails and suggested the Shrimp & Crab Martini appetizer, it sounded chaotic: jumbo shrimp, crab claws and lump crab meat with kimchi
slaw, plaintain chips to "dip" out of eponymous glass...but boy did we love it! Very unique, and a great kickoff to set the tone for the meal. 

Forgoing wine for a second round, he had the filet mignon special served with truffle mashed potatoes and asparagus, savoring every bite. My twin lobster tails were perfectly executed, we shared a side of spinach which was simple and delicious. Before dinner, we (I!) decided to order the Artisan Cheese Board in lieu of dessert: it was magnificent, we battled over the accoutrements as much as the five excellent cheeses which were chosen by the Chef. 

This was a superb meal, with 5* service throughout, Vic & Anthony's remains a favorite steakhouse in Las Vegas, but for a quiet, romantic evening, not my first choice. 

* great for group celebrations *

** still have fantastic gynormous whole lobsters & the biggest tails (3# is not unusual ) I've seen in Las Vegas  **

*** my pics do not do the food justice, but I abhor flash photography in fine dining settings ***

We were greeted and seated immediately according to our reservation. Our waiter was very nice and courteous. All was well until the bill came.  We were never told of the "upgrades" made to out steak and to our surprise ended up paying twice as much without notice. We had clearly pointed to what we wanted on the menu. When brought to the attention of the waiter he said there was nothing he could do.  We knew the cost per plate and were expecting to pay for our meal but feel when we clearly pointed to what we wanted regardless of what's being offered bringing out what was suggested is not a way to upgrade and stick customers to unwanted items.

The bottom line is the rib eye was the best I've had in 20 years, seriously. I've been to the finest steak houses all over the country and only a couple of them served me a rib eye as delicious and perfectly cooked  as I received at Vic and Anthony's.


This is only the second time I've been compelled to write a positive review on Yelp. I usually use Yelp to find ethnic and other interesting restaurants but this time I used it to find a good steak house and I was pleased to see the reviews were accurate.

We were a little worried about leaving our beautiful hotel on the strip to go to the Golden Nugget for dinner but after reading the Yelp reviews we had to take a chance.  I told my wife not to worry because we weren't going to be hanging out in the Golden Nugget just eating at the restaurant inside. First, I was surprised that the Golden Nugget had been remodeled to pretty high standards. Second, Vic and Anthony's makes a very nice initial impression and it frankly it doesn't really matter what casino it's located in because you'll only see it coming and going.

apologies for the late review Yelper's, we had dinner there January 31st.  Jimmy was our server and he was terrific!  First class service with excellent attention to detail.  We had the filet and it was cooked perfectly.  

Going above and beyond, I asked Jimmy if he could help arrange a car to take us back to our hotel.  He did that and Shawn, one of the managers, walked us out to the car.  

It was my girls first experience at Vic & Anthony's and she loved it. 

Great job everyone!
The best steaks expensive but worth it  very large portions that can be shared we have tried many prime steak houses in town this rates with cut and envy

Our experience here was that of an average steak house, comparable to Ruth's Chris. Except Ruth's Chris has better calamari. Sorry.

Maybe it was the high expectations from the raving reviews, maybe people who reviewed have been to the Outback too many times, I don't know, but Vic & Anthony's, while good, didn't stand out at all.

Like a good steakhouse, they're going to give you a black napkin if you have black pants on. They're going to put it on your lap for you. They're going to expect you to use your forks and knives in the right order and take them away as the courses progress. The steaks are going to be about $30-$50 bucks. You're going to order sides to share. Your steak is going to be served on a hot plate and they're going to tell you to cut it in half to make sure it's served correctly. It's going to taste well seasoned and melt in your mouth.

This.... I can get anywhere. So is there anything else that makes me want to come here rather than any other steak house? No.

The only note of originality here is that the wedge salad is huge (too big, really). The Prime Ribeye is also A LOT OF MEAT. 

The Au Gratin potatoes are covered in a Velveeta-like cheese that sticks to your mouth and sits like a rock in your stomach. Not in a good way.

They have a good wine list and I recommend the Cab/Syrah wine by the glass if you're leaning in that direction.

Still giving it four stars because there's nothing to really complain about... the food was good, the service was boring but standard... there's just nothing to rave about. For $150 bucks we were pretty well fed, but I'd rather have spent it somewhere else.

We went out with a couple of our friends and had a great time. This was our first time here and I do have a few complaints as well as praises.

1) At first, when we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that we couldn't valet unless we were staying at the hotel, and that the garage sign said it was full. We drove around for about 10 minutes before asking again about the garage, and were then let in after telling the guy at the gate that we had reservations. When we got into the garage, it wasn't even close to full.

2) We called ahead and made reservations and then had to wait almost 30 minutes to be seated. There were people that just walked up before us, with no reservations and still got in before us. What's the point of making reservations?

3) The saving factor was that once we were in, the customer service was good and the food was excellent. 

My wife and I had a whole lobster, which ran about $90 by itself. We had the crab cakes for the appetizer, which we shared with our friends. They ordered oysters that they shared with us.

For the main course, we both had blackened ribeye and a baked potato. We had other food that we tried as well, but when it was all said and done, we spent about $385 with tip. Our friends spent $140+ tip.

It was definitely worth it if you're looking for somewhere very nice to eat. We sat and talked for about 45 minutes after we finished the meal and they continued to serve us water and iced tea (what I had). Not once were we rushed.

If I didn't have the parking and reservation complaints above, they would have gotten 5 stars from me.

Located inside of the classic Golden Nugget this restaurant is one the best in the city.

Pairing my filet mignon with a house red, the au gratin potatoes, brussel sprouts,  a risotto and topping my steak off with foie gras butter was simply one of the best dinners I've had in Las Vegas - and possibly at any steakhouse nationwide. The steak was perfectly cooked and had amazing flavors. The risotto special of the night was done so well, I was shocked at the thought of eating anything below its quality - the same can be said about the au gratin which were deliciously cheesy but still perfectly balanced. Additionally the brussel sprouts were fully seared and done perfectly as well.   

I sampled the crab stuffed salmon and was pleasantly surprised by the plump amounts of crab and freshness of the salmon. The bone-in rib eye I sampled we excellent, and paired with a blue cheese sauce brought out the texture of the cut while adding a creamy texture to each bite. 

Our service was outstanding, prompt, and took care of our party so well I was simply impressed. What really made the experience standout was the time we came in - nearly 20 minutes until closing and still everything was excellent. 

5 Stars - this location will not disappoint!

Wow never thought old Vegas would have theee best restaurant in Vegas our family decided to spend Christmas in Vegas so we made reservations for Christmas Eve and it was by far the highlight of the trip the service was top notch I ordered a bone in ribeye my go to at any steak house and this one was the undisputed best enjoyed it with a side of Duck fat potatoes and my mouth still waters thinking about the Bread pudding desert I have had countless trips to Vegas and have eaten at many restaurants and this is absolutely the best

Terrible service from Jay! We went here for my cousins 21st birthday. It was a family dinner, there were 12 of us, including my 19month old twins! We were seated, it is a nice place like any other nice steak houses in Vegas. When the waiter, Jay, came over to take our order, I felt he was very rude!! He acted very impatient with us, as if we couldn't order fast enough. When I would try to ask him a question, I felt he ignored me! He pretended he could not hear me. This happened quite a few times. They also didn't leave he right number of water glasses on the table so when we let him know, he made my mom feel as if she was bothering him!! It was terrible!!! 

Then dinner came out... And the steak was actually pretty good!! They were cooked just the way we ordered, which I have found a rarity in the steakhouses around Vegas! The salt they sprinkled on top really made the difference!! The creamed corn was delicious! Kids loved it! Mashed potatoes were not good, over whipped and you could taste it was really gummy. My mom ordered the plain 3 oz lobster... But our waiter Jay brought out the stuffed lobster. Well my mom thought it was what she ordered and we didn't know until we reviewed the bill later in the night... But Instead of her $30 lobster she ordered, He wrote down the wrong thing (feeling as if it was an intentional mistake) and charged her $80!!! So watch out!! Clarify your order because they can be sneaky!!!! 

And RIGHT after dinner came the bill!!!! Not once did Jay ask if we wanted coffee or dessert!!!! We had two tables side by side to fit us all, well the other table got coffee, he didn't even ask our side!!!! Who does that????? Very rude!! 

I truly feel our waiter Jay did not want to "deal" with any of the women at the table, he just wanted to talk to the men!!  He was the one who brought the credit card back to the table for us to sign... He handed it to my dad (it was my card), so I told him "I'LL TAKE IT!" Loud enough to make sure he heard me!!! He then handed it to me and said "this card?" I said "ITS MINE!" And once he knew I was paying, he was all smiles and thank yous! "Thanks for coming have a great evening blah blah blah!" Unfortunately the tip was included since we had such a large party. He was lucky it was!  Not sure if I would go back there because of JAY! For $400+ I expect MUCH better, more respectful service!!!!!! 

The gentleman who bussed our table, Richard or Ricardo (I can't remember his name!) he was amazing!!!!!!! I wish he was our waiter!!! So attentive, very polite! He acknowledged my kids!!! Made sure no hot plates were in front of them!! Where as Mr Jay put a giant steak knife right in front of my son! Hello!!!! Moron!  

Hope the steakhouse smartens up and hires more appropriate staff!

Simply Outstanding, What a wonderful evening at Vic and Anthony's, the service is always outstanding and our waiter (Luciano) was very knowledgeable and professional.
  Now , to the food , for myself , the Colorado lamb chops were delicious , cooked to perfection, and served with a flavorful mint jelly, bread was warm and replenished as needed, I truly enjoyed it. My dining companion had the tuna with a pear salad and enjoyed hers as well, the companionship, service , quality of food and over all ambience was top shelf across the board, so good in fact I had to make it back, pan seared chicken one night ( moist , flavorful , perhaps best piece of chicken I have ever had) and then another round of the chops on another visit. 
 Check out this eatery  in downtown at The beautiful Golden Nugget , you will be glad you did.

What can I say that hasn't already been said...maybe that the food is orgasmic? :")  My new husband and I enjoyed a meal here during our honeymoon.  From the moment we walked in, we were impressed.  The staff is extremely professional and courteous.  The ambience is classy yet relaxed.  One can (and should) dress nicely but we saw many shorts, cargo pants and even a wife beater.  My husband is a big fan of single malt scotch and we were fortunate enough to be served by John who knows more about scotch than anyone we've ever met! 

The food was superb...so much so that I moaned throughout the meal! ;)   I enjoyed a perfectly cooked 8 oz. fork-tender filet mignon, pan broiled rock lobster tail and grilled asparagus.  My husband went for straight beef and tackled a perfectly cooked 12 oz bone-in rib-eye.  We shared a side dish of creamed spinach which was topped with seasoned broiled breadcrumbs.  To finish the meal, we shared the homemade cinnamon bread pudding with a scoop of gelato.  

Every bite was scrumptious and we were able to enjoy our meal at a leisurely pace. The staff here is helpful but unobtrusive so we were able to enjoy a very romantic time together.  Do not miss this place when you are in downtown Las Vegas!

I've eaten a lot of steak in this town, more than I should.  But what a delightful surprise this restaurant was.

Mother in law was in town a few weeks ago, and we were running late to the Gordie Brown show.  Originally we were going to try the steakhouse at the El Cortez, because I had a restaurant.com certificate, but we took so long showing her the strip we just didn't have time to go there before the show.  So we came here instead, because we could have a quick meal in the same casino.

We were seated right away, without reservations.  My mother in law and my husband had the fillet, and I had the ribeye.  They had a really nice surf and turf going on that night and I should have ordered that, but for some reason the ribeye was calling me, even though I mostly order fillet.  I guess I didn't want to copy everyone at the table.  We also ordered lobster bisque, caesar salad, and the potatoes gratin, spinach, and asparagus.

I have never seen my mother in law get excited about anything we have eaten, in Las Vegas or anywhere else.  Mostly when we go out to eat, she constantly complains about the expensive price of restaurants outside of Montana, and acts like she is mad we went out instead of cooking.  She did have a fit at first about eating here looking at the prices, but after tasting her food she loudly exclaimed "oh my god, this is so good," and shut up about how much it costs.  But this is a woman who grew up on a farm mostly in poverty and worked for the government her entire career, raising my wonderful husband alone, so I cannot be mad at her attitude about it.  I try to take her occasionally to nice places because, well, she deserves it.

Every steakhouse in town I have eaten at always has something not executed correctly, or the quality of food isn't that great.  This literally was the most perfect steakhouse meal I have had.  The meat was so flavorful that my husband still dreams about it, and was executed with the right amount of char that we love at the perfect temperature.  Sides were so perfect and good they could not have been better.  Lobster bisque had lots of nice chunks of lobster in it.

I'm not sure why Carnevino and Cut and some of the other steakhouses are considered the best in town, but this really blew everything I have eaten away, including CraftSteak which was garbage compared to this meal.  Maybe I will try Carnevino and Cut next just to compare!
Absolutely fantastic! Filet mignon was perfect and the mashed potatoes were to die for. Dessert was delicious as well. Must say, fantastic customer service!!!! A must try!

Great steakhouse with wood and leather decor with Art Deco stained glass chandeliers. Wait staff is attentive without being obtrusive. A half pound of crab legs was plenty for me, but they also offer a full pound serving size.  TIP: the quail appetizer can also be made into an entree size. Definitely save room for their croissant bread pudding.

ABSOLUTELY LOVE THE AUSTRALIAN LOBSTER TAIL.  Can never find the same size any where else!!!

Had reservations, but ended up waiting an hour!!!!!!  ..... minus 1 star.

Let me start by saying it was simply outstanding.  The ambiance was first rate, as was the food and service.  I frequent a lot of steak restaurants,  up this is now on my short list of favorites.  Our steaks were perfect and most delicious, the side dishes were large and delicious and desert was delicious.  Prices were perfectly typical for a fine quality steak restaurant, so no complaints there...I felt it was a good value.  The real standout, as funny as this may sound, was the creamed spinach...wow...really.

There are a few other very good steak restaurants downtown, but I might say the Golden Nugget may have an edge because IMHO it is the nicest downtown property.

Once again, yelpers did not disappoint!  Based on the reviews, I ordered the bone-in rib-eye, which my partner and I shared.  

It was juice and flavorful and even though it was pink and bleeding just a little (which would ordinarily gross us both out), we thoroughly enjoyed it. 

We very nearly went back the next night to have the identical steak but couldn't justify being in Vegas and not trying another glam restaurant.  (We headed to the Eiffel Tower restaurant instead.)

We also ordered the steakhouse fries and the green beans, both of which were not stellar. 

I was also not impressed with the creme brulee -- not warm enough and just didn't have the kind of flavorful zing to justify all those calories. 

We're not big wine drinkers and relied on the waiter to suggest something.  He suggested a $20 glass which we passed up so he brought us a taste of the Shiraz instead.  I could swear that the full pour he brought was not the wine we tasted.  In fact, it tasted damn near close to two-buck chuck shiraz.  

However the steak was the saving grace.  If I went back, I would have ordered different side dishes and not relied on the waiter for the wine (or get a cocktail instead), but that steak justifies the 4 stars.

Outstanding service, Excellent decorMarvelous steak, Lobster bisque is to die for. Creamed spinach and the au gratin potatoes made to perfection. Would have given it 5 stars but wine list is a bit pricey. Desserts were all outstanding with tbe bread pudding winning the best reviews.
Be sure to ask for the prix fixe option. Outstanding deal $50.00 per person for a 4 course meal.

My new York was good. Boyfriends bone in rib eye very average if that.  Mini baked potatoes inedible.  Service way too enthusiastic.  Everything was fabulous according to our waiter.  Such was not the case

Overall an average steakhouse. Steaks were not cooked to order but only slightly off. Not enough to complain to management but enough to complain to your dinning partner. When we ordered a side of lobster tail with the large steak we assumed it was a side. But it was actually the $169 monster tail that we would never have ordered as an add-on. The appetizers and some sides were good but the potatoes au gratin were salt with a side of potato. Place has potential but not enough for me to go back

A great steakhouse in the old "rat-pack" Las Vegas tradition.  Great service!  

Perhaps the best creamed spinach in the country!

Pricey food.  A good, albeit pricey wine list.

But, this place is simply excellent for steakhouse cuisine, suck it up and pay for the quality....

I think Vic & Anthony's is, by far, the best restaurant downtown. I live in downtown Vegas and try to patronize the area as much as possible and I'm glad I tried V&A.
My wife is in a wheelchair, and we had to wait a bit for a table, even with a reservation, because of the stairs to certain parts of the dining room.

No matter, the servers were all very solicitous, without being overpowering. All of our needs were met quickly; we never waited for anything.  Everything was delicious...Darlene had the lobster and filet special; I had bone-in ribeye. I've dined in many steakhouses here in Vegas, and this is up with the best (LV Weekly had it in its 2nd town). It's the slightest notch below CUT/Carnevino/ Prime triumverate. If I could award 4.5, or 4.7, I would. I just cant give it 5 stars, due to the ADA-unfriendly dining room and the fact that the above 3 (and apparently Ramsay and Old Homestead)are ridiculously sublime. But on a price/location/quality nexus, this place is in the top 10 in town. (Going back next week)

The most incredible meal that we've ever experienced. Our server Ben was amazing! Every dish he recommended was perfect! The crab cakes , the lobster bisque , wedge salad, beet salad, filet mignon , the ribeye , the Mac and cheese, scalloped potatoes and chocolate mousse, were to die for....pure heaven!!!! Did we say how much we loved our server, Ben! He really made the experience unbelievable!

Service was excellent, wait staff was very well versed on the wine selection and pairing options based upon our aggregate food order. The food was perfectly cooked with high quality ingredients. Be sure to indulge in a shared dessert as you won't be disappointed.  The creme brule was to die for.
I went there last night with my wife. I ordered a Filet medium and it taste real bad. To soft and no taste. Never recommend that.

Had a staycation at the Golden Nugget for Christmas. Decided to go all out and splurge! My bf and I prob spent about $250 on dinner and drinks. It's a pretty pricey place. Had apps, steaks, sides and drinks. Omg def one of theeeeeee best steaks I've ever had! 
If you're looking for a great steak this is the place to go!

We were rather apprehensive when we arrived to the lights of downtown Las Vegas in that night, but felt like you were stepping in to a different world when we went in the restaurant. Very traditional surroundings. My brother and a friend of mine loved their steaks and thought the filet mignon was one of the best they had had and cooked perfectly to their taste. The sides were good and the waiter was helpful and friendly. The only small negatives were that the restrooms were a trek through the casino which wasn't ideal and the red wine was rather too chilled. The air con was also a little fierce. We were too full for a pudding put the neighbouring table ordered what looked and they confirmed was a rather spectacular cheesecake. A lovely evening and would recommend if you are a steak lover.

If you are looking for a really great steak but don't want to pay the crazy prices on the strip, Vic & Anthony's is the place for you! The food and wine were FANTASTIC and we loved the dark, intimate, old-school Chicago steakhouse feel of the place. If you're staying on the strip, coming to Vic & Anthony's is also a great excuse to check out Fremont Street, a must-do in my book!

Hands down the best meal I have ever had!! The filet mignon is the best steak.  I love this restaurant.  We go to Vegas every year and we look forward to Vic and Anthony's each time.  I have recommended this place to many people and every one of them have LOVED it!!!  This place is top notch from the service to the fine dining.

Amazing Dinner at the Vegas location!! We made a reservation but arrived early and opted to dine at the bar. Service was fantastic, great recommendations on both food and wine. Scallops cooked perfectly, the potatoes au gratin were the best I've ever had! All that being said the steaks were still the star!! We were too full for dessert but finished with a 100 proof Irish whiskey the bartenders recommended that perfectly finished off the experience! With full bellies and hot cheeks we hit the floors to gamble.  Definitely a recommend!!

I can't say enough about what a perfect experience we had at Vic and Anthony's. The oysters in the half shell were so fresh and perfectly briny. Had the filet, which melted in my mouth, it was spectacular. The service was impeccable.  Expect dinner to cost a grip, but for a special occasion this place is one of the top in Vegas.

My mother and I were excited to spend our recent winnings on a great steak dinner and Vic & Anthony's turned out to be a major disappointment. After seeing the 4.5 star average on Yelp I was expecting greatness, however the food and service were mediocre/poor. I hate to give negative reviews, but this place deserved it in my mind. I hope my Yelp friends who gave this place 4 or 5 stars would crusify me.

My mother had the Tuna Tartar with avocado, citrus vinaigrette & chips. We both liked it, but it didn't blow us away. I ordered the Prime Ribeye with the au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. My ribeye came out and we were told the side dishes were coming in "ten seconds".  A few minutes later our waitress came by to see how everything was and I informed her that I still haven't started to eat my steak since I am waiting for my sides. She assured me they will be out shortly. Seven minutes after my steak they finally came! Bullshit! I expect my sides to come out at the same time as my steak so I can enjoy them together. I think that is pretty standard and not an outlandish request. When they were brought to our table there was no apology for the delay. Unlike other steakhouses I have been to Vic & Anthony's didn't serve the first scoop of the side dish onto your plate. I know that makes me sound like some regal, high expectation asshole, but I'm sorry, that's one of the many things that makes the best steakhouses stand out (Mastro's for example). I wasn't crazy about the creamed spinach and the au gratin potatos were waaaaaaay to cheesy for my liking. The steak was not what I was hoping for.

Lastly, our waitress was inattentive, unfriendly, unapologetic, and I don't think smiled once throughout our meal. Maybe it was an off night, but when you are paying big bucks for a nice steak dinner there should be no off nights. I'll be back in downtown Las Vegas in two weeks and I will be sure to avoid Vic & Anthony's.

Just inside of the Golden Nugget lies an intimate steakhouse in the midst of chaos.  

A friend and I decided a steakhouse was on our palette for the evening.  We walked in without reservations.  Luckily they do offer a full menu at the bar.  The three bartenders who helped us out were readily available with professional helpfulness.  

Noah suggested the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake was not to be missed.  I concur that it was indeed a treasure on the appetizer list.  It's definitely jumbo with so much crab packed in.  The flavor of the sauce enhanced the full flavor of this lovely cake.  

I am always thrilled when my friends want to spilt entrees so we can try more than one item.  This evening it was split between Roasted Salmon and Filet Mignon.  The steak was medium and perfectly pink.  It was so tender that it felt like slicing through butter.  The steak was delicious that it didn't need any sauce or extra seasonings.  

The roasted salmon was good being served over asparagus and potato purée.  The roasted salmon was supposed to be stuffed with Gouda and Jumbo Lump Crab but I didn't taste much of that if any.  I still enjoyed the dish very much but has room for improvement.  

The broccoli we ordered on the side was really eye opening! It was as if two huge heads of broccoli were steamed and put on the plate.  Yes this side will feed a village! 

It was a pleasure to dine here and I look forward to my next visit!

Everything was amazing. Went here for a year end bonus and enjoyed every bit from the lobster bisque to the bourbon caramel bread pudding. The steak was perfectly cooked and wonderfully tender. The oysters frsh and the cucumber mignet was refreshing and tangy.

Oh so fabulous!!!!

Best steakhouse we have ever been to.  The filet steak and fish are out of this world!  Best au gratin potatoes loaded with cheese.  Friendly servers!  Love the music as well.  Have been here 3 times and will always return.  The desserts are also amazing!

Good, solid, upscale steak joint in Golden Nugget.  Old-school style and large portions.  Went in before a show and if its the weekend, better make reservations since its an institution.  The bone-in ribeye fed two us up with some left over.  The Caesar salad is one of the best in town.  service is attentive if a little rushed but activities are split up so you get lots of attention.  I do wish they had a little more room around the tables as its pretty cramp and gets loud and bustling.  Small compliant for an otherwise really good place downtown.
Dear Vic & Anthony: If, as a steakhouse you can't do french fries, its does not instill confidence that you can do anything else.

A second visit, and a second 5 star rating.

We wanted somewhere exceptional for our wedding night, and after evangelizing about the porterhouse for 6 months after I first tried it, my new wife was keen to try Vic & Anthony's and see what the fuss was about.

Suffice to say they stepped up again and delivered the best steak I've had the pleasure of. Our server this time was Matt (I think - he had an awesome 'tache!) was brilliant, kept the drinks coming, the tone fun and friendly, and upon finding out we were 4 hours wed brought us a free desert and drink. 

The cocktails are delicious, mad strong, leg stealing and delicious. Highly recommended.

I love this place, and can't wait to get back there in the fall.

One of the great things about living in Vegas is that we have some of the best restaurants! Last night we had a fabulous dinner at Vic & Anthony's Steak House. The Tuna Tartare and The Steak Tartare were delicious, the Filet was so tender it melted in your mouth, the cream of corn and the potatoes were delicious. The service was impeccable.

I am giving this place four stars even though I want to only give three and a half.  

Pros: the wait staff was awesome and very attentive.  The food was all cooked to perfection (which one would expect when buying $30-50 entrees).  The maple bacon was AWESOME.  The salmon tasted good and came with a side of potatoes.  Saw Nicholas Cage there.

 Cons: food was too expensive.  My in-laws picked the place, so I went, but the thought of a $50 steak (and nothing else on the plate) makes me want to puke.  The music was too loud. Even my kids, who are super noisy, thought it was too loud.  The lights are so dim you can barely read the menu.  The steak, while perfectly cooked, had no discernable taste or flavor.

Having eaten in their Atlantic City Location and given it top reviews, we very much looked forward to our dining experience here in Vegas our here on our annual Golf trip with 8 Hard core restaurant Gentlemen who are very much a difficult bunch to please.  So we roll downtown into old Las Vegas where we normally dine next door at Hugo's Cellar but thought we would give this place a try. 

Arrive to bustling place heart in the Golden Nugget where our party of 8 is seated immediately at a nice round table.  Service is brisk where OK bread is provided as we peruse a fairly overpriced wine list and a similar menu as its NJ counterpart.   Everything is Ala Carte and pricey as a top steakhouse is but if they deliver you don't mind 

After selecting some wine we are off to the races. 

Wedge Salads with Blue Cheese "Homemade" dressing is truly outstanding with a rich Roquefort cheese chunked in.  

The Shrimp Cocktail were large fresh and cold but the cocktail sauce in short was extremely disappointing. 

Cesar salads were OK nothing special. 

Entrees: 

Veal Chops Absolute perfection, grilled and charred to proper temperature and as tasty as they come. 

The Rib Eye's were in short OK but not as good as the Veal Chops. 

I'm not a filet Mignon person and this large piece of prime beef did nothing to change my mind as it simply has no flavor. This is a personal preference. 

The NY Strip was top notch. 

Sides were good but not great as baked potato was a disappointment while the mushrooms were excellent as was the creamed corn. 

Service was 100% outstanding all night. 

All and all a bit pricey, gratuity of 20% already added on so no problem there, but I've had better steakhouse experiences for the price points, and I certainly think they A.C. Please is much better. 

Good but not great is the only way to describe the experience.
Outstanding Steak and wonderful bar service.  We missed our reservation at another place, and the hostess put us at the bar, which was top notch, and great entertainment

This place is fine dining at its best. Attentive service and delicious food. This hidden gem located inside the Golden Nugget was a refreshing change in decor, ambiance, and service. Both the veal and filet were cooked to perfection and practically melted in your mouth. I loved the au gratin potatoes - I would come back for the potatoes alone. The strawberry basil martini was a little strong but I enjoyed the flavor. I would highly recommend this classic steakhouse.

Well here we are again 1/15/17 at Vic & Anthonys First are waiter Patrick was spot on with great service friendly conversation. We order from the Distinctive dinning menu (Which you need to print off and bring with you $52 each ) Great food Ceasar salad , Lobster bisque,  Main entree 8oz Filet Mignon perfect. We split a side of Asparagus yummy.
Desserts Chocolate mousse cake 5 stars My favorite Croissant bread pudding The Best.

Ate here for New Year's Eve. I had  the 8 oz fillet. Was prepared perfectly. Au gratin   potatoes were good as well as mushrooms. Wife and mother in law had the salmon. They spoke highly of it. Great service from Matt. Great place on Fremont.

It is located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel & Casino in Downtown Las Vegas. Don't be fooled, its surprisingly very nice for downtown! The atmosphere is extremely classy and although our waiter was super knowledgable and nice, the hostess was not. She didn't smile, and seemed like she didn't want to be there. Also, even though we had reservations, it still took about 20 minutes to get seated and it seemed we got seated at an awkward table right at the entrance. 

The steak here was delicious but I do wish they had a smaller sized cut that was not a filet mignon (i like a lot of marbling, something the filet mignon cut does not have). Definitely cooked to the right temperature. Everything you can ask for in a top tier steakhouse. In comparison to Mastro's and Ruth's Chris, I would say the taste is slightly less than par. Don't get me wrong, still delicious but nothing out of this world. With all the steakhouses in Vegas, it wasn't so good that I'll return here again. 

Try their crab cake! (Singular, because theres only one). Super chunky crab meat, great flavor and great sauce. If you want to make your visit extra special and different from other steakhouse visits, you must try their crab cake! 

I believe our total for 2 was about $150 and we got the crab cake and a side of creamed corn.

One of the best steakhouses.  This place is excellent with the old Vegas feel.  The food was excellent.  Service was great which I tried the waiter's recommendation of the pear martini to start the night off.

I will definitely go again next time I'm in Vegas.  I tried this place based on all the Yelp reviews.  Thank you all for posting such wonderful reviews and pictures.

My bf and I ate so much.  We started off with baked and fresh oysters.  The most tender cut of filet mignon I have ever had, along with the lobster tailed, served with mashed potatoes.  And for desert..... YUMMMM, the bread pudding.

This dinner was worth the price!

This place is a hidden gem in downtown Las Vegas. I went last night and can say it is easily one of the best meals AND the best service that I've had in Vegas. If you go, I would request Luciano to be your server because he is so attentive and knows every detail about the menu. I loved everything that we ordered- calamari, the stuffed salmon, filet, ribeye, Mac and cheese, duck fat potatoes, and asparagus. Everything is worth the price!

Reall great steaks! Perfectly seasoned ribeye and cooked med rare to my request. I ordered the mash and green beans which were both excellent.
The bread served pre meal was eh. Not great. Dry and tasteless but highly recommend everything else. Service was top notch as well.
*side note- VERY dim lighting so bring your readers!

MOUTH WATERING!!! Sat at the bar had two sides ....mash pots and asparagus with a massive Rib Eye that so coulda been split for two...great service ....perfectly cooked...I may go again but if I really wanted a mean steak I'd go to Charlie Palmer at Four Seasons

While I might say I have had better I would be hard pressed to tell you what other establishment was  more outstanding.

Make no mistake this is and expensive dinning place.  It is 4 $$$$ for a reason.  Everything is a la carte with steaks starting at $45 and going up to the high $60's range.  I ordered a shrimp cocktail.  For $19 you received 3 jumbo shrimp with their "atomic" sauce.  Nothing was atomic about the sauce but it was a great compliment.  While not the most outstanding shrimp I have ever had it was top notch.  

For my entre I ordered the prime rib eye steak which was $64 and well sized for the price.  I also had a baked potato which was good but $9.00 good? I guess so.

What really impressed me was the whole service team.  From the waiter to the buss boys they worked seamlessly to make the evening special.  They were not the hovering type they would look at your table see what you needed and bring it.  Very intuitive service.

We are Vegas locals and picked this spot for a night on the town with friends. We made a reservation for 10 and were give the private room in the back. Decor is dark, mahogany, jazz music and white table cloths. Great atmosphere, you forget you are right in the center of Fremont Street. The service was excellent, with an extensive wine and cocktail list. I had the pear cocktail which was sweet, but a perfect start to the night. My friends had old fashioneds and sazeracs...lots of bourbons and ryes to choose from...

We started with a round of appetizers--the tartare and cheese plate. Both were excellent, but I have to call out the cheese/meat plate as outstanding. The truffle salami was superb and the three cheeses they selected were liked across all guests at the table. Next we ordered salads--all of which were VERY generously sized. I had the roasted beet salad and highly recommend! The beets were fresh and the goat cheese dressing was the perfect balance to the sweetness in the beets. For dinner I had the filet--cooked perfectly--and everyone at the table was pleased with their steaks. We tried several of the sides...MUST try is the au gratin potatoes (as long as you like A LOT of cheese) and the mac and cheese. Mashed potatoes were good, but didn't compare to some of the other options.

A few of us tried desserts...again...awesome. I had the croissant bread pudding (which was a HUGE serving...definitely share with several) and my friends had the strawberry ice cream. 

All in all...great evening and overall dining experience. One of the few places that actually lives up to "strip prices"...Between the ten of us, we've tried several of the downtown steakhouses and this was one of our favorites! Great evening, service, we will all be back!

The wine and drinks were very good and very reasonable. My steak came out and one bite proved so extremely salty that my wife (who digs salt) could't eat it and recommended that I wipe off the seasoning from the 21-oz masterpiece before me. After summoning the waiter and letting him know that I really couldn't actually eat the awesome cut of New York goodness that had been placed before me he disappeared immediately and I enjoyed some of the entrees that had landed in the meantime. Our waiter was fantastic. Nice moustache. Great care for the patrons. He came back out with the maitre'd and a totally clean unseasoned and perfectly medium rare masterpiece of a NY. Probably pushing 3lb to be honest. I ordered more wine for the table and made sure the waiter was taken care of. Here is my guidance to the establishment: Almost everything was over seasoned that night. I don't know if that's typical. The vegetables, particularly the beet salad, were perfect. If you could arrange to have a restroom that was in your own space and not in the casino that would be helpful. I would eat there again in a heartbeat even though I had to send my steak back the first time around.

Happy holidays Las Vegas Yelpers!

I came here this past Sunday night for dinner :)
My boyfriend and I joined his dad and step mom visiting from Hawaii for a delicious meal at V&A. I was really excited... never been here before and it was my first time meeting his dad & step mom.

I'm not a steak eater but I fancy other things :D
For starters we shared the calamari, crab cakes and portobello mushrooms. The crab cakes are phenomenal here! Probably one of the best I've had.
My bf ordered the prime rib, his dad ordered a filet and his step mom and I ordered the lamb chops... with baked and mash potatoes. Everything was perfect!
For dessert I had their flourless chocolate cake! If you love chocolate, try it... it's on the rich side.

Our server Bo was really excellent in customer service!

Great ambiance and amazing food!

If you're looking for a steakhouse, make it V&A!

- Miss Yelp 2011

Service here is on point. Seriously. From the water and bread refills to the waiter inconspicuously asking one of the guys helping at the table to get an extra plate (what ARE they called?), these guys are on point.

The food didn't blow me away, but it was solid. 

The sourdough bread that kept on coming out had a nice crunch with a soft interior and was served with a whipped butter.

Chopped salad was just a chopped salad - nothing special there. 

When all our dishes came out, our server immediately asked us all to check the temperature of our meat to make sure it was ok. Mine was not, and he profusely apologized for it and took it back immediately to correct the temperature. Definitely have not seen this done before. (But then again, I haven't been to THAT many steak houses). 

I had the veal chop which was good, and tasted like pork chop, but I kind of wish I just stuck with a regular steak to get that meaty taste. The bites of steak I did have from the other people in my party had a nice salt/pepper exterior with a nice crunch and was really flavorful.

As far as sides go, the mushrooms were good, but a bit too seasoned (marinating in something balsamic for too long?), asparagus was good, potato au gratin was exceptional, as well as the creamed corn. 

Would recommend coming to this restaurant. It was also a nice surprise to check out the Golden Nugget. Who knew that it would look so fancy inside! I'm always on the strip, and this was my first venture to downtown Vegas

Excellent service, very attentive, food was delicious. If it wasn't for the enormous corkage fee of $55, I'd give it a five star. They DO NOT allow outside wine bottles. but because we were celebrating our 20 year anniversary, they made an exception. Unbelievable! They weren't doing us any favors at $55 for a corkage fee.

I love this steakhouse!  Food is great. 
It was the biggest  capreese salad I had ever tried.  (like 2 pounds salad HUGE!)  Stakes were amazing too. and the best thing was their potatoes with cheese on top. I tried to cook the same thing home after we came back from Vegas.
The thing I dont like about the place is that they display raw pieces of meat and half dead lobsters  - I felt so sad about those poor creatures who were killed for our pleasure. (but C'est la vie.)
Also they dont have a bathroom in the restaurant   and just to wash your hands you need to travel all the way  through casino.

I've read a lot of good reviews about this place before I even decided to step in. So, my expectation is very high. Walking into this place on a thursday evening is a fairly easy. But its very very busy in there.

I am a little dissapointed that we dont get to seat in the side seats somewhere instead of being seated in the middle of the dining room. But let me tell you that the experience is that great. I cant never drink my water glass till its empty.

Its always full somehow. I think they have ten servers assistant who just walk around filling up water. Their server assistant are wearing chef uniform to make the whole place looks very classy and elegant. 

They even take the time to bring black napkin to my fiance's black dress so that it match her outfit. All I can say is, this place rocks.

Alright, lets get on to the food. We try the lobster bisque for $9.95 absolutely worth it. Have lots of lobster in it and taste very seafoody. 

Next, the appetisers, we try the maple glazed quail thats to die for. The maple glazed on the quail is so damn good, we wouldve swallow the quail bone if its not because the head saying dont swallow it.

We ordered a couple of fillet mignon and prime rib eye thats to die for with peppercorn sauce. Keep in mind that everything is not free. 

Peppercorn sauce additional $2.95 and sides like mashed potatoes are $6.95. I dont mind paying but some yelper might find it helpful that I write down some prices.

The fillet mignon cost $38 something and its absolutely worth it. My rib eye cost $45 and its HUGE!!! I cant finish it and lemme tell you something, I can eat some steak!!! 

All in all, its a great experience and we definetely put it up there as one of the best steak we ever ate and our server BEN is really great and on the ball as well as fully knowledge in his craft!!
Great food and excellent service. We sat at bar because of the wait. I had lobster bisque and oysters (bisque was very good!!) my husband had the ribeye and lobster tail he loved it.

I can definitely see why Vic & Anthony's is one of the top steakhouses in America. The food was amazing.
I had the 12 oz. filet and I can say it was one of the best I have ever had. I usually need steak sauce but not for this one!
I also recommend getting the asparagus and mash potatoes.

Absolutely incredible steak and a great meal overall. The Golden Nugget had a ad in the room that you can take the restaurant where you get an appetizer (I got the Wedge Salad), main course (8oz  filet mignon and mash potatoes for me) and a desert (Went with the chocolate cake) for less than $50, a great deal. It was one of the best steaks I've ever eaten, no joke. 

The side that you get is more than enough for two people, so my wife and I ordered two different sides, she got the creamed spinach, both were excellent. The service of course is top notch. I didn't eat much of the desert, not only because I was really full from the meal, but the chocolate cake was really too rich for me. However, I loved the steak so much, I could have cared less about the cake!

It is pricey of course, but if you're staying on Fremont and want to go all out for one a great meal, this is a good spot to do it!

How do you end up at Vic & Anthony's? I'd have to agree with the other reviewers..... usually a referal; someone tells you about this high-end steakhouse. For me, it was the concierge at our hotel.

I was trying to put together a dinner-show package for clients. Trade shows in Vegas usually come up for me around the first quarter of the year. And when entertaining clients, I've got a short list of reliable spots in Vegas for dinner. And it's not just about the food; it's definitely about an enjoyable evening, which has to include a relaxing, and tasteful ambiance. V&A's is all that, and reasonable.

In the past, I would have made reservations at Joe's Prime Steak & Stone Crab at the South end of Caesar's Forum Shoppes. But now, I have a very good alternative. And about those "reasonable" prices? Not as high as you might think. For our party of four, a couple cocktails and sodas, two appetizers, the NY strip, a bone-in Ribeye, a salmon entree, a chicken entree, three vegetable sides and a dessert we four split, our bill was about $250. That's very reasonable for a steakhouse meal. 

Funny thing. When we had been seated for a bit, a group of four young guys came in, sat down, opened the menus........ and then in concert, stood up and walked out. I'm thinking they thought they were in the hotel's cafe? 

Things that I really like about this hotel restaurant...... it's easy access, just inside the East side valet entrance to the hotel. The servers are formal, but very accomodating and non-intimidating. The atmosphere is really casual, and the food is very good. Even if I'm by myself, I'll consider getting my next Vegas meal here. And I don't like eating by myself, but for their steaks I'd break that rule.

Went there for dinner last night and the steak was incredible, as it always has been there.  And the service and ambiance were also top notch.  The one downside is that they replaced the AWESOME Beefsteak Tomato and Mozzarella salad was replaced with a Tomato Panzanella, which I tried.  It was ok at best, but not near as good as what they had before.  It is nothing I would even think about ordering again.

Took my wife here for her B-day, since we always eat and stay at the newer part of Las Vegas, i decided to try the old school scenery for once. It was well worth it. We ordered the following with stars on the side 1 out of 5.

Complimentary Bread w/ garlic butter cream (share) *****
Fresh Oyster 2 kinds (Share) ****
Asparagus (Share) ****
Mash Potato (Share) ***
HUGE Australian Lobster Tail (For Her) *****
24oz Bone in Rib Eye Steak Medium Rare (For Me) *****

A complimentary cake for her B Day and all was smooth and perfect. Thanks V&A for a great time. Took a stroll around old town and back to our 2,000 sqft suite at The Hotel.

This place is seriously amazing. 5+++ stars with a silver lining that shines.

I made reservations here for a pre-birthday dinner after seeing some of the reviews on yelp & taking in different factors (price, food variety, wine list.) Seriously did not disappoint & the food lived up to the hype. Quite possibly one of the top 2 most delicious filet mignons I've ever had in my life - and I have had my fair share, it's usually my go-to. 

Reservations were for 4, and I decided to have their prix-fix which included lobster bisque, filet mignon, creamed spinach & creme brulee all for $50. The filet alone was worth $50 and everything else was delicious too... I actually gave my meat an applause & saluted the last piece before I ate it. If a vegetarian would have tried it, I'm sure they would have been happy that the animal turned into a fine mouthwatering morsel. Life changing it was.

Other food at the table included an oyster platter, where the oysters were very big but our oyster expert friend was amazed at how good they were for being so big (I don't eat them.) A wedge salad that looked big & satisfying, a large cheese & meat plate that our friends mostly wrapped up to eat later. My dinner date had some chocolate cake souffle thing and I - who doesn't care a whole lot for chocolate - would really like to eat it again. 

If you love wine - they have an amazing wine list as well. I only had a Malbec & a sparkling wine but I could have moved into their wine cellar. 

Ambiance was great, staff was pleasant & attentive, the only thing I could possibly think of that I didn't like was the restrooms were out in the casino. But I'll gladly walk 10 times for the food here, especially with great service at a decent price.

Everyone in our group loved it & will definitely be going back!

My wife and I ate dinner here last weekend for our 28th anniversary. We were seated promptly at our reservation time. Our waiter was professional, knowledgeable, and personable. 

Our food was outstanding! For appetizers we had Oysters Rockefeller & Mushrooms. We both had fillet Mignon's and I had a lobster tail all of which were outstanding. Our steaks could have been cut with our forks; tender and well seasoned. 

Their wine list is extensive and the entire experience was over the top. 

We were even comp'd dessert for our anniversary. 

The dinner, no alcohol, was $150+ tip. While pricey, very well worth it.

8-9-2015 When the waiter spilled a full glass of water on my wife and drenched her blouse and pant suit, she received an apology.....a few new napkins and a table cloth to dry off. No manager ever came to speak to us. Isn't the GOLD Standard for fine dining to check on Your client after mishaps. No accommodations or adjustments were made. Also, the waiter said its hot outside so, your "Clothes will dry quick".....We had not even started our meal and my wife was soaked.
