What we should have done was left, changed and had your staff made us new meals. But we stayed and kind of expected a manager to make things right. It never happened.  We won't be back.

My husband and I ate here for our 4th Anniversary. The Filet Mignon & Lobster was delicious. The crab cake was wow...that's the best crab cake by far. The staff & service was great. Place was very romantic. Highly recommend this place for steak & lobster. It's well worth the money.

My wife, brother, cousin and I decided on this restaurant after the great reviews. We were planning on watching a show over at The Smith Center and wanted to eat somewhere within close proximity. I would not be dissappointed in our choice. First we were greated very warmly and seated right away. I would recommend making a reservation and you could easily do that on their website. The atmosphere was very warm with all the dark wood features.
On to the service and dishes. The service was impeccable. My ice tea actually was filled with ice and I continued to get ice tea AND ice throughout the dinner! Perfect. Most of the time at other restaurants I get a glass with 5 cubes of ice that melt by the middle if the dinner and unless you ask for extra ice your not going to get it. It's the big things that count but all the little things count just as much. Also the wait staff was very friendly and welcoming.
The dishes we had were the best I had in awhile. We had the calamari in which the caramelized onions were delicious! I had the seared tuna which I cannot even begin to describe. The dish was just amazing. The tuna melted in my mouth. Unbelievable. If you love sushi you will love this dish. My wife had the shrimp scampi which she loved. My brother had the prime rib eye which he stated was cooked to perfection and my cousin had the pork chops that were cooked just right. I have to say that previously we ate at the steakhouse inside the sunset station and I would most definitely have paid a little more to eat at Vic and Anthony's.
Don't pass up the opportunity to eat here. I would probably compare the quality of food to when my wife and I ate at BOA Steakhouse about 3 years ago. Happy Dining!

Best steak house in Vegas. 
This is an old school mahogany,  leather, martinis and steak place. 

Fancy for Freemont St but anytime I come to Vegas I eat here. 


In fact my favorite steak house.
I have eaten here a couple of times and food and service has been very good.  Old school feel inside of Golden Nugget.

The wife and I almost never spend $150+ on a meal, mostly because the expectations are so high, the results have a hard time living up. I would have been happy to pay double! This may have been the best meal I've even eaten. Steaks cooked perfectly, seafood risotto was amazing, and enough for two. I would seriously consider eating only one or two meals a week, just so I could afford to eat here!

Located inside the Golden Nugget in Downtown Las Vegas, Vic & Anthony's is a place I'd been wanting to visit for a long time but never got around to it. Finally, while in town for meetings, I suggested it to a coworker and he agreed. So we met downtown and gave it a shot.  

The atmosphere is upscale and upbeat yet relaxing. Dark cherry wood, low lighting, open spaces but with an air of privacy. There is also a bar with eight seats and I noticed there were always a couple open. There were two servers/bartenders back there which is one for every four seats. Not bad.

We were fortunate enough to get in without reservations, but I highly recommend making them. It was a Tuesday night for us so not too crowded but I'd never try walking in like that during the weekend. Unless maybe you want to dine at the bar.

I ordered the Prime Ribeye and added some Mac & Cheese. Both were absolute five star dishes. I can't say enough about them. Outstanding. One of the best steaks I've encountered on the earth thus far. The Mac & Cheese was amazing in it's own right, baked just right with the perfect combination of taste and texture. Not salty at all, like many restaurants make it. 

The service was beyond courteous and professional. I'd give it six stars. Everyone there clearly wants you happy and wants you to come back. The staff combined with the pleasant atmosphere made us want to hang out a little longer than we usually would. So we did. 

Of course, when I go out something a little odd has to happen to me. Tonight was no different. A guy at a nearby table ordered a side of broccoli and these two HUGE broccoli florets come out on a plate. He's shocked (and a little hammered) and starts walking around other tables with his plate begging people to take a slice of his broccoli. When he got to us, we politely declined and he was a little indignant and said: "What's wrong with you people, don't nobody like broccoli?"

Finding no takers, he sat back down at his table with the two trees still on his plate and went at it alone. 

Dinner and a show. 

This is a somewhat upscale place but I noticed a few patrons in shorts. I wouldn't recommend it because Vic's calls for better than that. I personally wouldn't wear them because, in this dark environment, I'm afraid my legs would glow in the dark and be the spectacle of the evening. Even more than that broccoli guy. No, I wore some dark jeans with some way cool dress shoes and a long-sleeved polo and fit in just fine. 

This is a must visit if you're downtown and looking for the right place to dine. Don't wait years like I did to try Vic & Anthony's. It is a supreme steakhouse.

This place is amazing and a hidden gem. As we walked in we were greeted by numerous employees and they brought out fresh baked bread and filled our water glasses immediately. 

We ordered the lobster bisque, crab cakes, potatoes gratin, rib eye and the salmon dish with lobster topping.  

The lobster bisque and crab cakes were amazing. Extremely flavorful and the crab cakes was majority crab. 

The steak was cooked to a perfect med-rare and extremely flavorful. My wife doesn't like steaks but enjoyed it very much. Her fish was absolutely amazing as well. The skin was crispy and full of flavor while the salmon itself was very soft. I wasn't too crazy about the potatoes gratin cause it tasted like Kraft Cheese.

For dessert we ordered the croissant bread pudding and it was sooo good. Surprisingly it wasn't that sweet and we pretty much cleaned that out.

We will definitely come back here.

Awesome restaurant it's my favorite place in Vegas. They have New York strip to die for. They have a romantic atmosphere. Warning the restaurant has dim lighting perfect for a dinner date. They do offer a delicious lobster bisque. And they have the best creme brulee in town!

Good food good service.  Roasted beet salad & oyster Rockefeller to die for.  Potatoes au gratin on a salty side.  Told our server about it, a nice young man from Romania, he took it off our final bill without us asking for us.  Nice touch. Shared a prime rib eye steak with a side of peppercorn sauce. Good sautéed wild mushroom.  Ample portion.  Nice atmosphere.  We would do it again.

If you're looking for amazing food this steak house is the place to go! My boyfriend and I absolutely loved our dinner, the food was to die for! The staff and ambience were impeccable. I would highly recommend dinning here.

A 5 star restaurant all the way around. Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse is really the pinnacle of great food.

The wait staff knows exactly what they are doing. Our waiter was able to recite a long list of delicious sounding specials from memory and was well-versed in proper dining/serving etiquette . 

I ordered the salmon and was truly blown away. I was expecting great, but what I got was on another level. Top 3 all-time on the salmon list (and I eat salmon a lot!). Wild-caught Alaskan salmon which a creamy sauce. Yum! 

The atmosphere is very similar to what you would see in a nostalgic Brooklyn mob lounge, upscale with just enough lighting to see your partner across the way.

The price is not cheap, so don't go to Vic's unprepared. But for an exceptional restaurant away from the strip, Vic's is the place to be.

This place was fantastic. Usually I am very cautious about eating at one of the restaurants in the hotel that I'm staying in. The Service was fantastic. We were there for our end of the year office trip and had 5 people. All of the food was served perfectly with no mistakes and was great. The atmosphere was perfect. You don't have to be super dressed up, dressy casual is just fine. It is a bit pricey though, that would be the only reason I didn't give it the full 5 stars. I would say it was apparent because the place was pretty empty for a Thursday night. Will I go back, yes!

Great restaurant located inside the Golden Nugget hotel. Service was excellent- and we had a party of 14 people. The food was pretty good all around. I ordered a "caprese" salad to start and it was delicious. My main course was the Scallops, Brussel sprouts with grits. Fantastic. Hubby ordered the Maine lobster which he thoroughly enjoyed and finished. The king crab legs were amazing.. My nephew had six legs to himself. That 3 year old is one expensive date! 

As for desserts, not amazing but good. We tried the pecan ball, which was a huge ball of vanilla ice cream with pecan nuts on the outside. Nothing special. The bread pudding was better, it came with caramel ice cream on top. I think there's slight rum in the pudding, it was good but nothing blow your mind.

Minus one star because my pineapple juice cup had lipstick stains all over the cup... That's extremely unappetizing and unsanitary. overall, for such a large party- I think the waiters did a fantastic job serving and our food was great overall. Recommend!

The steaks tasted like steak... when you add their sauce the steak's flavor is enhanced.  Hubby took the rib eye and I took the 8-oz filet... very happy with our choices.  We also took a side of asparagus which was enough for two people and the asparagus was cooked al dente... perfect!  This restaurant is pricey but well worth it.  The servers were very attentive and respectful.  We'll definitely bring the family the next time we're all in Las Vegas.

The last time my father in-law was in town, he went to Vic & Anthony's with a friend and enjoyed it so much, he needed to go back...
I was a little hesitant going to a steakhouse as my last few experiences have been bleh sides and grumpy waiters.

First, the atmosphere is perfect. We sat at the bar as the 4 of us were very causal. Very comfortable bar stools, spacious, nice dark lighting, perfect old music...

The portions are huge so be careful of over ordering as we did. The broiled portabella was juicy and tasty. The caprese salad was very well prepared. The tower of chips and onion strings were ok (the chips were better, but a gigantic portion of onion strings)

Next came the wedge salad. They cut it in half for my husband and I to split, and my plate alone was a huge dinner portion salad! Very crisp fresh iceberg lettuce and they served it on a chilled plate! Very smart touch.

Finally, my husband and I split sides: Broccoli, creamed corn, grilled asparagus, and the baked potato no bacon. Again, huge sides. But all very good and very fresh. No microwave tasting potato or rubbery canned corn here.

OH I forgot another fantastic part. The Pinot Noir from Oregon is fantastically smooth. The cheese platter is delicious. Its pricey though.... says market price on the menu so ask if you are interested. Ours came out to $27 I think, but they gave us a variety of 8 cheese (good portions of each), honeycomb, seasonal, sweet blueberries and blackberries, and dried sugared orange rinds. Perfect spread to construct many tasty little cheese breads.

Will be back... great romantic spot for couples!

It deserves the Michelin star and 4 stars from me because they do something a lot of places, with fine meat, don't-- they cook it perfectly. This isn't a tucked away bargain on Freemont, its a destination restaurant. A great guy's place for that one "big meal".  It's not in a league or price range, with Crafsteak, but it could very well be the best steak you eat all year.

Yeah, the service was an issue. They were friendly but they delivered our entrees one at a time, while the rest of us were still working on our appetizers.  

The apps were fantastic-- here's what I say: They have the best crab cakes on the strip,  topped with a sweet and tangy chive sauce, bold but complimentary to the pure and rich crab. Sensational  The sirrachi quail was ordered as a lark--  I've always wanted to bbq with "the rooster sauce" but, now I actually "get" why they have the rooster on the bottle-- it works with bird amazingly well.  The quail was delicate, juicy and a bit gamey, but the sirrachi glaze was such a strong contrast that every bite was an experience. Excellence! 

The freshwater oysters were also a hit, they were in fantastic condition, and with a little rock salt sprinkled over them and some seriously coarse pepper, delicious. We also tried the shrimp cocktail which came with about #4 shrimp, huge babies! The sauce was a compote of cherry tomato, chunky garlic pieces, that beautiful coarse black pepper and some sherry. There was a hint of the sarachi in this as well. This is one of the best shrimp cocktails I have ever tried, and it was in my opinion, a value. If a couple were splitting this, it would work as a first course for sure.

Now to the steak. I ordered a bone-in rib eye, others in my party also ordered the fillet, the stuffed sea bass (amazing) the stuffed salmon (creative and maybe the standout) the lamb rack (4 to a rack) and of course there's always one...he ordered the chicken. 

My steak ordered Medium rare was cooked to perfection, lightly seasoned, every bite was juicy and had that tangy-tease on first bite, followed by the deep beef flavor. Magnificent!    And rib eye lovers take note, the meat near the bone was intense, a true sign of proper aging.  It was delicious and I left nothing but the bone.  I tried the stuffed salmon, which was filled with gouda and onion compote, and flakes of fresh herb, it was sensational-- I believe it was cooked on some sort of exotic wood because it had a unique flavor. This is the best salmon I have ever tasted. The cheese, the herbs, and the wood flavor only made the flesh of the perfectly cooked fish blow up, it was raining slamon flavor in my mouth, with dimensions I can't explain-- I want to go back and have this dish!  

The sides were of course above average. You don't get a Michelin star for slacking in detail, but I am tired of baby veg, and chunky mash potatoes. but they were very very good. The onion strings, and asparagus (cooked with truffle oil) were fantastic. Also, I really liked the wedge salad. It was huge of course, but the cheese and two types of bacon, house dressing really was impressive, I mean its as if this great sounding salad we've all ordered before came to new life. It's perfected here. 

Parking: work with the people at the Nugget and you'll have less of a walk.  Service: Knowledgeable, and very friendly, good reccomendations without seeming like they are up-selling. Above average. Young table runners though seem a bit out of whack. Wine service is a true value here.

Highly Recommended

Per person with wine, drink, app, salad and entree about $95 with tax.
Per glass wine service is generous and reasonable, and they are known for heavy pours.

Clean restrooms, and old school decor. Men should wear a "going out shirt" gals dress up here, but there's plenty of clientele going casual on the night I was there, so I can't say any dress code is firm. I'd call.

The steaks are seasoned to perfection, so tasty. The lobster tail is huge. You probably could feed two to three hungry people. The service is second to none. For dessert you gotta try carrot cake and the pecan ball.

I go here once a year. I often bring new people to try it as well. It's interior is dark wood with dark red drapes and it's dimly lit. I can picture Frank Sinatra sitting in a corner booth, smoking cigars and sipping a glass of scotch here. I love the feel of the place and it doesn't hurt that I've never had better service in my life. 

We have easily eaten every appetiser they have on the menu. All good. I've had a few steaks on the menu, all of which were incredible, but my personal favourite is the veal chop. It is so mouth wateringly delicious and getting sweat on my brow typing about it. They have a great wine selection as well and out waiters have always been good at helping with the pairings.

I will go here for as long as I go to Las Vegas.

Not a bad place at all so don't let my 3 stars think that is is not a great place but we ordered 2 dishes-the filet and the tuna. The Filet Mignon was some of the best steak i have had-yummy yummy yummy. The tuna was not that great and i barely ate any of it.  Wouldn't recommend it to anyone at all. 

Decor is dark and almost feel like you walked into a SpeakEasy. The TV at the bar kind of threw the whole thing off though. Unless there is some big event that everyone wants to watch like the Derby or Super Bowl, it should be turned off. It really detracted from the cool ambiance the restaurant had.

The wine list is extensive and they truly have it all-even Screaming Eagle which is rare to find. If you go, get the Filet Mignon and you will have a fabulous dinner!

5 star from start to finish.. I dined with a party of 8 and every person was happy.  All servings are huge.  You could easily share salads, sides, and deserts.  I loved the ambiance of the restaurant.  It felt, sounded, smelled, etc. like a steak house.

I will be back!  Had so many steaks in Vegas that on our last night I decided to have crab legs.  The wine and water service was great - the music playing was fantastic!  I would love to go back and have a steak!  

Now for the not so great:  The crab legs came out in a pool of melted butter  - with more melted butter in a ramekin on the table.  Yee gads so much butter!  I could not get the meat out of the shell as the legs were slip slidin away on the plate.  I finally had to use the bread plate to move my crab legs over out of the pool to dig into them.

Our server never dropped a discard plate for the shells and I had to ask for a hand towel to wipe my hands from the buttery mess.

Overall we like the place and next time if I order crab I will ask for it steamed with butter on the side

Three of us just had a wonderful dinner at Vic & Anthony's. We had an early reservation on Sat. We got there on time and were seated at a comfortable table right away. The room is very comfortable, lots of wood and stained glass and two of us noticed that it was a nice change that we were able talk with out shouting even though the room was busy. Our waiter, Vic, was wonderful, very professional, and helped us thru a couple high maintenance food allergy food requests.  I started with a crab  cake - excellent, no noticeable filler, just good well seasoned crab. My friends liked their salads. I had one of the best veal chops ever, my friends had a steak and a lobster tail, both excellent, the steak cooked perfectly. The sides are  big enough to share. I thought the au gratin potatoes might have been a bit too cheesy, but still quite delicious. The wines by the glass seemed reasonable, for vegas, and the pinot noir I had was a good choice, our waiters recommendation, with the veal. The deserts were good, I had a flourless chocolate cake and it was one of the richest, best ever. We casually mentioned during the meal that all three of us were celebrating our birthdays and when the check came, the deserts had been comped. Yay! nice touch. Thanks guys.  I only have one complaint  - when our waiter delivered our steaks, he asked us to cut into the middle to check that they were cooked correctly. I HATE THAT!!!!  I expressed my hatred to that bullshit practice, perhaps a bit too enthusiastically, to our waiter. It's not voodoo, its a matter of temperature and if the "cooks" cant tell if the steaks are cooked to order, they shouldn't be in the kitchen or just use an instant read thermometer. In a dim room, cutting into the center is a crap shoot, you cant see well. and even if you can, I don't want  to. Hopefully he passed my message on to management.  All in all, it was an excellent dinner. Everything, food, service and ambience were great. I plan on returning soon.

One of several restaurants inside The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino, Vic & Anthony's is a classic steakhouse, full of old Vegas charm with a modern twist. While not inexpensive, the menu provides value if you order correctly because the portions are HUGE - almost too big to share between only two people! My best friend and I shared an amazing artisan cheese plate (market price, $26), each had a salad (she, the Pear & Saga Blue Cheese; me, the Classic Wedge) and finally split Chicken Paige. In the salad course, we questioned how we could even ATTEMPT to eat our entree, so large were the two previous portions. 

Our table service was perfect: a charming, well-informed waiter, at the ready with suggestions. The host/hostess stand could use a few pointers, however. Our 8:30 PM reservation became a 9:00 PM seating, seemingly because a wedding party staged an impromptu post-ceremony dinner. Likely because the restaurant sits on the main corridor of the Golden Nugget's shops, bars and restaurants, its seating area is limited to one, very small, two-person bench. Waiting consists of wandering around in the fluorescent horror of the meeting point of consumerism and casino gambling or clinging to the wall inside the dark hipness of the restaurant, with the glow of the cold case and lobster tank as light sources. That's jarring enough, but the hostess and host talking about how much they hate Friday nights while failing to recognize incoming guests isn't exactly a confidence booster. Thankfully, we shook the wait off easily once we were seated.  

 This is old school, coursed dining, so don't expect a quick meal between table games or use it as a stop on a stroll of Fremont Street. Prepare to linger in its dark, vintage ambiance over an incredible wine list, a menu filled with a options a plenty (even vegetarians can find something) and some great people watching. DO heed the warnings about entree and side sizes: either go hungry or attempt to choose one side for every two to three people at the table. The desserts we saw were far closer to individual size, but - especially after a meal like one could easily have - sharing those might be an excellent idea too.

While casual dress seems allowable, select something finer and have a time-honored, high roller Vegas dinner, even if you don't gamble!

We went to Vic and Anthony's for our five year wedding anniversary and it did not disappoint. Located in the Golden Nugget in front of a chocolate shop, you walk in and see their meat display and lobsters, dim lighting, cozy setting with the chairs close but not too close to each other, friendly and quick service, and oh the food. My husband usually only gets one thing when we go to steak restaurants and that is a filet mignon. Lets say he has had quite a number of filets and this place served it just perfectly. The filet was the perfect texture, not rubbery or chewey, melts in your mouth, wonderful color when cut, and does not need any help to boost the flavor because its all there. I had a few bites and it was excellent. 
I have never had a sea bass and since they had it on special I went ahead and ventured on in there and ordered their sea bass. I was not disappointed at all. I like my fish a little salty and again this did not need any salt or boost, it was everything I expected and more. Their potato puree is amazing as well. Their bread is great and since it was our anniversary we got a complimentary cake. Layers of chocolate, peanut butter and raspberry. It was a big slice as well and we were already too full to finish it but oh it was delicious as well. Our server was polite and fast.

My Husband and I decided to celebrate our anniversary with dinner at Vic & Anthonys.  
The wine selection was incredible and our waiter helped us pick a great bottle.  For appetizers we had the raw oysters and crab cake, both were excellent!
I decided to have the special which was a filet topped with fois gras, mashed potatoes and brussel sprouts.  My husband had the bone in ribeye. We requested that both be prepared medium rare.  His steak was cooked to perfection and seasoned just right.  But my steak was overdone, SALTY, and the fois gras was cold! The potatoes and sprouts were excellent, but for that price I would have expected the steak to shine!  I should have stuck with my original plan of lobster, but the promise of fois gras led me astray!
We had the pecan roll for dessert which was a unique take on ice cream with nuts along with a cup of coffee.  Both the coffee and dessert were good.
The service was great. 
Despite my disappointing steak, I would eat here again, but stick with the original plan of lobster

I just had my wedding dinner here, and it was amazing.  Three weeks before my wedding, my original venue tried to up their prices, so I went seeking an alternative.  Vic & Anthony's was more than accommodating.  While their private room could not fit our group of 26, they made sure to place us in a somewhat cloistered area at 3 large tables.

The service was amazing.  The lead waiter was constantly checking with me, my husband, my father, and my father-in-law to ensure that everything was to our satisfaction.  Even though we had a large group, the kitchen and servers managed to get each course out to the entire group at the same time.  When it came time to cut the cake, the lead waiter brought it out for a very nice presentation, then took it back to be cut.  The restaurant gave us no problem for bringing in our own desert, and only charged a small cake cutting fee (which is pretty standard).

The food was some of the best I've ever had, and I am a real foodie.  The restaurant allowed my guests to order off of the standard menu which was really nice since so many places require a large group to have a smaller set menu.  The crab cakes were the best I had ever had.  Everyone who ordered steak really enjoyed it, and my in-laws said it was the best steak they had ever had.

Thank you to everyone at Vic & Anthony's who made my wedding dinner an amazing event.  It was well worth the cost!

Best steak dinner in town so far! I was very pleasantly surprised with how good the steaks were. 
My husband & I went for an early dinner on a Saturday. The place is dimly lit & has the old school darker decor with some framed pictures on the wall. There is an intimate feel but not crowded like I've seen at other more modern strip casino steak restaurants where you are seated close to others but yet can barely hear your own conversations because of how loud it is.
I felt comfortable to have been wearing jeans, a nice top & heals, without feeling under dressed. It is definitely not a shorts & sandals kind of place but how many steak restaurants are aside from Outback? 

Jim was our server & he was professional, polite, & came around just enough times to make sure we were taken care of but also allowed us to enjoy our dinner. His team was also very efficient in quietly clearing the table in between courses. 
We started by splitting a Caesar salad. It was good but nothing special. I had the 12 ounce filet and husband had 14 ounce prime NY strip. Both were cooked to our liking & seasoned well. The steaks were moist & very flavorful. My filet was the cleanest piece of meat I have had. I had absolutely no gristle & didn't cut away any bit of it. It was tender & needed no sauce whatsoever. They were served on piping hot plates that kept the steaks very warm but didn't cook it. 
We also ordered au gratin potatoes & steamed asparagus. Potatoes were slightly saltier than I liked but very creamy & cheesy and decadent. Asparagus were cooked perfectly, al dente. 
The food was so good, we laughed at how quiet we both were, just savoring every bite & not saying too much. 

We finished off the meal with some really good coffee & a nice chocolate mousse  that was a perfect end to the incredible meal. 

Ive been to a few steak places in town but compared to some places I have been to such as Strip Steak, Hugo's Cellar (both horrible meals & we felt ripped off by the first)The Barrymore (great meal), Flemings, Mon Ami Gabi, Morton's, SW Steakhouse, Sonoma Cellar, Del Friscos, and Hanks to name a few, this was the meal we enjoyed the most! 

Now the bar is set.

When I go to bed at night and dream it's not about Brad or Johnny (Pitt and Depp)  It's Vic & Anthony.  Yes, as the rating indicates, it is "as good as it gets!" This is the perfect description of a dining experience.


Vic & Anthony's will always be my first and only choice for upscale dining downtown in Las Vegas. No wait "Scratch that",  I only visit Vegas to dine here!  Steakhouse cuisine is unparalleled in its simplicity.  succulent porterhouse dripping in natural juices and butter.  Either way, steak proves that the simplest foods can constitute great dinners.


They know how to carry out fully here.  We are fully convinced that this is The Best of the Best of the BEST!  

In fact whenever  our dearest Friends, Family, or clients are visiting the Vegas Area we Call Vic and Anthony's and run a Comp Charge via our credit card and treat them to the experience of there lifetime! 

Let's just say we are pretty popular after this ;0)

Old school Vegas steakhouse. Was a bit hesitant because it's located in the golden nugget downtown Vegas. If you've been downtown Fremont street you know what I'm talking a bout. It's a freak show, my retinas are still burning from the human filth that scoures the area.... Well once inside the place it's old Vegas , high back leather, dim lights, service was spot on, real good, but not bothersome. They tend to your every need. Good wine selection and wow, I drink bourbon, they had a list of high end stuff to choose from, very nice, we had roast beet salad, Caesar salad which they were more than happy to split for us, filet mignon, and of course lobster tails. Steak was great, cooked to our likes! Perfect. And the lobster was fantastic... Tender, sweet, and cooked so well. They don't give you the greasy butter bath to dip it. It needs nothing but cut and enjoy, so we'll done. It's not a cheap experience, dinner for 2 was over 300 with of course a well deserved tip ! When back in town, I will go back to Vic's! Tackle the 35 oz cold water lobster tail. One more thing. We dressed nice, you'll see tourists wearing hawaiin shirts, one ass wore shorts and flips, dress right people, they won't stop you from dining if your that guy. But you make the place a lil less with your old ratty clothing.... Oh, I would of went 5 stars.... Take away one for the young snooty girls who work the front desk and seat you. Lighten up ladies, your not solving the worlds problems, they don't make you feel welcome... They act like they are doing you a favor! Not a good first impression. I almost told them to stuff it... But my girl kicked me in the shin.. And off to the table we went... Vic, retrain the desk girls plz......

Great spot for a Prime Ribeye. The service rocks as does the food time after time. I had a bunch of ladies from the Bay Area in town and so being the Big Baller I am I took them here for dinner. We started with Dom and oysters (can't ever go wrong with Dom and oysters) the n on to the stuffed quail and a cheese plate for apps. Now mind you we were a bit intox. so we were probably high maintenance but the staff took very good care of us. Our drinks whether it be cocktails, water or wine were never empty and every time someone got up to go to the bathroom (which was frequent as we were partayin a little especially towards the end of the meal) our napkin was collected and folded neatly and left in its place. We all ordered steaks and a few of us split a 3 lb. lobster. Everything was fuckin incredible. We ended up drinking a couple of bottles of Quintessa as well as some Silver Oak. The service and the meal really flowed well. We were never waiting for the next thing. One of the best meals I've had in Vegas. I highly recommend it.

My husband and I had our Christmas dinner here. 
Our waiter was Friendly and Professional. The food was prepared to perfection, we enjoyed our Choices.
For dessert I had a Chocolate Martini, Yummy, 
The Atmosphere was warm and inviting.
Only 1 complaint, the server brought my Check along with my Drink, what came to mind was, 
"Thank you, please leave now"!!
Dinner for Two $150

Ok, so I am very torn about how many stars I'm giving V&A's. Here's my break down and I think you'll see why I  had to go with four:

Food: 4
Price: 4
Service: 5 (can I give more than five?)

So now lets talk about those points:

Food: The food is delicious. Excellent quality and flavor. I also love their extensive wine selection.
We ordered-
-Crab cake app: just ok in my opinion, everyone else loved it.
-Chips & strings: didn't like it at all, again everyone else did.
-Roasted beet & goat cheese salad: delicious.
-Lobster bisque: delicious. I am a freak who hates bisque and even I liked it.
-Crab legs: You don't get a ton, but these are excellent quality and just cooked perfectly. Love.
-8 oz. Filet: Ordered it medium rare and that's how it came out. I didn't try it but the person who did loved every bite.
-Bone-in Ribeye: Thank God for cows. Again, it came out cooked perfectly and was just... amazing.
-Au gratin potatoes: Yum!
-Mushrooms cooked in wine sauce: Holy hell these were amazing. My expectations were low enough that these were actually the shining star for me. 
-Cheesecake: The best. Just perfection. The crust is to die for.
-Flourless chocolate cake: I'm a chocoholic. This was sublime.


Price: I, and everyone else in the party, eat at top steak houses on a fairly regular basis. We know great steak and we know how much it costs. I feel like because of where V&A's is located and it is Vegas, you're sort of a captivated audience and they therefore stick it to you price wise. Is it worth it? That's up to you. It was for us. We would go back, keeping that in mind, and perhaps not go as crazy with the ordering again. Bottom line is that we would go back.

Service: I feel like I saved the best for last. I am kicking myself for not making a note of our servers name because he was superb. When you think of high dining and the service that should accompany that, this guy blew those expectations out of the water. We were greeted by a very friendly hostess and seated by an equally friendly/polite seating hostess, who just blew my mind with this next thing-- I was wearing black so she replaced their standard white napkins with a black one for me so I wouldn't get white lint on my black clothes. That's honestly never happened to me and I've been to really high end restaurants before. I love that extra attention to detail, and the pleasant surprise. Our water glasses were never empty. Everyone that works in V&A's was just so helpful and attentive. So, back to our server: he asked how were enjoying our time in Vegas and we told him that we were supposed to be seeing Elton John but the show was cancelled at the last minute. So, you know, the trip wasn't exactly going great. But we were in this amazing restaurant and had a bottle of Merry Edwards on the table, so come hell or high water we were going to have a great night. Well, aside from the flawless service we received, our server remembered our sad story and brought us a dessert plate he had put together since he felt bad for us. Um, what? Maybe this is sad statement on the people we encounter in our day to day lives, but we were all shocked. Vic & Anthony's has nothing to do with Elton John or Caesar's Palace. He could have just left it at "I'm sorry your show was cancelled, that sucks." And we would have been happy and never thought anything of it. But this man went above & beyond to make sure we had a memorable evening, even if it wasn't the one we had planned. 

I want so badly to give them 5 stars, but I feel like I would be cheating other people who read this review. If I was rating on service alone then I would give them 10 stars if I could. I just feel like V&A's has a small way to go with the food and especially the pricing. For my own personal taste some things just could have been better. Again, I did say we would go back if we are ever in Vegas again (which I'm sure we will eventually). Next time I'm trying the stuffed salmon.

Superb, friendly, efficient service.  Had a great Tom Collins to start.  Enjoyed a Tuna Tartar appetizer.  Could have had a pinch less salt.  I had the 16oz Ribeye and Potato's au gratin.  The steak was done just to my perfection.  Our waiter had me cut into it at the beginning to make sure.  Tender, succulent tasty beef.  Yum, yum.  My wife had the halibut and it was also very fresh tasting and delicious.  Really a very nice treat (it was my birthday, and since I had let them know on the reservation, I got a little chocolate mousse cake, very nice). If you are looking for a special occasion place, I would not hesitate in recommending you consider Vic & Anthony's. .

This is my second time to Vic & Anthonys and i was really impressed with both the service and the food on my first visit a couple of years ago but a couple of things on this visit was not quite up there at the "Vic & Anthony Standard". I started with the Tuna tartare with citrus vinaigrette and chips. The tuna was really fresh and high quality and with the classic company of avocado and the crispy chips it was a great start. My company had the scallops with appleslaw/bacon and a tabascovinaigrette. This was even better then mine and the combination of perfectly seared scallops and the appleslaw together with the spicyness of the tabascovinaigrette was awesome! 

For a maincourse i took the medium filé that was juicy and good pared with a peppercorn sauce that was ok but nothing special. Me and my company shared a side of mashed potatoes and this was the big dissapointment. I prefer my mash silky smooth like for example at the Boa Steakhouse in L.A or the now closed Dakota Steakhouse but this mash was full of lumps and the potatoes had its skin left. I know that some people think lumpy mash has this good old home feeling but that aside the mash lacked any flavor. So this was a real downside. 

I rounded of the dinner with a classic creme brulée with berrys wich was good but nothing i will remember. My companys chocolate cake was a step up and she was really happy with it. 

If the steaks and vibe of the place is worth a 4 there something more then the bad mash wich brings the points down. The service was not close to the service i remembered from my first visit. Our waiter made us feel rushed and felt a bit annoyed by the fact that we wanted to eat the appetizer before deciding on our main dishes. Whats the problem? 

So for us the appetizers wich should not be missed gets 4,5 , the steaks gets 4, the sides and the service gets 2. All and all a solid 3 pointer. Would go back but hopefully get a better waiter. And skip the mash and try the gratin or potatoes lyonaise instead.

Starting off this is a typical US Prime Beef cooked with a Salamander steakhouse, If you been to Ruth Chris or Mortons in other cities, you know the drill here.

This is probably one of the best nice dining spots in downtown.

Starting off, on a busy Friday night with no reservations we were seated in about 40 minutes, which isn't bad considering we had no reservations. Instead of going to the in house bar to wait, we went to the casino cocktail lounge around the the corner and watched the shark tank and sports updates until we were called by the hostess for our seats.

The venue is dark, classic steak house, it was busy, but it was also very private, as someone stated before, there are many restaurants which has a fishbowl effect with people gawking at you while dining, its not the case here. I've seen a few local celebrities here while dining. A good spot if you want to keep a low profile.

The service was top notch. Our drinks were refreshed regularly, the staff was friendly and the courses were served in a timely fashion.

Pricing is appropriate for a US prime steakhouse with market prices for beef and seafood. We never had any of the seafood so the review is focusing on the steak.

Started off with cocktails and the bread roll which was very nice, soft and warm with whipped butter and a crispy crust.

Followed that up with a Cesar salad and chili, the salad was ok, with a nice balance between tart and creamy. The chef special soup for that day was a prime beef chili which was horrible. They added sugar and what seamed to be off the shelf chili powder.. it wasn't much better than the stuff you get out of the can which is really unfortunate.

The main entrees were cooked properly, nice well marbled beef with our table having steaks cooked from rare to medium, it has the buttery flavor you often see with the Salamander prepared steaks.

The sides we had was Brussels sprouts, the potatoes au gratin, mash potatoes, asparagus and creamed spinach. All were excellent speaking from a standpoint that I hate brussel sprouts generally. The au gratin potatoes was loaded with cheese so expect a fair bit of grease.

We skipped dessert. 

It's a nice option to have in downtown vegas, I'll be back again.

I had high hopes for Vic & Anthony's. The food was pretty good but nothing amazing or special in any way. The service was great, our waiter was very friendly, attentive, and helpful. Maybe I just had too high of expectations, but I've been to a better steak house in Reno. I'm not saying it was bad, but just not great. I ordered the Prime Strip and it was cooked exactly how I ordered it, but I wasn't too impressed. My husband ordered the veal which was pounded very thin and breaded, it seemed there was more bread to meat ratio. I also ordered the onion strings on the side, which came out as a huge mound on a plate (not very appealing) and they were mediocre, no better than you would get at a fast food joint. Luckily the desserts were delicious. I ordered the pecan crusted ice cream with caramel sauce, it was amazing. I can't remember the dessert he ordered but it was so good he was tempted to order another. So overall I think it was worth 4 stars. I don't think I would go back during future trips to Vegas, I'd like to try somewhere else.
It's good, just not great.  The cesar salad wasn't that great and my veal chop was not even close to the best I've had.

We had a late dinner here and enjoyed our steaks...the crab cakes shouldn't be missed either. The service was friendly and attentive...but too fast! When spending $100 a person for dinner, please dint rush us! No sooner had our apps been cleared than our steaks arrived.

The sides are huge! The potatoes au gratin were ok...the creamed spinach, not so much...very salty.

The room is nice and has a very Vegas feel to it. The steaks were perfectly cooked and very tasty. Wasn't a bad dinner...just not a great overall experience.

I wasn't impressed. In fact, I wish we would've followed my instinct to just go back to N9NE. 

We started out with Caesar salads. They were good.

I ordered the Chefs Special; an 8 oz filet and lobster with puréed potatoes. Not sure they know how to. cook a steak medium well vice medium. I asked for my filet to be cooked medium well. It came out medium. Our server then proceeded to take the steak off my plate so that they could cook it to medium well. When it came back out it was significantly charred on the outside, and still medium on the inside - unbelievable.

The lobster was delicious. It was served atop a garlic butter sauce. This was the perfect accompaniment. The puréed potatoes were too salty to eat.

My mate ordered the ribeye. From my understanding it was just "alright". 

We also ordered the scalloped potatoes. They were good but very rich. 

The manager comped my filet and offered to have something else made for me, but I politely declined. 

We thought we'd pay our bill and then hit the strip, but suddenly a ginormous piece of red velvet cake and two mini cakes aside it came to our table. We were informed that the cake was made in house. We were doubtful of this as it was ice cold and appeared to be store bought. It was okay nevertheless.

Will I return? No. There are too many far better steakhouses in Las Vegas.

5 stars for the service. 2.5 stars for the food. My total rating for Vic & Anthony's is 3 stars.

Steak was really really good, I had a hard time finishing the rib eye, probably because we had 3 bottles of red between the 3 us plus a few cognacs.  I rarely ever venture to downtown vegas when I'm in town but its worth going if you end up down there for some reason.

Prior to our trip to Vegas, I went on a Yelp bookmarking spree for places to eat and visit, and one of the restaurants that I bookmarked was Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse. Luckily for us, the restaurant is located at the Golden Nugget, where we were staying. We also received a $125 gift certificate for the restaurant after attending a timeshare presentation. It seems like we were destined to dine there!

We were able to make a reservation easily through OpenTable on the Yelp app. As we entered the restaurant, we were awed by the restaurant's display of live lobsters as well as steaks and huge lobster tails. The restaurant itself was dimly lit and had jazz music playing in the background.

The food at Vic & Anthony's was delectable! To start off our meal, we had the seared scallops with crisp apple slaw; the scallops were perfectly seared and paired well with the mouthwatering apple slaw. We also had the pear and saga blue cheese salad; loved the combination of flavors! My boyfriend and I both ordered the filet mignon and shared a side of au gratin potatoes. Both of our steaks were tender and cooked perfectly to our preference. We ended our meal with their vanilla bean creme brulee...yum!

The service at the restaurant was fast, attentive, and accommodating. When we first got there, the hostesses were friendly and they promptly guided us to our table. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, and even gave us some wine samples to help us choose what we wanted to drink. Our water glasses were never empty, and our completed dishes were taken in a timely manner.

Overall, Vic & Anthony's Steakhouse has tasty food and amazing service!

I think after reading the reviews from everyone we had really really high expectations and few were met. This place is good but nothing to run home and tell my mom about. 

Pros: Server was kind, food was served quickly, steak was cooked as we asked, proportions were large, drinks were strong, dessert was comped because we were celebrating our anniversary, water glasses were always promptly refilled 
Cons: We were NEVER addressed by our last names although we had a reservation, tons of people were wearing shorts and flip flops, we were never offered bottled water (automatically served tap), not the best steak we've ever had :(

For appetizers we ordered the crab cake, one large cake with a butter sauce that is richer than Bill Gates and the oysters Rockefeller, good but was just an oyster with spinach, bread crumbs and cheese. Entrées were both steak, better than most places but nowhere near the best. For sides we had the au gratin potatoes which needed more potatoes for all the cheese and creamed spinach which was a bowl of the same stuff on top of our oysters Rockefeller. Dessert was pretty darn good though. Croissant bread pudding was the highlight of our meal.

Bottom line is that the place is good but not great, I say check out the band in the lounge area....they are awesome!!! Prime in the Bellagio and Anthonys in The M Resort are still my top two steaks in Vegas!

Stop reading this review and go eat here. Seriously. I do not think I've had a more perfect meal in the longest time, if ever. I mean, from the moment we walked in to the moment we left, perfect. 

I came here on a Saturday evening a few weeks ago with my friend to celebrate my 30th birthday. The only thing I wanted out of this dinner was a perfect filet mignon and a drink, and that's it. While I appreciate a nice steak, I'm very basic in what I'm looking for. I really only want to talk about the food, so suffice to say the service and ambiance were perfect. I have nothing to complain about, so let's get to the food. 

Our appetizer was quail -- absolutely perfect. I wish I could use profanity to explain the amount of motherlovin' flavor on those guys. Yeah there's not a lot of meat, but oh my face they were perfect. The flavor was absolutely on point and they were cooked to perfection. I, at that point, was pretty ready to die. We also each ordered the lobster bisque: I personally thought it was on point, but my buddy said he thought it should've had more texture. My buddy ordered the special that night, which was a buffalo steak served with mashed potatoes and scallops. I ordered the filet mignon, cooked medium. Both were perfect. I mean, I'm an ok cook, but I'm in the d-league compared to the gentleman who cooked our meals.

The place isn't cheap. For us two dudes, our total was somewhere around $200. That total included 2 lobster bisques, quail, filet mignon, buffalo, and we each had one drink. All in all, totally worth it. As a matter of fact, I think I know where I'm going for my 31st birthday!

Absolutely one of the best steaks and service I've ever had.   Really lives up to the hype!!  
The sourdough bread and butter were a great start. I ordered a New York Strip with a side of wild mushrooms.  Absolutely delicious!!!  The special was an 8oz filet and lobster with a side of potatoes which the man got.    The lobster had a small kick to it but definitely not too spicy.    The filet just melted in you mouth.  
Can't wait for next year's visit to Nugget and out return visit to Vic and Anthony's.

Service was exemplary! Food was okay. As Portland, OR foodies, we are spoiled by our city's excellent restaurants, but V&A's wine selection was AWESOME! If you want a memorable wine experience, enlist the help of the sommelier. This wonderful French gentleman picked a lovely French Chablis and Bordeaux-like Napa blend for our meal. I described our tastes (oenophile sister to Merlot Mom) and he delivered selections that exceeded our taste buds.  

I ordered from the Prix Fixe menu and was a fan of the Haricot Verts. Wonderful!! Filet was ordered medium-rare but was pretty rare... too rare for me. The waiter did warn us. Creme Brulee comes in a flat dish  vs. ramekin so you get more burnt sugar than flan. My sister had the Oysters Rockerfeller and it was tasty. I ordered the bacon appetizer and yes, it tasted like a sweet bacon dish. I was expecting more of a Pork Belly phenom. 

There were 7 of us for a family reunion and the reservationist delivered what I asked... a quiet area so my hard-of-hearing dad could hear the conversations over the dinner din. Bravo and Thank you! Great experience. 

CON: restrooms are in the casino -- quite a walk and not a direct route.

We went on a recent trip to Las Vegas.  The food was excellent, service was professional, and staff was courteous.  Everything was a la carte and the sides were very big as was the salad.  We got the market ribeye which were $68 each.  I've been to several high end steakhouses and this was as good as the rest.

Visited 06.26.15

OMG wow.  Wow wow wow.  First off, this place was amazing, the food was excellent, the service was superior to many other "fine dining" establishments and all in all it was a great experience.  The only tiny downside is how close the tables are to each other so it was a bit hard to talk but other than that everything was on point.

Hector was our server and he truly made the experience phenomenal.  His recommendation of the Peju wine made a good meal great and even though my friend and I sat there for 2 hours he never rushed us, checkin when it was appropriate, kept our wine glasses full and all in all gave top notch service.  You rock Hector and I would come back just to hang out with you again.

The food consisted of three courses of mouth watering goodness.  We both had the preset menu and it was worth every penny and then some.  

Lobster Bisque - I seriously could have just had a big bowl of this and been completely happy.  It was creamy and smooth, rich but not too rich, a hint of tomato and nice sized pieces of lobster.

Creamed Spinach - ok confession.  I love, love, LOVE creamed spinach.  And when a place does it well like Vic and Anthony's does I love it even more.  Ugh just cannot say enough good things about this dish.

Filet Mignon - excellent cut, cooked just right.  Soft and flavorful.  Excellent.  I ordered mine medium while my friend ordered hers medium well and both came out perfectly cooked.

Chocolate Mousse - ok lets be honest.  By this time I was stuffed so it was hard to eat anything else but I did try it and it was creamy and fluffy and if I wasn't ridiculously fully I would have probably ate the whole thing.  

So, all in all a great night of eating and drinking and seriously one of the best meals overall I've had in a long, long time.

EXCELLENT.

I know there are a ton of options for fine dining in Vegas, but Vic and Anthony's was really exceptional for a number of reasons. 

FOOD:
I came here with a group of 7 and 5 of us ordered from the $50pp 3 course prix fixe menu, which boasted some great options. I opted for the lobster bisque for the first course, fresh fish a la nage for the second, and creme brulee for the third. The lobster bisque was HEAVENLY. It was rich, butter, and full of lobster meat. The fish (it was salmon) was served with delicious sauteed carrots, haricots verts and zucchini and was topped with crab meat. Very tasty. The creme brulee...... I had a bit of a spiritual moment with that dessert. It was served in a large, flat dish so there was a lot of crispy, delightful caramelization to break with a spoon. Beneath the crunch top was an absolutely decadent creme, chock full of vanilla bean. It was so good I actually cried. It was so good I turned down bites of my boyfriend's chocolate mousse cake. It was so good I kept eating it and eating it even though I thought I was going to burst at the end of the second course. I have seriously never eaten a dessert THAT good. 

SERVICE:
Exceptional. Our waitress was patient and attentive, making sure that we were well taken care of. My glass of water was never left empty. My empty plates and used utensils were taken away at just the right time. Our food was well-timed and we were treated very well.

AMBIANCE:
Personally, I think Downtown Vegas (Fremont Street) is about 1000% cooler and hipper than the strip. The Golden Nugget, in which Vic and Anthony's is located, is a classy establishment with a dash of funk and fun from the vibrant promenade outside. The restaurant itself is dimly lit, very classic steakhouse decor with white table clothes and dark finishes. There are candles flickering on every table. Frankly, I would have happily eaten this food on a bus or in a cab or at my aunt's house or anywhere because it was so good it wouldn't have mattered, but the ambiance and feel of this restaurant really amplified the experience. 

Overall, superb restaurant. Go if you have the chance!!

This will be our 4th time here!  Going tonight. Love the food and the service. . We go no where else to have a steak. It's all about the sides and drinks are amazing. Jay our server was fabulous. We had he perfect table in the back. Thank you Vic and Anthony's for a great celebrations.

This being the first time I'd ever staying in Downtown Vegas, I had low expectations all around.  However, Vic and Anthony's was amazing--a shining beacon in a land of sad, $7.95 steak dinner offers.  As said by others, this place is comparable to any fine dining place on the strip and the prices are very reasonable.  Our waiter (coincidentally named Anthony) was incredibly helpful and friendly.  
My boyfriend and I had wedge salads--huge and very good.  The only thing that would have made them better would have been some bacon.  (But honestly, doesn't everything need a little bacon?)  We then split the ribye and crablegs special.  OMG.  Best. steak. EVER.  It was perfectly cooked and amazingly tasty.  Perfectly seasoned, tender, and had a great beefy taste.  No steak I've ever had (Ruth's Chris, Mortons, Mastro's, Houstons...) was this good--and I love my steak.  Plus, the crablegs were huge!  I can't even imagine the size of the crab who lost his legs for my meal--he must have been the Shaq of crabs.  We also had the creamed spinach, which was good, but not great.  It was very cheesy and a bit spicy--in a good way.  
Based on the fact that I came for steak and I was rewarded with the best steak I've ever had, I give Vic and Anthony's 5 stars.

My Daughter and Son-in-law recently brought us here to celebrate my Wife's Birthday. It was actually our 3rd or 4th visit from over the years.  This experience was the best ever!  The food (especially the Steak) was phenomenal, best I've had in Las Vegas in the last 3 years.  Even more incredible was the entire wait staff.  Service was perfection. The whole place seems to have a new vibe:  fun and exciting, still with Old Vegas style.  Can't wait to go back.

Phenomenal! My husband and I went here to celebrate our Vegas honeymoon! Staff was knowledgable, professional and personable. Food - best meal I have had in years. Best elegant find in downtown - a true gem!

Food wise, this place only gets 2 stars. The other 2 came about because I absolutely adore the ambiance of this restaurant, and the service is excellent. I really especially love the music selection (the nights I've come here, they've played 1920's-40's jazz lounge kind of grooves). 
I had the rack of lamb medium rare, it was the most unflavorful lamb I had ever tasted. The sauce that was supposed to go w/it was horrible. My Grandmum ordered the filet mignon (also, medium rare). It was to die for!!!
We also ordered the angel hair pasta (WAY too salty) and the buttered broccoli (very bland). 
As many gripes as I had with most of the food we were served, there are also many reasons why I would come back. I will stick to fliet mignon and a bottle of wine for now on however, to ensure my visit is just fabulous!   :)

We had $75 in free dining vouchers and had already eaten at the Grotto twice. We had reservations at 8:45 and didn't get seated til almost 9:15. Glad I happened to look online and see the 3 course tasting menu. We had lobster bisque (decent flavor and small chunks of lobster) filet mignon (tender and delicious but slightly undercooked) potatoes au gratin ( tasted like American cheese coated these things and it made me want to gag) creamed spinach ( decent ) and the creme brûlée ( the brûlée is my favorite part so I  how they served it ) and bread pudding. ( my bf enjoyed it and it's a massive portion )  After coming here I wish we would have eaten at the Grotto again with our vouchers but the filet and creme brûlée made the stop worth it. But only bc we had $75 in free credit. I don't think I would go back.

I have to say that this restaurant was wonderful.  Being that the Golden Nugget is a bit of a dive, I didn't expect much from this place.  My mind changed when I walked in though.  Very classy place, very alert server, and one heck of a meal.  You absolutely must try the lobster bisque.  It is incredible!  Also, the oysters tasted very fresh.  Lastly, I had the lobster mac n' cheese.  It doesn't sound fancy, but it blew my mind.  They take 4oz of fresh lobster and mix it in with a super cheesy pasta dish.  They then fry an entire lobster tail and drop it on top.  It was insanely good!
Whatever you say I don't care. I was amazed by the chefs choice. I had prime bone in Ribeye. Delicious delicious super super. I do recommend this place for the steak! !!!

idk what it is about steak...steak is just, well, steak.  maybe it's because i'm not a steak connoisseur, but it all tastes similar to me. (don't beat me with a stick!)  yes, the steak was good.  yes, the broccoli was good.  even the mashed potatoes were yummy.  but nothing spectacular or outstanding happened in my mouth.  
this place seemed so ritzy, glamorous, and super fine dining but when it came to the food, it was just...ok.  is it bad that i came here expecting something more?  my dad and my brother seemed to have the same reaction as me so maybe not.

I've never had a ribeye with so much flavor and cooked to perfection. Request the chefs perpetration, cost about $65 but it's worth every penny. It's like getting a complimentary reach around from the chef.

A $$$ cab ride from the strip and a $75 meal at Vic and Anthony's is well worth the visit! A local gal suggested I try it out and she did me right. A bone-in Ribeye with a side of Cream spinach and a big glass of Cabernet was most fabulous. An old school steakhouse decor with courteous service is not only bookmarked, but has made it a regular stop every time I'm in town!
5 stars for amazing customer service. Dave, Victor and Brian could not have done more to ensure our evening was unforgettable experience.
Favorite restaurant for an outstanding Filet! Excellent food, excellent service! Worth every dollar.

They do one thing extraordinarily well.. The steak. Sides- too rich, appetizers (seafood)- overdone, salads even- over the top rich dressing.. But the meat.. Perfect. It's why you came. The sommelier? Spot on. His knowledge? Impressive. 3 yrs ago we ordered just a bottle of wine, a baked potato (split), a bottle of 2006 J Davies cab (rare treat), perfect. Today we ordered the works.. Including an impeccable bottle of wine a cab from Lodi that tasted appropriately like a Zin (Lodi being renowned for such).. And no surprise the best parts of the dinner were the steak and the wine. As tempting as they sides sound- skip them.. You won't be disappointed.  Coodos to the very impressive and knowledgeable wait staff.. Professional over the top.

My sister and I went here a while back and I can't say that I was blown over by the experience. 

First off, let me say that the ambiance and service in this restaurant is impeccable. I wasn't crazy about being seating right next to the kitchen, but that's what you get for being two gals out on the town rather than a romantic couple in embrace. ;) 

I ordered the bone-in rib eye, and my sister got the boneless rib eye. For sides we had the broccoli and the mashed potatoes. The sides were fantastic, and the steaks were well prepared, but they just seemed to be lacking in quality. They were a little tough and just didn't have much flavor, which is what I go to a steakhouse for. 

I would actually try this place again, just to try their enormous lobster tails that you see on display in the front of the restaurant. And because it was a wonderfully run place. Maybe next time, I'll go for the prime rib and maybe it'll be better than the rib eye.

This was a fantastic dining experience.

First of all, the meal was perfect but the service was incredible.  I regret forgetting the name of our waiter, a young man from South Africa, but I will say his level of service went above and beyond.  He really made us feel special.

We started our meal with the Oysters Rockefeller and they were probably the most amazing Oysters Rockefeller I have ever had.  Soo good, so creamy and perfect.

We then had the lobster bisque and just that soup was worth coming in.  It was incredible, so delicious, so perfect.  Later on that night I wanted to go back just to have more soup.  It was the best Lobster Bisque I have ever tasted.

We shared the Porterhouse for 2.  The meat was perfection and we had the Mac and Cheese side, yes it was rich, but I was on vacation so I treated myself.  It was perfect.

Finished off with a complimentary Crème Brulee to celebrate my sister's birthday.  It was very delicious.

I will say the meal was amazing and the service was 5 stars.  Will definitely eat here again.  I hope I get the same waiter.
Great steak and great service. We had the prime ribeye on the bone, the mushrooms, and cream corn. Top shelf experience.

I absolutely love this place! All of the food is delicious here.  We had the filet and ribeye with the risotto with salmon,  and I must add that it was the best risotto I have ever put in my mouth.  The steaks cut like butter.  Do yourself a favor and eat here your next trip to Vegas inside the Golden Nugget on Fremont Street!

Food was mediocre.  The calamari with spicy peppers was extremely soggy.  The bread they served was actually stale.  In their defense, My filet was perfectly cooked and quite delicious.  Our waiter was nice but spilled my husbands beer all over the table and didn't offer a new one.  It's not a bad place but it's really nothing special .  Not what I expected for a $60 steak.

First, let me start by saying I don't give 5 stars easily, and this place deserved every single one. Vic & Anthony's delivered the perfect atmosphere, exceptional service, and  an incredible culinary experience. The atmosphere is very dim and perfect for a romantic night. Victor was our server and he delivered flawless service. I've been in food and beverage for 9 years and have worked at some of the top steakhouses and restaurants on the strip and I was very impressed by him. If I had my own restaurant, I would want him on my team- My compliments to the restaurant for finding him! He was extremely knowledgable on the wine list, recommending the perfect wine pairings for our meal and even brought tastings to ensure we would be happy with our choice. Now for the food:

To start we got the infamous crab cake (I don't even like crab) and every bite was delicious. You have to try this!! 

Pear & saga salad- I was skeptical about ordering but I'm so glad victor recommended it. The BEST salad I have ever had. Everything about this salad flowed and it was perfectly proportioned. I could go on and on but do yourself the favor and get this!

For entrees I got the 8 oz filet with a side of peppercorn (loved the peppercorn but the steak was cooked so nicely and was full of flavor so it didn't even need it) and my date got the American Kobe filet special that came with lobster.
Also got a side of macaroni & cheese which was good but very rich (what Mac & cheese isn't?)

For dessert- OMG CROISSANT BREAD PUDDING. To die for. I was already in a food coma from the appetizers and main course but this was so amazing I finished it. Thank you chef!

All in all, out of all the restaurants I've tried, this is definitely one of the best culinary experiences I've had. I underestimated it, being located in the Golden Nugget and all, but wow- I was mistaken. Definitely don't come here unless you've got the money to spend. Our bill was $240 for 2 people but worth every penny.

The best meal I have probably ever had.  
My husband & I eloped a year ago and renewed our vows for 20 family members & friends in Las Vegas.  We wanted a steak house for a couple of reasons; one to please the men in our party and also I have allergies to gluten and know that a steak-house menu is easy to order from.  
We picked Vic & Anthony's based on their yelp reviews and availability on a Friday night (during a fight weekend).  We were sat right away and our server Annette was funny, curteous, and most importantly put up with our motley crew.  The sommelier on site was great too.  I forgot his name, but he had great suggestions.  The food - oh the food! - came out at a reasonable pace and was delicious!  Our friend actually said "I don't want to swallow because I want the taste to last forever!"
Because we had a large party, we ordered a number of different items.  My personal favorite was the scallops and the cheesy potatoes.  The best part were the steaks!  They were seasoned perfectly and cooked to mouth-watering amazing-ness.  Most of us in our party work in the restaurant/bar/service industry and we were over the moon with this restaurant.
It was a wonderful evening of food and family.  We will recommend this place again and again.
PS - it was fun to walk out on to Fremont Street afterwards to people watch!

I have to admit i was treated to dinner here. We had high rollers that took care of the tab. Anyway it was great had appts,soup,steak/lobster and dessert. needless to say it was delicious. The maine lobster was crazy.  The steak was great.  The server was good, and very helpful.  Loved it i like the bread pudding, girlfriend liked the choclate.  Great fun.

The Pre-fix menu is an excellent value with fantastic choices for everyone-each entree was perfection.  The Blue Cheese wedge was enough for two (but I didn't share), Lobster Bisque was creamy, and absolutely wonderful.  The filets (Prime) were cooked as ordered, tender, and so flavorful.  I dream about those steaks.  The green beans were crisp, the creamed spinach awesome and those potatoes...OMG!  Cheesy goodness, perfectly seasoned.  The Creme Brûlée decadent, rich and so satisfying.  We were such happy campers!  We ordered a bottle of the St Clements Cab, it was superb.  The servers were prompt, professional and in spite of someone a little unruly at our table, handled it with with such respect & professionalism- we left a huge, much-deserved tip.  It has been a long time we have had such fantastic service-it made for a memorable evening.

I finally made it to Fremont from the strip on my 6th trip to Las Vegas.  I wanted to make sure to include this dinner as part of the evening out with  my hubby.  I really don't understand the hype.  I think a chain restaurant like Ruth Chris's or Capital Grille really is a lot better than this place.  I ordered the special which was a filet with a little lobster tail on top that was supposed to have a vanilla type cream on top of that with a little pile of sautéed wild mushrooms on the side and some asparagus.  All of this was sitting on a small puree of something or other.  Parmesan polenta maybe?  It took a while to get to the table and mine was completely tepid in temperature.  The whole plate - not just one item.  Here's the kicker.  They didn't reflame anything, they just put it in the microwave.  YUCK!  How can one tell this?  The color of the filet went from brown to gray.  What was I going to do at that point?  Send it all back and have them remake it all?  No.  We just won't go back, so big deal.  The flow of the restaurant is awful..  I get it, more table and chairs, more people = more money.  But for a place that has been around this long, shouldn't they know by now comfort for both servers and patrons really makes for happy faces everywhere in the restaurant?

Third review, and very disappointed to write this one.  We were a party of 6 on a Wednesday night.  The attentiveness of the server was zilch!  Two people in our party tried, for twenty minutes to get a second drink.  When the entrees (mostly steaks) were served, they looked like little brown islands in the middle of a huge white sea (large plates).  Part of a fine dining experience is eating with our eyes.  A little garnish, or smear of color on the plate would have enhanced its appearance.
Five of the entrees came pretty close together, and the 6th was several minutes behind... NOT GOOD!  Several minutes later the potatoes, and other side dishes were served.  We were halfway through our entrees when the sides arrived.
This is not the kind of service one expects at a $75-$100. a plate restaurant!  I have been at inexpensive casual restaurants that send the food out with several servers at the same time, so that the meal can be enjoyed as ordered.  Don't know if they were short handed on a Wednesday night, but that problem should not be extended to the customer!

This meal was a HUGE disappointment. The Prime Ribeye was tough (Cooked medium). Really tough. I saw no sign of being well marbled, and it was like a steak off of an outdoor barbecue where the person buying the meat and cooking had no idea what they were doing. The side dishes of creamed corn, sauteed mushrooms, and duck fat potatoes were all mediocre at best. The creamed corn had no taste of 'creaminess', like I experienced of other 'fine dining' restaurants. Really. The corn had crunch to it, and the cream was mostly non-existent. The mushrooms were REALLY chewy. Mushrooms should not be mushy, but should definitely not be chewy. The duck fat potatoes were like home fries cooked with bacon fat. Not horrible, but something I'd expect from a breakfast house. I can't overstate the steak though. Tough, not tender, massive disappointment. This restaurant lives on it's reputation, like a lot of Vegas restaurants. I would not return to dine there. No chance.

This place is THE place to eat if you are at Freemont Street!

My sister had her wedding at The Golden Nugget so she had her reception dinner here. There were about 30 of us and they had no problem accommodating us in the back corner of the restaurant. Everything about this place was good. 

The service: Our waiter was Matt. He was THE DUDE to have. He knew everything there was to know about the wine, beer, food and specials. He was courteous, fun, attentive and cute.

The food: The food was outstanding. Our appetizers were crab cakes, calamari, beefsteak tomatoes and cheese, crab legs and bread. The crab cakes were to die for, they will spoil you forever for crab cakes anywhere else. The steaks were cooked to perfection, the seafood (I had the salmon) was excellent and the salads/soups were a good round up on the entrees. Their side were said to have been good, I only had the mashed potatoes which were decent.

The drinks: The drink list, wine list and beer list is extremely impressive. We had a double magnum (yes, DOUBLE MAGNUM) of Prisoner that served the entire party no problem. The beer was exclusive, you don't find what they had on their menu anywhere else very often. The bourbon my husband had was 180 proof, crazy!

All in all a great experience. I would definitely come back here again!

4 of us went to dinner here this past Saturday night and could not have asked for a better meal. We were seated right away for our 9:15 reservation (tail end of the dinner rush) and our waiter Miguel was great and very attentive.  I ordered the filet mignon and it was cooked perfect and so easy to cut. Two friends has the filet mignon special with lobster tail which they totally enjoyed.

Had the maple bacon and it was one of the best I have had. 

Our drinks were never empty. 

Looking at some they comments here is my take: 

Being from NY and Italian bread is a staple of life. The bread they served was hot and quite good. Add the butter on top and yum so not sure what others thought.

People were upset dinner is a la carte and sides are extra but that is what you get at most steakhouses in any major city.

Ok. the bottom line is i ate the BEST steak that i have ever eaten in my life at this place. I was familiar with all the stellar reviews and decided to venture to Freemont to check out Viv and Anthony's. I am a huge foodie and use yelp and trip advisor to help guide me in selecting top rated establishments. I was in the mood for a steak that rivaled my previously favorote steakhouse in Vegas: Mandalay Bay's Strip steak. I was a bit skeptical that Vic's could equal the cut i had at Strip Steak. Man was i wrong. Big time! First off, i don't mind splurging for a pricey steak every once in a while as long as it is worth it. Even though i really liked Strip steak a lot, i was simply not impressed with the 18 oz size. I know for most people this is plenty big. But if i'm paying a premium i expect at least 20, preferably 22 or 24 ounces for a 65 dollar steak. Vic's bone in ribeye clocks in at either 22 or 24, and let me tell you: when i first saw it the first thing i thought to myself is " it's a good thing i'm pretty hungry." The server brought it out and warned me to be careful because the plate was piping hot. He then told me to cut into it to make sure it was medium rare as i requested. I did so and it could not have been cooked more perfectly despite it's size. i took the first bite and the flavors burst through like no other steak i had ever tasted. The damn thing was so juicy that i had a little puddle that formed in the botton of the plate that allowed me to simply enjoy at as a de facto steak sauce. I cut the steak into multiple bite size pieces and completely destroyed every bite. The most amazing thing i noticed was that each bite was just like the first. It was as if my palate was cleansed after  every bite. The ladies sitting at the bar next to me were in awe that i devoured the sizeable cut in such short order. I told them that i simply couldn't help it. The damn thing was just that incredible. Needless to say Strip Steak is a thing of the past for me. THIS place is where i will eat steak exclusively in Vegas from here on out. Keep in mind how incredibly difficult it is to garner 4 1/2 stars on yelp after 200 plus reviews. This place has earned every bit of the hype. The atmosphere is intimate and has that old vegas vibe. I went on a Saturday night and there was a line, so i sat at the bar. I knew when i saw the crowd that the place must be something special. And it most certainly was. My meal consisted of oysters rockefeller that were pretty good. A bit too much spinach and parmesan, but the oysters were big and very tasty and their flavor wasn't at all overpowered by the toppings. Unlike most places. Next time i'll simply request a little less of both. I ate my steak a la carte because i knew it was huge and i didn't even want a salad to go with it. The 65 dollar cut i had is known as the chef's cut and believe me: It was worth every single penny!
Ribeye was off the hook ! Get one  you won't regret it ! Service was top notch .. Vic & Anthony's know how to treat you right !

Thursday night dinner. We had a 4 lb lobster, bone in rib eye and boneless rib eye, baked potatoes, scalloped potatoes, and mac & cheese. Everything was amazing. The mac & cheese and the baked potatoes were the best I have ever had. Steaks were cooked perfectly. Lobster was delicious. The wait staff was very attentive. I would dine here over any other steak house in Vegas, it was that good. May have been the best dinner I've ever had.

Back in Vegas and back to Vic and Anthony's. 

This time my boyfriend and I had dinner with Dad and Stepmom as our trips overlapped. Again, it was perfect and lived up to all the expectations. 

Dad got the distinctive dining menu with the filet option. He said it was a great steak. His side was the creamed spinich, which if you read my initial review you will know I thought it was slightly off mark last time, not so this time. The roux was prepared better and the breadcrumbs much more crunchy so everything didn't blend together. I am thrilled to see what was a good side made great. He enjoyed the wedge salad as his starter. Good as he remembered. He raved about the steak. He was thrilled everything was as good as before. Stepmom also had distinctive dining menu. She got the fish. She is not a seafood lover but wanted something different. She was blown away. However, because she is not a  super seafood lover she left the perfectly crisped skin behind.
