I can say it was perfectly cooked. It was just her personal taste. She enjoyed her wedge salad. Thank goodness she got the au gratin potatoes. They were ridiculously good and I cannot wait to go back to Vegas just to get them. Seriously, amazing. Seriously. Rich, cheesy, cooked perfectly, stick to your ribs perfection. Worth every calorie.

I got the pear and saga cheese salad. It was a bit overdressed and the cheese not well presented on the plate. Flavors were great but I am one who likes my salad lightly dressed so overdressed is going to be a little off for me. I should point out my dad tried some of mine and thought it was perfect, so I think it really is my personal taste. I would get it again and next time alert the server to my preference. I have full confidence they will prepare it the way I prefer. I ordered the  Veal Chop and it was as lovely as I remembered. Fatty and tender. Slightly overcooked and I do mean slight. I asked for rare side of medium rare and got more medium side of medium rare. however it was still nice and rare in the middle and near the bone, this is a slight issue, I almost feel silly mentioning it but I am trying to be honest.. If we had been at straight medium, I would mark them down a star. It worked out because boyfriend prefers some medium pieces and traded some of his near bone rare pieces of his ribeye. Yea for me!

My boyfriend got the bone in ribeye and it was perfection as before. Melt in your mouth and lovely. Simply the best steak I have ever passed between my lips with the exception of Bern's Steakhouse Chateaubriand. For those who know their steakhouses that is rare and exceptional company.

We got two crabcakes for the table and they were divine, just like before. They really are all crabmeat with barely enough breading to hold it together. I am not sure how they even flip it over when cooking it. My boyfriend who gets crabcakes at every steakhouse for an appetizer said it was exceptional and very few if any were better.

We shared some of the croissant bread pudding for desert that came with the distinctive dining menu. It was amazing. Everyone at the table is bread pudding fans and we loved the idea and execution. Although the lactose intolerant in the group was disappointed to see the ice cream on top. It wasn't on the menu he saw and he cannot have it. He ate around it. He did not complain because he knows he would have been accommodated if he knew to request it and the portion was so big there was plenty that didn't have ice cream on it.

Service was impeccable. We will return on our next trip to Vegas for a fourth time happily.
Our waiter Dennis was excellent food was very good the croissant bread pudding was to die for. I would go here in second again.

Way over rated just OK at premium prices. Save your money and go elsewhere. While the steaks were just OK and a bit small the side dishes and salads were like something you would get at Chilis. $10 for creamed corn which was just a can of Del Monte corn is absurd.  Many better options in Vegas.

I have dined at this location several times in which I would have given a four+ star review.  We took my mother here for her birthday and, to the server's credit, he got us out right when we needed to be leaving for a show.  My mom and husband thought their steak and fish were very good.  

The reasons for the lower starred review is that the bread and butter were nothing to write home about and the sides and salad were all mediocre/undercooked/or overpriced for what you got.  Specifically, we got the mushrooms, which were above-average, potatoes au gratin which were like a cheese soup with very little potatoes, and uncooked and underseasoned brussels sprouts.  My salad had watery tomatoes and a really bland dressing.  It was disappointing to have such crappy sides because 1) they were expensive and 2) they comprised all of my vegetarian meal.  

Also, the waiter commented about three separate times about how much we must have liked our food or that we were hungry as he was clearing our plates  (rude).  Hey a**h*ole, if I'm paying about $4 per forkful, you had better believe we are eating all of it!!

My fiancé and I were having such a good time on Fremont Street that by the time we were thinking about dinner it was 10:15 pm. We had planned on going to Oscars in the Plaza but got there and realized they closed at 10:00. Someone recommended the steakhouse in the Golden Nugget. We got there at 10:30, they closed at 11:00. We were able to sit at the bar and order.... Such excellent service and the food..... Soooo amazing! I will definitely be back!

My experience at Vic and Anthony's was by far one of the best I've ever had.

My guy and I had our last dinner here while on vacation in Vegas.
We went all out and had the porterhouse steak for two with a side of broccoli and mashed potatoes with the added bonus of a fresh 3 1/2 pound lobster which I was able to select. 
The mashed potatoes were OK, not the greatest I've ever had as they were not quite mashed enough to my liking..there were still chunks of potatoes mixed in. The broccoli was good, hard to go wrong with a simple steamed broccoli.
The lobster was outstanding and cooked to perfection! Super buttery and delicious, im salivating just thinking about it as I type this.

Now, for the porterhouse...what a beautiful thick chunk of meat! 
The server brought it out to us and asked if it was to our liking, we gave him the OK he took it back and cut it for us.
The meat was delicious up until the end where one side of it was a little tough but definitely still edible (this is the only reason why I'm not giving V&A's 5 stars).

The service was impeccable, our server who's name I've forgotten was amazingly helpful and attentive. He genuinely seemed happy to be there and very knowledgeable about the menu, both the wine list and the food.

It was our anniversary dinner and I had let that be known to our server whom at the end of the our meal brought us out a slice of cheesecake. And oh what a slice it was!
I thought the portions they give out at the cheesecake factory was big! haha

In conclusion, I would highly reccomend Vic and Anthony's as a place to go for a nice dinner. You forget that you are even in downtown Vegas when here.
Good food and outstanding service! :)

Now that Ruth's chris has closed it looks like we found a new steak house !! Priced high but very tasty. I liked the decor, dark and rat packy.  Service was great, I had the bone in rib-eye , with broccoli & mashers. My date loved the huge lobster tail !  My steak was perfect, the big broccoli bushels were yummy and the mashers were great .They included a free chocolate layer cake that was incredible . Loved the location also .

I would 100% give this Steakhouse a 5 star. If I could give them more than a 5 start review, I absolutely would. 

I checked out the website prior to our arrival and was pleasantly surprised to see their "Pre-Fixed Menu" that was offered for $49 a person. Although the pre-fixed menu is not offered on the menu when you enter the building it does share online if you bring the menu with you that they will offer/validate the price. 

 The menu included one of the following:
1.) Salad or Soup
2.) Filet Mignon/Salmon or Pasta
3.) Side dish of Au Potatoes, green beans or Creamy spinach.
4.) Dessert (I had the Crème Brule) but they also had the option of a Chocolate Cake (one other but I am not sure off hand what it was)

A few Co-Workers and I got all different dishes for our side and we were able to share them since they are more of a "Family Style." All dishes were great but I would highly recommend the potatoes or creamy spinach. 

I go the Filet Mignon and it was immaculate. It was perfectly cooked and all flavors were absolutely perfect throughout each bite. 

For the cost, ambiance and service I would absolutely be back!
The roasted salmon was absolutely off the charts! We love their location in downtown Houston, and this may be our overall favorite in Vegas too! Yum!!

EXCELLENT!!!!!!  Wow! By far the best steak house I have ever been too. 

*outstanding service 
*High quality 
*fair priced (you get what you pay for)

Defiantly will return
The Mash was incredible! Great wine, and the food... very flavorful! recommended all the way!

Yum! 

My boyfriend was very sweet to take me here during a dinner break while we were at The Golden Nugget. We don't usually go to downtown LV, but it's actually pretty cool! 

Anyway... this steakhouse is great! We ordered: 

Crabcake appetizer -Yumm, it's basically all crab meat and no filler. Totally great. The crab pieces are gigantic and plump. It comes with a little sauce drizzled on the top with a few chopped tomatoes. Delicious! I wish I could eat some right now. This was probably the best thing I ate. 

Filet Mignon -Perfectly cooked medium rare. They're great cuz they verify what medium-rare means to them, so that no one gets something they weren't expecting. 

Australian Lobster Tail -Mmm... So many times I have overcooked lobster and it just tastes so gross. But this was so good. Dipped in butter... yumM!! I forgot prepared, but it doesn't matter! 

Au Gratin Potatoes -Just cheesy potatoes. I couldn't stop eating it. So good! The potatoes are chopped into little pieces rather than sliced and the cheese is perfectly burnt just a little on top.  

We also ordered the most amazing red wine, per recommendation of the waiter. Wow it was so good. It was the first time that I actually saved the cork. Unfortunately, I can't remember what it was (perhaps I drank too much!) 

We didn't have time for dessert, but I'm sure it would have been good :) Or if you're here you can skip dessert and then go across the street and get some deep fried oreos to end your night! If you are in downtown LV, definitely stop by Vic & Anthony's!
This is now my favorite spot to have a steak in LV. The Filet mignon was absolutely delicious. The prices are a little high, but you get what you pay for.

Wir waren zum Abendessen in diesem Steakhouse und haben megaklasse gegessen. Der Service war wirklich ausgezeichnet und sehr sehr freundlich. Das Essen war qualitativ sehr hochwertig, lecker und schön angerichtet. Ausreichende Portionen, und der Geschmack war sooo unglaublich gut. Wir haben selten so gutes Steak sowie Fisch gegessen. Das Brot mit Butter als Start war sehr sehr gut. Macht weiter so!! Herkommen lohnt sich auf alle Fälle :)

My brother and I ate here Friday night. We got a reservation for 6:15. We arrived and were promptly seated. Luckily, we got a really cool waitress, Annette. She wasn't stuffy or snobby like some of the waiters at the tables near us. 
We ordered; 
fresh water oysters 
wedge salad with blue cheese crumbles 
2 bone in rib-eyes 
au gratin potatoes 
asparagus 
shiner bock 
tea 

The oysters were surprisingly good. We'd never tried freshwater before. The wedge salad was basically a half head of lettuce. I wasn't expecting it to be that big. The crumbled blue cheese was really good. The steaks were as big as my head. They were cooked to order, juicy, and delicious. The au gratin potatoes were all right. It tasted like they just melted Velveeta cheese over the top. And the asparagus were cooked just right. 
Was it expensive? Yes ($200; tip included). 
Was it worth it? Definitely! 
I mean, it's not like you do this everyday. And, you're on vacation. So splurge!
Best ribeye I've ever eaten. Delicious mashed potato on the side (gluten free). Great service, and cosy atmosphere. My favourite steakhouse so far and worth every penny!
We had a salad, crab cake, and Mac and cheese! Perfect way to end a night of sipping on ever clear slushies :)

VERY nice.  Maybe nicest dinner I've had in vegas.  Of course Wait staff can make or break an evening and our Lady was sweet, knowledgeable and very personable . Would definately recommend.  Then you're right in the action on Freemont street!

The best steak house ever.  Great service, and awesome food.  We've split the porterhouse several times, and it's been perfect each time.  The other steaks and sides are wonderful.  Not much else I need to say... it's awesome!

Okay I want to start off by saying that Vic and Anthony's is literally my favorite restaurant EVER. It is SO SO SO good - and I've never even had their steak. 

I had a wedge salad, crab cake and lobster bisque. Holy cow, it was amazing. We had an awesome server, and the place is so classy and nice. 

I've spent the last year dreaming about that crab cake, btw. UGH. The next time I come to Vegas I promise you the first thing I do will be getting one of those crab cakes!
Love the old Vegas feel. Best bone in Ribera and creamed spinach. Great service..! Will b back. :) nice to get off strip 4 fabulous meal.

I feel like a broken record as all of the reviews are similar but it really was that good.  The setting is really romantic and we were upstairs in a private area with only a few other tables.  The lobster bisque is truly the best I have ever had with chunks of Maine lobster. The portobello mushroom app was large with large chunks of tomato, mozzarella & basil.  I had the chilean seabass a la nage at it was buttery and amazing.  My fiance had a 4 1/2 lobster ($140) (the waiter recommended we share but it was his birthday) and he couldn't even eat half of it but it was cooked perfectly! I had creme brulee served in a wide, narrow dish so there was a lot of crust and it was pretty good and they brought the birthday boy a beautiful (complimentary) croissant bread pudding that was pretty great!  This place is high end so it isn't cheap but I thought it was worth the money!  Victor was a truly gracious waiter and glasses never were empty and he anticipated everything. The only thing I didn't love was the hot tea; it was bitter but I just assume the water was too hot so it didn't steep properly.  Definitely will be back.  For a great deal, go to their website for the "distinctive" dinner...four courses for $50!  I had it and was so full I couldn't move!
Fine dining, romantic atmosphere. Great steaks, exceptional bone-in filet mignon. Definitely a place to come back for more!

I read quite a few reviews on here that defend their less than 5 star review simply because of the prices. You get what you pay for here and then some. The service here was excellent and the food was beyond what I had expected. The "sides" were generously portioned (we ordered the wild mushrooms and broccoli and had left overs). Steaks were flawless, like melts in your mouth flawless. We will definitely be visiting Vic & Anthony's again if we make it out here to Vegas.
Outstanding from the service to the food. Hosted a bday dinner for my wife. From drinks to apps to dinner and desert and more drinks it was perfect.

Always consistent, always fantastic. Steak prepared like Ruth's Chris, best sides of any steakhouse, excellent atmosphere and service. Absolutely nothing ever bad to say about this establishment after 4 or 5 visits.

I am a fan of Ruth's Chris but I find the quality and service inconsistent, so friends of mine urged us to join them at Vic & Anthony's. They really talked it up so I was worried about being over sold, but it was really excellent. We each ordered the Deal for about $50 that includes a 8 oz filet, soup or salad, a side and dessert. We had to ask special for this because our waiter didn't tell us about it and it's not on the menu. (I find that strange...Ruth's Chris puts their Deal in the menu. Luckily our friends knew about it.)

The steaks were all cooked perfectly, the sides are good--better than Ruth's Chris', and the dessert was better also. The wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The atmosphere was warm and quiet, which I really appreciate when you are trying to have a nice meal.

Three hours of free parking with a validated ticket which is enough time for a drink at the Golden Nugget before dinner, dinner and even a quick walk around Fremont Street.

A friend gave my husband and me a gift card for the Vic and Anthony's at the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas.  We do not drink alcohol, and the waiter (Ben) seemed to take it as a personal offense when we declined to see the wine list.  My husband does not eat red meat, so he inquired about the chicken.  Even more offended, our waiter proceeded to tell us that "it's cooked in a pan" and literally just stared at us.  Finally, he said "We're known for being a steak house." I think I saw him roll his eyes, but it was kind of dark in there.  I even chuckled to myself when he mentioned the high priced lobsters that he is sure we noticed in the tank on the way in.  What made that statement funny was the fact that I did look at the tank as we walked by, and it was completely empty!!  Our waiter was so rude that we basically couldn't wait to get out of there.  Needless to say, he treated us with absolute contempt when we declined the dessert menu and the after dinner cocktails.  When my husband put the gift card and additional cash in the bill binder, the waiter actually said "I presume this is a gift card of some sort?" then scampered off to verify it before we left as though we were some losers who planned to "dine and dash".  Although our meals tasted really good, it was a horrible experience.

My first time here was a treat for my birthday. Upscale, dressy vibe with a cross between business dinner and intimate dining. The portions are so large you are able to split a steak and take some home. Creme brulee is the best in the world! Not even the French have perfected as Vic & Ant has. 

Dine here for birthdays, guest in town, business dinners and any chance I can!!

Hands down, this our favorite restaurant ever! My husband and I always stay in the Rush Tower at the Golden Nugget (which is fabulous) when we are in Vegas and going to Vic and Anthony's is always an event.
Anything you order on the menu is to die for and the service is impeccable. The atmosphere is very classy but not snotty at all. The most amazing part is their prices are extremely reasonable, especially for a nice steakhouse. Save yourself the trouble of breaking the bank at one of the fancy steakhouses on the Strip and head downtown :o)

The wait staff was incredible so that bumped it up from 3 to 4 stars. Solely base on the food, it would have been 3.

Appetizer:
We ordered the oysters Rockefeller and while I'm not a huge fan of oysters, these were amazing. Really fresh and the sauces to accompany them were perfect. 

Dinner:
My NY strip steak was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. Worth every single penny. I would suggest splitting the sides though...they're huge and way too much for one person. I asked for a wine pairing and I expected the server to suggest the most expensive one on the list, but it was the second least expensive and went perfect with my steak. 

Dessert:
I ordered the creme brûlée and it was great but, again, enough for two people. Being that I had the Tahitian vanilla bean creme brûlée at Le Cirque (Bellagio) the night before, it didn't stand up. Still very yummy though. 

Definitely worth the money if you're a steak fan.

I have been to several prime steakhouses and V&A is tops. Service was exemplary and catered to our upbeat, party style attitude with my particular group of friends. They did not miss a beat. The server was fun and courteous and not stuffy. The sommelier was the best I have encountered and catered to our requests.

We started with some oysters rockefeller and they were delectable! I had the ribeye and lobster tail. The steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection, the lobster a bit tough, but good, and the mashed potatoes were equally well prepared. She had the filet and quality was top-notch and rich in flavor. 

All in the party enjoyed apps, meals and drinks and we left food-high and happy! 

What a great way to celebrate my 40th B-day!

Choosing Vic & Anthony's over the plethora of other great Vegas steakhouses wasn't easy.  I'm sure many, if not all, of the other options would have been great as well, but we were very pleased with our choice.  The service was absolutely wonderful and the food was amazing (me the filet, her the crab/lobster/filet combo special).  We'll be tempted to try another Vegas steakhouse the next time around for a new experience, but we may well end up back at Vic & Anthony's because it was so great.

Our only complaint (and it's a big one) is that the Golden Nugget valet was full (at 7p) and the parking garage was one of the worst we've ever experienced (long delays, nearly full, expensive (though V&A's validates), with a slow/crappy elevator, and stairwells that lock behind you, preventing you from re-entering the garage!  But since parking isn't the restaurant's fault, we won't ding them for that.

Ok, I wanted to update this review based on the EXCELLENT management that gave me a wonderful experience for my 30th anniversary awhile back.  Really?  The best steak (and it was a New York)  I have had at any time in Las Vegas.  I love this place and so will you.  I know good restaurants and I know damn good art.  Trust me.

Coming to stay at the Golden Nugget I started looking at the restaurants located in the hotel and saw the great reviews for Vic and Anthonys. This is one of those spots that live up to the hype behind the reviews.  Our server was so amazing. The guy knew his stuff when it came to food and wine pairing. 

A lot of yelpers talked about the lobster bisque so we had to try that. My wife said it was one of the best she ever had. The waiter even brought me a sample of the potato and cheese soup because I mentioned two my wife it sounded good. (ahh the little things) I threw down for some Kobe Beer and my lady got the Filet and Lobster (Dammnn girl *like Jaime Fox in Booty Call) Seriously her filet was so freaking good I had a little bit of food envy. 

Vegas is known for getting you to stuff your belly for as cheap as possible. But Vic & Anthonys is a reason to avoid that $1.95 buffet that will call from some tums later on and spend some cash (hopefully winnings) on a great meal. Get in here and dont be afraid to order that after dinner shot of cognac, and I hate cognac but when in rome....CHEERS!!!

Pretty awesome traditional steakhouse! Nestled in the Golden Nugget downtown, V&A has that old-school feel, all dark wood and low light. It was a busy weeknight (the rodeo was in town), so while service wasn't super speedy, we were acknowledged quickly, and our server was very sweet and personable. 

I had the Apple Mule, upon my server's recommendation, and it was quite tasty, a nice play on the Moscow Mule, with a green apple slice as garnish. 

My business partner and I started with the calamari and crabcake as appetizers. The calamari was very good, lightly battered, tender, and piping hot. Initially, we thought there was no sauce, and requested a side of marinara. The server very nicely told us that she'd have to get it from another restaurant on property, and we told her never mind, that's ok, but she got it anyway! By that time, we'd discovered that there actually was sauce! Underneath the calamari, were sweet onions with a sweet and spicy sauce. It was great! I feel badly that she got the marinara anyway. 

The crabcake... Wowzers!!! I think it was the best crabcake I've EVER tasted, and I'm a seafood fanatic. Light, barely any breading and filler, sweet, with a cream sauce.. It was amazing. I'm contemplating returning just to get another. I ate the entire thing, my partner didn't get a bite. 

Now, to the meat! We both ordered the filet mignon. I ordered mine medium rare. At the first bite, I initially thought it was a little overdone, but by the third bite, it was perfect.  I think it just might not have been evenly cooked. Regardless, it was very good, and well seasoned.

We split an order of fries, and they were also tasty. Not too crisp, just enough on the outside and soft in the middle. 

We didn't have enough room for dessert, so we called it an evening. The bill totaled around $150, which we thought was pretty fair. 

Finally, I can check Vic & Anthony's off the list. Good showing!

Great Service, Great food!  Came here with a bunch of friends for their bday. Waiter was courteous and polite. everyone there had a smile on their faces.  I loved my dish. I ordered the Roasted Salmon stuffed with Crab meat, with asparagus & mash potatoe, omg, sooo delicious!  My husband ordered a steak, forgot which one, very tasty.  Ordered mushroom on the side, a bit too salty to taste. Everything was great, but it was a bit pricey. We had 8 ppl, ordered 1 bottle of red wine, most ordered steak except for 3 of us, maybe about 6 sides, came out to be $650. Or maybe that wasn't too bad...but given that this rest was inside Golden Nugget Casino Hotel...didn't think price would be high...but the food was delicious.

I actually thought our appy's were the best part of this meal.  The quail was amazing and I could have made a meal on that.  The beef carpaccio was excellent!  The raw oysters were decent.  The ribeye was just ok- I think I make better at home.

My theme of this review is a shout out to my boy Drake because it's one of  "The Best I Ever Had" and you'll read why.

Located in the most unpretentious hotel, not on the glamorous side of the Strip, Vic & Anthony's is a hidden gem within a hidden gem.  Sure, I was apprehensive but V&A's is Michelin rated, granted it's just one star but, that's one more than most of the restos on the Strip.

First off, do your research, check out their menu on the Golden Nugget website and make reservations.  They offer a prix fixe menu, which is a super deal.  It comes with your choices of soup or salad to start, three entrees to choose from, a selection of sides and a dessert to share.  For $46.95 per person, it's a super deal.  If you calculate it, between two people, you're getting one side and the dessert for free.  However, you have to know to order this PF deal, as it will not be listed on the menu nor will they offer it to you.  Think of it as an exclusive secret society menu...mwahaha!

However to start,  we ordered the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake, which seriously had to be the,  "Best CC I Ever Had."  Why do I say that?  Well, it was jam packed with pieces of lump crab just as the name states, not crab shreds, crab filler or krab with a k.

The s/o and I had the Lobster Bisque, which was truly rich and creamy with bits of lobster in it.  We both literally licked our respective bowls and used pieces of bread to clean the bowls!  This LB was the,  "Best LB I Ever Had."

I was going to order the Sea Bass but the s/o gave me a dirty look about ordering seafood at a steakhouse.  I'm just not a fan of Filet Mignon and it's thick cut but, the s/o's right, it IS a steakhouse.  However to my delight, the FM was so tender, juicy and flavorful.  Hmm...V&A has made me a believer, maybe I've just had crappy FM in the past?  So again, this was the "Best FM I Ever Had."

We both got a choice of side, which is big enough for 2-3 people to share.  We ordered the Creamed Spinach and Au Gratin Potatoes.  Both were not necessarily the, "Best I Ever Had" but both were quite delicious.

For dessert, we choose the Croissant Bread Pudding.  Wow, there's something about the elegance of a croissant that just made this bread pudding like no other.  Instead of being flat and heavy, it was just the opposite.  The side of ice cream was a pure delight.  So, was this the "Best Bread Pudding I Ever Had?"  Damn right!

The service was truly outstanding!  From the hostess, to our server and other wait staff.  My only thing was that the restaurant was really dark, or maybe my eyes are just going bad?

V&A is top notch and is worth skipping the toney Strip restos.  And in closing, I'm ending this review the same way Drake ended his song, "Best I Ever Had,"

"See this is the type of joint you gotta dedicate to somebody, make sure it's that special somebody...."

Very Good.  The Steaks are Cooked with perfection. I have been 3 times and the Service was just OK until I had the Server with the Handle Bar Mustache now he was what I want in a server at a establishment such as Vic & Anthony's  

Desert to get is the Bread Pudding but ask for more Ice Cream... it's needed.
The Cheesecake is a Large Portion and can be shared.

I tried the special of Lobster and Pasta.... NOPE  didn't work for me... taste like Mac & Cheese with some Lobster in it...

I hated every Side Dish except the Baked Potato   & Risotto  

I will go back again & again when in Vegas.
Noah the bartender is simply amazing! Words cannot describe how much of an asset he is to Vic and Anthony's. 3lb lobster was excellent!

It was good.  Good service.  Tasty food.  Cool location.  

The quality off the meat though doesn't match the price.  Filet mignon was kind of tough.  Ordered medium rare, was served medium well and half of it had a black hard carbon shell.  The crab cake was good!

I've had better steak at home or even at chains like saltgrass.

Special thanks to Chef Rodriguez for his gracious hosptality and most wonderful meal. @Vic_n_Anthonys steakhouse located in downtown #Vegas' newly renovated Gold tower at the @GoldenNuggetLV Hotel & Casino 

We had a reservation for 7pm and were seated immediately. The dining room was very elegant with beautiful stained glass ceiling, formal settings with low mood lighting. 

The waiter came out promptly introducing himself and welcoming us with a full description of the evenings menu and specials that were currently being offered. The evenings specials were the Lobster live from the tanks and Kobe steak heated to liking on a hot salt tablet prepared tableside VERY COOL!! 

We ordered drinks a couple apps and a steak dinner and a couple desserts. 

The apps came out quickly-a crab cake like NO other. light and crispy full of crab covered in crab with a sauce I'm not sophisticated enough to describe but the fact I DO NOT eat seafood and I licked the plate clean here says it ALL!! WOW!! 

The other appetizer Maple Glazed Quail was alot like chicken drumettes but lighter tastier with a wonderful combination of greens+tomatoes with another indesribeable sauce:) YUM 

What a way to get started!!! We could hardly wait to try the steak. 16oz prime strip cooked medium-rare:) and of course a baked potato loaded with butter&sour cream!! Thats me Mr Meat & Potatoes;) 

BEST STEAK EVER!!! I have only been to a handful of places that even offer steaks costing more than $20 so I have limited experience here but this was by far and away the best steak I have EVER had. Melt in your mouth delicious!! Oh and the potato wasn't bad either lol :) 

After this amazing meal -Chef Rodriguez came out to thank us for coming in and then we talked about his visits to some of the #Vegas restaurants he had visited during his stay concluding there's so much to discover and it's such a fun and tasty adventure. 

To our surprise the Chef presented us dessert--Cheesecake with blueberries and sauce and croissant bread pudding w/ice cream and lots of lil extras that just took it over the TOP:) 

The desserts were GREAT but after taking home the bread pudding and trying it the NEXT day it seemed even BETTER 

What a wonderful dining experience-pleasant atmosphere, truly fantastic personal service, and the food was to die for. I would recommend it to EVERYONE and if you are on Death Row(Texas reference) and have to select your LAST MEAl-If you wanna feel that feeling like you've REALLY lived now-ORDER it from Vic & Anthony's!!

Vic & Anthony's is located in the Golden Nugget in downtown  Las Vegas.  Who would have known there is such a great steakhouse in dt las vegas!  Make reservations because this place gets packed. 

Jumbo lump crab cake: the best crab cake I've had outside of Maryland.  They are not lying when they say jumbo lump and they are not stingy with it.  Barely any breadcrumbs which is what crab cake should be like. 

Broiled portabello mushroom: great especially with a piece of mozzarella cheese.

Iceberg wedge salad and Caesar salad: standard salads nothing out of the ordinary.

Lobster bisque: yummy!  There is a strong  taste of cognac.

Sea bass a la nage: the best fish dish I have ever had.  This is how all fish should taste.  It was heavenly and not only that they sprinkle it with jumbo lump crab!

Prime ribeye: cooked to perfection.

Au gratin potatoes: simply delicious!  I really liked the cheese it was baked with.

Mac & cheese: good, but the potatoes were definitely better.

Vic & Anthony's is one of the best steakhouses I have been to.  No complaints here.

If I have to rate top five steaks I'd ever had, this is one of them. It isn't cheap either. And remember, when you order steak, it is steak only. There are no salad or potatoes. 

Make sure you make an reservation first because the line is long. Parking can be an issue too. I had to park at palaza casino across street .

The steak was made perfect. Every bite was succulent, and full of flavorite. No need pepper, salt, or steak sauce. Service is very good as well. The bill was 140 for three of us and we didn't order wine.

1 year later, second time is still memorable .

From start to finish, this was top notch! My husband took me here for my 40th birthday and everyone knew, the meal was excellent, my husband really enjoyed his seafood soup ap, and his halibut. I loved my seared tuna, and for dessert we had croissant bread pudding, Devine. Every patron leaving kept shaking their servers hands and gushing about what a wonderful experience they had, including us!  Only sad thing for me was I was a little hungover from the previous day and was unable to partake in their fabulous looking cocktails.

Stayed at the Golden Nugget and we ate dinner here all 3 nights-it was THAT amazing! The pan-fried chicken is the best chicken I've ever had...and the Lobster Bisque is even better! The steaks are so tender & seasoned perfectly! For all you wine lovers-they have a very extensive wine binder...yup no list here! We will definitely be back!!!

To. Die. For. 

This is my absolute favorite place to eat in Vegas and really, everywhere else. A perfect gem in the otherwise wacky Fremont Street area. Exceptional service, gorgeous atmosphere and beyond excellent food every single time. Pretty pricey, but not as expensive as lots of other fancy steakhouses that aren't as good and this place is worth every penny. Everything I've had here has been beyond delicious, but my favorite things to order are the filet mignon (it doesn't need it, but the blue cheese bacon butter is a delicious addition!), the potatoes au gratin, the wild mushrooms, and the bread pudding! While you're there you can't help but think that meals and dining experiences should always be this perfect.

I'm sure you already know all the praises at this place so I'm just gonna be short and sweet about it.  

This is your typical high end steak house with quality food and service.  Any type of bone-in meats are the way to go.  The duck fat potatoes were the best!

Yes I will come back!

On a beef feast, 3 dinners in Vegas . . . Texas de Brazil, Chart House and Vic & Anthony's.  What can I say 'The Best Beef Of The Week'.  I was tired and want a steakhouse and did not want to leave the hotel.  It ambiance is traditional steakhouse along the Morton's line . . . Morton's has always been a place I loved to go when on the road too long but that is another story . . . centered on familiarity.  And so it is with Vic and Anthony's.  I started with a Booker and suggested that an associate try one.  I thought South Africans could drink . . . well now I have two.  I had a beefsteak tomato salad, excellent, and followed it up with a ribeye and some creamed spinach.  Next time I will upgraded to the bone in ribeye.  The quality of the steak was Prime and it sang out its quality on the first bite.  The creamed spinach was spot on.  Stag's Leap bottles were 1/2 off on selected bottles.  I had some with dinner.  Finished with a espresso.  

In summary, I would have not searched it out.  But is a very good steakhouse and hits all the right notes.  So why then only 4 starts . . . now this could be really pissy but the service was over attentive . . . there is a fine balance when serving between attentive and annoying.  To be fair, I would have given them 4 1/2 stars, maybe even 4 3/4 stars, but I just can't give them a 5 star review.  I know I am a bastard . . . but in the end it comes down to the fact that I would return only  if it was convenient but I would not search this excellent restaurant out.  Instead I would be more adventurous.

Vic & Anthony's is one of the finest restaurants I've ever eaten in. 

Began with French onion soup, followed by lettuce wedge w/ Roquefort chunks, then small fillet Mignon (rare) for the entree, and ending with a desert of bread pudding to die for, (made with croissants).  --I don't usually rave about bread pudding, which you can find at any L.V. buffet, but this one was recommended to me by my server, and turned out to be incredible, (served with a small scoop of vanilla ice cream). 

The service was impeccable and the food was prepared flawlessly.  --One of the finest pieces of beef I've ever eaten.

I will return to Las Vegas in three weeks and Vic & Anthony's is a must.

What can I say this place is good.
You must get the crab cake!!!!! It is very delicious along with the steaks.

It's a unique hidden little gem. Very old school playing great music with a dark & sexy atmosphere. The food is always delicious with huge portions. We can never finish it all! 
I highly recommend them to all who enjoy steak houses. Parking is never available so plan on parking somewhere near the Golden Nugget but the hotel itself is beautiful, they've done an amazing job renovating the old place. The food is amazing so it's all worth it. I'm a huge fan of this place. Great service as well & bring your appetite.

This place is amazing, we had crab cake appetizers and I got the 8oz Filet Mignon which was perfect. I expected it to be more expensive than it was since the service and food were top notch. I am getting married at the Golden Nugget in the future and can not wait to come back.

16 oz. Prime Cut Rib Eye was the best steak I have ever eaten in my entire life!!! I was literally in heaven while devouring this precious piece of meat! I couldn't even open my eyes while I was chewing bc it was so mf ono just melting away in my mouth! 

Thank you baby jesus to the steakhouse who closed at 930 who reccommended me to come here!!!!! 

BEST STEAK EVER!!!!!!!!!!!

I am definitely going back on my next visit to Vegas!

I had the 12oz filet mignon asparagus, and a glass of the ZD pinot noir. Steak was delicious and perfectly prepared. I had it cooked to medium. Wine perfectly complimented my steak. My only gripe is it bothers me to leave a restaurant spend about $70+ a person, on the low end mind you, and still be hungry. I remember looking at my plate when they brought it to me, and I thought, damn I see a lot of white plate. So my scoring is purely on how my steak tasted. Will I be back, probably not. Just can't justify the cost for such a small amount of food.

The food is good, but just good. The  service is good. We had crab cake appetizer, and Gordon Biersch is much better. The steak was ok, but much like a 15.00 Applebee's type. We had the ribeye. The best part of the meal was the salmon, which was very good. The seating is not appropriate for the prices charged. They are few "private" tables, and we shared a bench, with a large party (8 or so.) Not ideal for a special birthday dinner. One appetizer, one salad, and two entrees - no alcohol, and the bill was 160.00 - too much for the quality. There are too many other really nice restaurants in Vegas, to go back here. Sorry, I really hoped this was going to be a better review.

The first time we dined at Vic & Anthony's was for our Anniversary on 4/19/16. The food, the service, everything was absolutely phenomenal. That is was brought us back for round two a little over a month later. The food again was absolutely delish. We both ordered the 8oz filet and a 1/2 pound side of crab, purée potatoes and asparagus. We also had the creme brûlée for dessert which is a must!!! The second time around, the service was absolutely dreadful. Growing up in this town and seeing how things work, we more often then not get mistaken for "children who probably won't tip well." It is ridiculous. Just because I'm young doesn't mean I'm going to tip like shit. Now that you have given me terrible service and only touched our table once since we got our food, that is what will give you a bad tip. We constantly needed refills. Our server at one time glanced at our table, saw my husband needed and coke, then proceeded to greet the 8-top that just sat down. His spiel took almost 10 min. Fortunately we both work in the industry so we know what good service and bad service is, but when you are paying $100 per person to eat, you think the service would be above the rest. 

**One server does not make a restaurant terrible. It is just unfortunate that a great restaurant hires incompetent servers.

I did not expect the old strip to have a nice steakhouse but this place was great. I thought the old strip in general would be super ghetto and don't get me wrong it is a different scene for sure but it's really come a long way. The golden nugget has been updated nicely and Vic and Anthony's was delicious. Probably one of the better steaks I've had in a while! Nice wine selection and great service as well!

We decided on having the chicken.  I'm assuming most people go for the steak but I'm a sucker for good chicken and I figured this place would be a hit.  We were so disappointed.   The chicken was very dry.  It came with mashed potatoes that were nothing spectacular, just home made.  It also came with two spears of asparagus that were cooked well but bland.  We both commented that I could have made a better dinner at home.  I didn't come to Vegas to spend so much on chicken that I could have done better myself.  I was so bummed out.  We did have the scallops as an appetizer and they were pretty good on their own.  The mix that came with it had dry old bacon bits in it.  So I guess my only advice is don't bother with the chicken unless you are looking for a dried out home cooked meal arranged all fancy on a big plate.  I will say however, the service there was excellent and I give that part 5 stars.
The best steak and service of any restaurant I've eaten. Must try the crab cakes and the creamed spinach. Great selection of wines.

BEST STEAK HOUSE IN VEGAS

I've eaten here many times -- you can't get a bad meal and the service is amazing

Wow wow wow wow & wow 

We have tried about 90% of the steak houses here in Las Vegas. Whether it be a bizarre me at SLS or CarneYvino at Venetian,  This steak house is so far above the rest you can't even compare. It's almost in its own category. Chef Eric has his steak cooking method down to a T. 
From the second we walked in the atmosphere; the server was so knowledgeable yet not pushy in the slightest way. The food from ...the crab cake to the Tomahawk, to the bone in filet, to the bone in ribeye, to that lobster tail was unbelievable. 

I work at a steakhouse on the strip here in Vegas, but was beyond impressed tasting Chefs food. It was an unreal experience. 

Crab cake- sorry but holy F@&k!!!!!!! So much crab. Big, thick, a light lemon bur blanc sauce. 5stars

Quail- enough to share for 6 ppl, the nice spice was perfect for the dish

Tar- tar make it as salty as you'd like, as it comes on a salt block. 

48oz tomahawk Australian Wagu- speechless. Full of flavor. The best cut of beef I've ever had

15oz 180 dry aged Bone in filet- bucket list. Crossed off. Couldn't ask for something more worth trying. 

Other guest got the bone in ribeye and the lobster tail. Both biggest steaks I've ever seen. 

Dessert- biggest cheese cake ever, a chocolate cake that was as rich as some of the gamblers here in Vegas, and a bread pudding that would knock you off your feet. 

To finish with the beat espresso Martini I've ever hat. 

By far...  The best steakhouse in town.

One of the best steaks we've ever had...

The filet was so tender it just melted in your mouth. The oysters were amazing and the service impeccable. This is just what I expected from a top notch restaurant like this. Dine here and you will not be disappointed. Worth every penny.

A great treasure for me to find. I love this place . If you love .It was in the Golden Nugget Casino. I had the lamb chops wich  were cooked to perfection. and my friend had the sole wich was great. It was expensive ,but well worth it service was great and ,I FELT LIKE ONE OF THE SOPRANO'S ACTORS WERE GONNA COME INTO THE JOINT AT MINUTE.

Ok so hmmm its nice. Im not crazy about the prices but the service is on point. The food is above average. I give it three stars. I will return many more times. I just think when you pay this much to have a nice evening why do people bring they children. The last thing I want on my romantic evening with my husband is to hear some yelling infant.

First tried calling for a reservation for the tasting room (private room).  I'm dinging a star from the review because I had to call multiple times to get everything correct: finally they just gave me the manager's email address and we corresponded that way.  After you visit the restaurant you can see why they have so much trouble: they take the reservations from the front desk, and it's just too loud.

So I was in charge of preparing everything for 10 Japanese executives. Over email with the manager we created a set menu that had everything except dessert already decided.  They did a great job getting everything ready for us.

Our menu was three appetizers (quail, crab cakes, jumbo shrimp).  My guests liked the quail and crab cakes, but the jumbo shrimp was pretty ordinary for them.  I liked the quail.

What I thought would be the most boring part of the meal got the most positive response: the iceberg wedge salad.  The dressing was very good, and they way it's presented makes it appetizing.

Next up was the filet mignon.  I had them cook the steaks medium with only salt and pepper.  Vic&Anthony's has a lot of options for sauces, but I think simple is always best with great meat.

I met with Brian who manages all of the wine and explained the budget ($50 per person for initial drinks: beyond that each person must pay their own way).  This is a typical way Japanese groups handle these outings, because it gives some slack on what drink choices are available.  Brian suggested a magnum bottle of a good cabernet sauvignon, which hadn't even occurred to me.  It really impressed my guests because you don't see magnum bottles in restaurants very often in Japan.

We ran out of wine just before they served the steak, so I went in half with one of our younger guests for a standard sized bottle of wine.  I wanted to get an idea of the wine markup, so I asked for a bottle of something I knew they would have.  Based on the price they quoted me, expect to pay between 2~3 times winery prices, which is a little on the high side for restaurants, but they brought out the decanter as well, so factoring in everything involved I can understand the higher prices.

On the tasting room: it's private but not closed off from the rest of the restaurant.  Think of it like a VIP room in a club and that should give you a good idea.

The service charge was included in the bill (20%), and if you pay with a credit card they'll ask to see some ID.

Mein liebstes Steakhouse in Vegas!

Das Ambiente ist stilvoll, wenn auch etwas dunkel.  Der Kellner war sehr nett und auch hilfreich bei der Beratung, ohne immer gleich zu viel aufzuschwatzen.
Das Filet Mignion gibts für ca $45 und die Qualität war immer sensationell. Zart und saftig, auf den Punkt gegart.
Zusätzlich gibts Lobster etc. für ein Surf n Turf.
wenn man denn noch Hunger hat nach dem
12oz Filet.

Die Weine sind etwas teuer, wie an vielen Orten in Vegas, aber anonsten gibts auch Bier und Soda.
Als Beilage empfehle ich das Kartoffel Gratin.

Für Steak Fans ein Muss :-)

The service was great but the food was very disappointing.  My $50 ribeye was overcooked and lacked seasoning.  The crab cake and the asparagus was good,but the mac n cheese and bland.  I would not recommend this place to anyone

Filet mignon & lobster tail was wonderful.  I had the beet salad which I loved.  My sister had the Caeser salad which she loved.  Service was great.  Expensive (like most fine dining places) but the whole experience was great.
Great service and food. Historic old school Vegas style. Lobster bisque, oysters on the half shell and filet was perfect. Timely food service.

I went to Vic & Anthony's with a family member and we sat at the bar.  The bartender, Megan, was charming, efficient, and her suggestions made our evening perfect.  I asked for a dry white and she suggested the Terlato Pino Grigio which was perfect for me.  We decided to have a selection of appetizers instead of an entree and she helped us decide on the perfect selection.  We started with the fresh oysters - there were 3 different kinds and Megan explained where each came from.  The oysters came with lemon, horse radish, cocktail sauce, and my new favorite dipping sauce for oysters - balsamic with green onions - divine!  The pear and saga bleu cheese salad was yummy and the calamari was perfectly prepared.   We also enjoyed the jumbo lump crab cake which had large lovely pieces of crab and just enough breading to hold it together browned perfectly - just the way we like it.   We finished off the evening with an amazing chocolate cake - again Megan's suggestion.  If you are near the Golden Nugget, I highly recommend visiting with Megan at the bar in Vic & Anthony's.  We met some great people while we were dining - due to Megan's introductions.  She really made it a great experience for us.

Old school steakhouse filled with delicious USDA cuts.  I was so lucky to have been invited to this wonderful place for a wedding dinner.  The service was amazing.  The selection of apps and salads were wide-ranging.  Rockefeller oysters were the star for me as a Briny surprise under a gooey cheesy topping.  The crash cake was packed to the gills with lump crabmeat. Deliciously sweet and yielding meat.  For the main meal it was a delicious Tomahawk steak, prime rib And rock lobster  with sides of gratin, spinach, asparagus and onion rings.  The asparagus hit the spot as all the others were just what you would get elsewhere.  

The place was small but they really deliver on exceptional service.  My wine glass was always full and they delivered the food on time.  As well they made a wonderful wedding cake for dessert.  Seriously delicious and moist!  I am over the moon to have been able to experience this place!

Great exerience! Had the 8 oz filet mignon, it was cooked to perfection. Ordered a side of lobster risotto-delicious! The sides are MORE than enough for 2 people to share so  keep this in mind when ordering. Even the baked potato is HUGE, probably about equal to 3 average potatoes. Would eat here again in a heartbeat.

From the time we stepped in the front door without a reservation we felt welcomed; service was excellent, Heather, our waitress was attentive to every detail and the food was exquisite; we had an excellent evening!!!

Never in my life have I had a Fillet Mignon like this. It is impossible for anyone to make it better. Wonderful food, outstanding, actually more than outstanding service. Clearly one of the best, maybe THE best meal of my life. This place is heaven, expensive heaven, but heaven none the less.

This place has a very nice atmosphere - 5 stars -  but the food is really just A-OK. Basically, it was too salty, buttery, and lacked the finesse that such a high-end restaurant should have.

We got a variety of meat and vegetable dishes. The meat was very good. But the vegetable dishes - potatoes au gratin and mushrooms - were very mediocre, too fatty and salty, and lumped in such a big quantity in big dish, slightly unappealing. No elegance.

The deserts were also extremely mediocre. We got the key lime and the chocolate mousse. The key lime had a huge crust... the chocolate mousse didn't taste interesting... it felt basic.

Also, I didn't like the fact that the waiter pushed the most expensive wine first, then the next expensive one... it was a bit obvious.

This is not a place I'd come back to. If the prices were half of what they are, I might, but at this value, it doesn't seem worth it to me. I guess what I'm saying is, it should be priced at half the price it is. That would be fair.
Had dinner Saturday night, very good food and service. Perfect meal.

Food was awesome. Calamari was some of the best I've ever had. I had the 8oz Filet and it was cooked perfectly. The service is top notch which you would expect from a fancy steakhouse. The must try is the Creme Brûlée.  If you dont mind shelling out the money then you should definitely try this place out
Great atmosphere, wonderful service & the food was a hit! We had filet, lobster, wine and salads. The steak was cooked perfectly and just melted in your mouth!

Service was surprisingly rude. We bought a bottle of wine, and when they delivered it with a broken glass, they refused to remedy the situation. We asked for a fresh glass and they demonized us, saying we we re the bad guys. We had basic expectations of service - that they would appreciate our time and money, but Vic's decided that they could treat us how ever they wanted - that our time was not important and that they could treat us however they want. The service was extremely disappointing. I will not recommend the restaurant to others - and I hope others will recognize that Vic's does not care about the quality of their experience and that they give extremely poor service

Seriously the best Tomahawk Steak I have EVER had! Impressed!!! Amazing Lobster too!! Great service!!! Not only is downtown Vegas a must, this place is the best place to eat! Hands down! I come here for business twice a year and now this place is a must every time we visit Vegas!

Just ate here and it was phenomenal. We had seen a prix fixe menu online on the Golden Nugget website and carelessly forgot to print it. Our waiter was super nice and printed it for is and allowed us to order from it. Thanks :)

I had the filet and the husband had the fish of the day (halibut). My filet was perfectly medium rare and the sides, au gratin potatoes, were to die for. For real. I'd die for them. Husband's halibut was a bit dry on top, but the flavor was very good. We also got bread pudding for dessert. Amazeballs. The other two diners we were with enjoyed their meals as well. Lobster bisque is apparently fabulous and the roasted chicken was perfect. 

Go here. Spend the money ($50 for a 3 course, with side, prix fixe). You will not be disappointed.

I consider myself to be a true food snob. I have two business partners who think that I am too picky when we go out to eat. When it comes to fine dining I am more than picky. I do not smoke so I truly can taste my food. Vic and Anthony's was my best experience I have had at any fine dining establishment. I had the 12oz filet and a 3lb Maine lobster which both were perfect. I had the bone marrow to go wiht the steak and again along with the wild mushrooms it was just mouth watering good. My wife thoroughly enjoyed her food too and the service was outstanding. I will be back without a doubt.

I ate at vic and Anthony's last night and had a great experience. I have eaten at several of the top 10 steak houses in the country from berns in Tampa fl. To Peter lugers in NY, and this place is almost as great from the quality of food to the impeccable service . I highly recommend vic and Anthony's if you are in downtown las vegas looking for a great place to eat. I know I will definitely be back

My wife and I had dinner at Vic and Anthony's on Tuesday 11-18-14.  We both had the New York cut Steaks,  They were very good with much flavor to them.  Small suggestion.......trim a little more fat off of the edges.  Price was reasonable for what you get.  The deserts were very good to great.  Wait staff was excellent.  The tables are a little to close (the size of the restaurant is small)
Overall, less expensive then Ramsey's Steakhouse at the Paris or Delmonico's at the Venetian but also not quite as good overall.
The best.  I'm never disappointed when I go here.  Ive been with friends and on a date and it was perfect both times.  Try to find better food and service at this price, I dare you.
Delicious food. I had the sea bass and my husband had the bone in rib-eye.  Fabulous!

I apologize for being late with the review but got a little busy.  First off this has got to be one of the best restaurants I've been to.  The experience was amazing.  You know the workers are attentive when you don't have to asked for a different napkin for your close color.  Our server was Mario. He was awesome.  He knew the food and drink menu very well.  He even had the chef prepare an item that was not offered on the menu that came out wonderful.  The atmosphere was great. It was an awesome evening and experience.  I'll be back and recommend anyone to try them out.

There's something special about steakhouse's located in Downtown Las Vegas. My husband and I came here for a romantic date night. We'd heard so much about the service and food and the restaurant lived up to the hype! 

FOOD & DRINKS: We had the Bone Marrow w/ bruschetta, which is a phenomenal dish. However, it is heavy. I was only about to eat about half the bone marrow before I was ready to move on to something lighter. My two favorite dishes was the Jumbo Lump Crab Cake and Steak tartare, which was both the best I've ever had! I would come back to just eat both dishes all day. The crab cake was juicy, meaty and the sauce really made it a well-rounded appetizer. The steak tartare was unique and different. The rare steak went well with the chips and whole grain mustard. It's served on top of a Himalayan Salt Block too! The steak was tasty and cooked well. 

SERVICE: Excellent service, but they did seat us near the entrance so it was a little noisy and we were hit a few times by the traffic coming in and out of the entrance. 

AMBIANCE: Typical steakhouse that is dark and busy with a lot of fun conversations happening around us, which I absolutely love!

PRICE: Great value for what we received. The dishes were unique, the presentation was pretty and the service was great. 

Overall, I give this place a 4 out of 5. I would definitely come back again. :-) 

Happy DIning, 

J Tran

I had rib eye with loaded baked potato.  My partner had surf n turf.  She said it was fantastic.  My steak was perfectly cooked and so flavorful.  My potato was the best potato i every had.  Creamy. .. delicious.  Drinks were excellent.  I have an allergy to crab so they were very careful about that. 
For dessert we split a pecan ball, which is ice cream rolled in pecans.  This was just ok. 

Highly recommend this place.  So so so good!

Enjoyable old school atmosphere with an excellent bourbon and whiskey menu which even included pappy van winkle. The steaks were done well and the sides and appetizers were excellent. I was disappointed with the lamb as the sauce was too over powering. All and all a good place for dinner with good service and a reasonable price for a steak house in Vegas.

LV Steak House with bad L.A. Attitude!

I would have given this place a higher rating if it weren't for the AWFUL service  and SNOBBISH attitude we received from the blonde hostess when we walked in!  If I wanted to be treated terribly, I would have stayed home and dined at "Mastro's" in Beverly Hills.  Take my advice guys, dine else where!  There are plenty of better steak houses in LV that will treat you like a human being!  

I have always wanted to try this steak house but always dine across the street at Binion's Ranch.  But this trip I had a party of 5 that I needed to entertain and they have all been to Binion's, so we decided to try a new place and Vic & Anthony's was the choice.  I booked the dinner reservation about a month in advance for a WEDNESDAY night when I knew they would NOT be busy, however when I arrived EARLY for our reservation, I was immediately greeted by a RUDE, OBNOXIOUS, SNOBBISH, L.A. wanna be little blonde starlet who treated me awful and refused to give me any service or grant me the option to seat us at a comfortable round table!  Her response?.....oh, sorry sir, the round tables are RESERVED!  We can only seat you where we can seat you!  (This was coming out of her mouth at 7:30pm on a Wednesday night with a total of 2 parties dining in the entire restaurant and probably only 5 reservations for that night!  What a joke) and by the way, the round tables were available the ENTIRE NIGHT we were there!  4 hours and $860.00 later, I left Vic & Anthony's with a bitter taste in my mouth but not from the meal, it was from the blonde hostess who's unwelcoming attitude will assure that I never return to this restaurant and discourage others from dining here as well.  

The Bottom Line:
Awful rude service from the front, an extra salty steak that isn't great (but good), but surprisingly; probably one of the best Veal cuts one could ever taste! 
"Try the Veal, it's one of the best in the city" - Godfather

Enjoy!

Delicious dinner. $205 later and the food was the best we had so far during our stay here. 

For appetizers, my spouse ordered cold shrimp and crab martini while I had the lobster bisque. For dinner he ordered a prime rib steak with asparagus and au gratin potatoes. I had shrimp pasta. We paired all of this with a bottle of white wine. 

Sounds crazy that we went $205 on food when we can get this anywhere else for cheaper, but it was the best food so far since we've been here. The service was excellent. Our waiter I believe his name was Mario kept checking in on us, laughed with us, and congratulated us on our engagement.

Fabulous dinner!  Excellent service.  Lovely old school steak house ambiance.  We had a reservation, so waited only about 4 minutes for our table.  Both had steak, shared a baked potato and asparagus - delish!  Will definitely dine here again on my next Vegas visit.

My wife and I ate there to celebrate her birthday, although a little early. Stopped by around 2PM to make a reservation and the girl seemed to be bothered by the request. The first thing that put me off was the fact that most people were wearing jeans and t-shirts, a few had shorts. When I am spending $300 on a special occasion I like to dress up a little, if I wanted to sit next to loud and drunk people in jeans and sneakers I could have saved over $200. Service was very good but not perfect, plates stayed on our table for 10 minutes after we were done. Filet mignon was the best I ever had while the rib-eye was ok, lots of fat and one side was very tough. Both meat dishes were done as we ordered. Quail appetizer was sublime, I would like to see them try this with duck or pheasant. Asparagus side was very good while the scalloped potatoes were very very rich, enough for 4 people. Creme brulee was good but on a saucer plate and only 1/2 deep. Espresso was the worst I have ever had, looked it was a cafe latte as it was not black. Waiter took it off the bill and said it was a little lite? We will go back for the filets and the quail.

Can't say enough...continues to be the most amazing meal in Vegas! Not to be missed. Its elegant, romantic, and top notch from top to bottom. All of the staff is highly trained to give you a 5 star experience. Everything on the menu is outstanding! Smart, friendly, and well worth your time/$$. Love it more everytime! Thank you Victor and Brian for an amazing anniversary!

Where to start... I searched and searched for a place I could have an excellent dinner with my husband while on vacation. After reading about every Vegas hotspot I found Vic and Anthony's. I perused the menu and realized there was no way I could afford a dinner here. Then after reading my trusty yelpers I saw a review that explained the distinguished menu. 

The distinguished menu is posted on the website and must be printed prior to your arrival. It is only $50/person! It includes your choice of starter. We had the wedge salad and lobster bisque- ahhhhhmazing! Next is your entree, we both chose the 8oz filet which was unbelievable and I really couldn't choose words to explain how wonderful they really were. The meal comes with your choice of sides. Be sure to choose 2 different sides as they are more than enough to share. We chose the au gratin potatoes and creamed spinach. Delicious! After all this, yes, you get dessert included in the special! I had creme brûlée and my husband had the croissant bread pudding. Again, ahhhhhmazing! 

To seal the deal was our waiter. He was attentive and not overbearing. Excellent service and I highly recommend asking for Victor. Easy name to remember given the name of the restaurant!

LOVED it.  Amazing old Vegas atmosphere which you don't find much anymore.  Had the best steak and lobster.  Worth every penny.  Then the red velvet cake.  WOW.  Big enough for 3 and was the best i had ever had.  Don't even think twice about going - just go!

Wonderful dining experience all around.  The  Filet was perfectly prepared.  Creamed corn was to die for but the potatoes were just ok.  Wonderful service from beginning to end.  And let's not forget the desserts!!

We came here because we read the reviews. We got a reservation and we were twenty minutes late. The staff was very friendly, kind and honored our reservation by attending us immediately. The waiter was perfect. We had high expectations from the reviews. My wife is a sea food lover and I love steak. The food didn't meet our expectations at all. We came out very disappointed when the food didn't meet all the great service provided. The lobster bisque was very salty, and the steak was over cooked and dry with very little flavor.

I started off annoyed that they wouldn't seat us on a Tuesday night at 7:30 until all of our party of 6 was there. Generally, that is not the practice in Las Vegas. However, the giant aquarium nearby (with a tube for bathers to slide thru among the sharks) makes for a pretty entertaining place to wait. And, in fairness, once we got seated, it didn't seem like there were empty tables.

Once we were seated the service could not have been better. Our waitress struck the right balance between friendly and intrusively friendly. There were always assistant wait staff to fill water glasses and take plates away. One never had to look for the waitress for help with some item. I liked that our waitress told us the specials and the prices. I don't like to ask what the price is but I do like to know. I was a little annoyed that some of the menu items were "market price."

The complimentary hot bread was not really great; it usually isn't in Las Vegas.

I had the salmon which turned out to be the value meal as well as the allegedly heart healthy one. It was $29 and came on a bed of mashed potatoes, and with three big asparagus spears cooked just right, along with some diced tomatoes and capers.  My wife had the 16 ounce prime rib eye steak at $46 by itself. I had one bite and had to admit that it was delicious. It was rare with a charred surfaces. I avoid charred meat out a concern that it might be unhealthy, but it sure tasted good. She also got a monster $9 baked potato that was shared. 

One of my sons had the $10 roasted beet salad as an appetizer which we passed around. It was impressively good. Another had the pepper crusted tuna which was a generous portion at $36.

I would have preferred slightly softer music. 

It was a tough decision whether to give this a four or five star rating. I think you can expect consistently good service and food, albeit it pricey.

If I could give 6 stars I would. One of my top 3 that I've ever been to in my travels. Portion were much bigger than expected. Filet, gratin potatoes, scallops arwsome. Calamari with carmelized onions best I ever had. Wait staff also the best. An excellent nice surprise!

The ambience and service are top notch. The server was very attentive and provided great suggestions. They offer Kobe steak and Australian lobster tails both for over $175 and $130 respectively. The lamb, steaks, and fish were very tasty and worthy of a top rated steakhouse. The sides were good but nothing spectacular. The creme brûlée was the best I have ever tasted.

Great experience in an old chop house style steak place in the Golden Nugget. Never thought I would say that but if the shoe fits wear it. Quality seems to be very important along with a nice collection of wine offerings.  The Somm in training was knowledgable but I don't bite on the uncharged game as I am pretty comfortable with a wine menu. That being said our group enjoyed our time there and love the huge ice cube.

I just got back from one of my best steak dinners ever.  When I arrived, I was seated on a great table close to the bar where I can sit on one of their cool leather chairs and watch the NFL Draft at the same time.

The decor is totally awesome, a cross between the Capital Grille and Craftsteak.  It is furnished like an old school steakhouse with deep rich cherry woods and leather chairs but with beautiful trendy stained glass ceilings and low mood lighting....very sexy.

I love this type of steakhouse....truly a Frank Sinatra hangout with Suits, Steaks, Whiskey and Cigars.

My meal began with their delicious warm sourdough bread and their incredible lobster bisque.  The bisque was super creamy and spicy....one of the best that I have ever had.

For dinner, I ordered a bone-in rib eye steak and a side of sea salt fries.
The steak was super tender and juicy with the right amount of marbling.
The fries was a perfect side with the great steak.

For desert, I had their famous croissant bread pudding with ice cream and a toffee
stick.....super sweet and good.

Vic and Anthony's is one of the best steak houses that I have been to in the U.S.

The decor and ambience is sexy and romantic.......the service is outstanding.  I felt like a celebrity......the hostess and waitress made me feel as if i was the only customer in  the restauarnt.  The Mgr. came by my table a couple of times to check on me and when I left, they comped my desert and gave me a complimentary glass of cabernet franc to finish my meal.

I came in my pants twice.......it was that good.  No sex needed for a week....I am so satisfied!

I can see why they are a Michelin rated steakhouse and was voted as one of top 10 steakhouses in the country.

I wish there was a V@A in California and NY!

DELISH!!!! Really fantastic meal!!! BF said it was def one of the best steaks he's ever had!!! I had the stuffed salmon it was good... ITS ALOT OF FOOD... the only downside was the waiter reallllly realllly pushes the very expensive wines... but that is his job and he does want a big tip so i understand... everything was fab!!!! all the desserts were great as well!!!!

I visited this place on the recommendation of a colleague.  I dined alone at the bar and everything was excellent.  My only suggestion for improvement is to expand the wine list.  The service was impeccable.  The meal perfect!

Steak so good make you wanna slap yo' momma! Lol no but seriously this place is FANTASTIC! Ate here for the mother's day dinner and I must say that they have some of the BEST customer service I've received from a steakhouse! I originally booked my reservation online on the opentable.com website because of the cool perks of dinning perks! Reservation was for 5:15 PM. We arrived a little early but no problem because we were seated promptly at 5:15! The ambiance in this place is remarkable we were sat upstairs in this more private seating area! What a plus that was because of the privacy and sharing the special Mother's Day occasion. Let's get to the food, oh but before I start let me tell you that the "Mojito 23" drink that they have on the special drink menu is terrible, if you are a regular mojito drinker like myself take my word for it, it's horrible. The main food course we ordered were mainly the Surf & Turf specials which originally came with an 8oz Filet Mignon however my brother and I upgraded our steaks to a 22OZ Bone-In-Ribeye which btw is TO DIE FOR. We added this blue cheese butter to the steak that made it mouthwatering! The lobsters that came with these orders were cooked to perfection and nice with the butter sauce. Sometimes places can over cook the lobster which makes it tough but this defiantly wasn't the case, they nailed this whole entrée! The macaroni and cheese we ordered was horrible, put it like this we could have saved that $8.95 and went to Wal-mart and bought a box of Velveeta that would have been more worthwhile! Pass on that side dish FOR SURE! Over all other than the 2 minuses on the Mojito 23 and the macaroni and cheese I'll give this place a 4.5 stars! Will return for sure!

Went last Sunday with family after a wedding weekend and it was great.  Try the spiced pear martini, it is unique.  Service was outstanding, with the water refills coming constantly and all needs promptly solved.  The steaks were great, with the highlight being the 16 oz Waygu NY Strip.  It was melt-in-your-mouth tender, but you pay serious coin for that pleasure.  The huge lobster tail was fresh and allowed the 7 of us to each get a small portion.  The $50 distinctive dining menu can not be beat.  Highly recommend as a special treat visit, bring your wallet.

I wanted to love this place, I didn't.  Solo dinner, sat at the bar and that was my mistake.  Food was amazing; fillet Oscar, creamed spinach, brussel sprouts, bread pudding.   There were three bartenders behind the bar providing service for five of us.....   I felt completely ignored, to the point I spoke to management.   They don't know they have a problem if no one speaks up.  He knew it was bad.  He talked to me for at least ten minutes, the entire time both my coffee and water were empty and no one did anything!   He finally said something to the bartender, and admitted he was embarrassed and sorry.  I am guessing the dining room is different.  I say again, food was amazing,I will be craving that creamed spinach!

Best steak place I have ever been to. Restaurant was very nice, service was great, filet was perfect, baked potato was out of this world. Only complaint was bad key lime pie. Wasn't fresh, graham cracker crust was hard.

Went there for dinner last night.  It is spot on!!! Great ambiance and food. Bottle of wine, Kobe beef for the bf, steak and lobster for me-$350!! Worth every penny!! Make sure you ask to sit with Victor. Amazing server and nice on the eyes lady's :). Definitely will be back when were back in Vegas!!!

If you happen to be in downtown Las Vegas and find yourself hungry for some of the best steaks in the country, I highly recommend Vic and Anthony's steakhouse.

The food was what you would expect for a top notch steakhouse... the best.  For starters, their lobster bisque and seafood chowders were wonderful.  The pear and blue cheese salad was very good and was large enough to be a meal in itself.

Now to the heart of it all.  The 18 oz. Australian rock lobster tail was amazing.  The meat was sweet and crunchy, but not chewy.  It was so good, I've ordered it twice (and I'm not much of a lobster eater).  The steaks here are some of the best anywhere.  The 24 oz. bone-in ribeye and 18 oz strip were both juicy and flavorful.  The extra marbling really gave these cuts quite a lot of flavor.  Also, everything was cooked as ordered.

It is also worth saving some room for dessert.  The bread pudding here is excellent and comes with a scoop of ice cream.  It goes well with a cup of espresso. 

Service here is excellent.  Servers are both very knowledgeable about every dish and wine selection on the menu, and may even make a suggestion for something that is not on the menu.  They are also very amenable to splitting orders into smaller portions (we had our lobster tail cut into medallions) since the portions are quite large.  Everything arrived as expected and any requests were handled promptly.

The only warning I would give is that every dish here comes in large portions.  You might have to pace yourself to enjoy the full spectrum of what Vic and Anthony's has to offer.

WOW...

I don't give many 5-star ratings. That being said, Vic and Anthony's earned all 5 with ease....

We dined here on our last night in Vegas.  Being from Houston, we were familiar with the Vic and Anthony's brand, as they have a restaurant there.  

We actually stayed in the Golden Nuggett so we wanted to have a good last night dinner somewhere in Downtown Vegas.  We'd already been to Hugo's Cellar before(awesome by the way) and we had heard Binion's Steakhouse was quite good.  

We dropped by Binion's but changed our mind at the last minute and went to Vic and Anthony's instead. In retrospect, this was a excellent decision.  The restaurant is not that spacious however, on the other hand, the coziness provides the dining couples with a much more intimate and romantic experience.  

The waiter was very courteous and immediately wished my wife a happy birthday (earning valuable points) and then guided us through the wine menu and liquor/after-dinner menu.  The wife had a crown and 7.  I had a Makers Mark 46 with a splash of 7.  If you like Bourbon, give Maker's Mark 46 a try.  Both drinks were prompt, cold and stout, just the way they should be.  

We skipped the appetizers altogether and went straight the entrees.  I do hear, however, that the crab cakes are quite good

Because they serve such large portions, we shared a 16 oz. Prime Ribeye cooked to perfection.  As sides, we had the Creamed Corn and Truffle Mashed Potatoes. 
All were wonderfully flavored...

If you order a topping for your steak, I highly reccomend the Port Peppercorn. Have them serve it on the side, instead of on top of the steak. You won't be disappointed.  

For dessert, we shared the flourless Chocolate Cake.  This was quite good but a little too rich for us.  Should have stayed with the tried-and-true Creme Brulee.  

This place was almost as good as Hugo's Cellar in Vegas and Pappas Steakhouse in Houston.....very very close.

If in Vegas, either Hugo's or Vic and Anthony's would be an excellent choice.

The best darn steakhouse ever!!! My husband and I were introduced to this place by his politician friend and everytime we're in Vegas we try to come here. We had the crab cake, lobster bisque, filet w/baked potato, chicken dish (can't remember) and the creme brûlée. Morton's, Flemings, and Ruth's Chris have nothing on this place! Beware though...it's very dark in here. Good for a romantic dinner!

All i can say is WOW! This Place in old Vegas is incredible. I got the filet...perfect. The service is outstanding. Little pricey...but hey, you are in vegas! Rat pack feel. Dim and 40s music playing. Definitely one of the best steak houses I've ever eaten out.
All the food was full of flavor...  Cream corn is the shit...  The risotto kicks ass...  The porterhouse was on point... Service was 10stars...

We love this restaurant!!
All worker is amazing nice and great Service.
We order AustralianWagyu Ribeye it was amazing taste
We had great time at this restaurant
